loans.name: Carmentina Lili

texts.es: Carmentina es comerciante individual, ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa, lociones y enchapes para damas, este producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante en la ciudad, ella tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estan cursando los estudios en la universidad y otra esta cursando el 4 grado de primaria, ella toma la iniciativa de dedicarse a este negocio desde hace 15 años, el que le permite generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia, actualmente ella necesita capital para surtir su negocio ya que la demanda de clientes ha crecido y no  cuenta con el capital suficiente. su mayor deseo es poner su propio local donde los clientes puedan llegar a comprar.
texts.en:
Carmentina is a business woman who sells clothing, lotion and costume jewelry for ladies. She is an itinerant saleswoman and has three children, two of whom are in college and the third is in the fourth grade. Carmentina took the initiative 15 years ago to start this business, which permits her to generate income to support her family. At present she needs capital because her business has undergone a growth spurt, the customer demand has increased, and she does not have sufficient capital. Her greatest desire is to have her own premises where customers can come to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, lotion and costume jewelry

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata K. and Isha K.. They named their group "Success". This will be their third loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a tremendous impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of $325 each.

Aminata K. (right) is the leader of this group of two. Aminata was born in Moyamba in Southern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-eight years old and a divorcee with one child, who is in class five. Aminata owns a kiosk outside her house where she sells a variety of items. Some of the items she sells include: cigarettes, mints, biscuits, chewing gum, soft drinks, etc. She also sells slippers which she normally hawks around town and in neighboring villages.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ada Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Ada G. tiene 42 años de edad, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo popular, ella antes tenia una chiclera en la cual vendia pero poco y un dia se propuso poner su propia pulperia, con esto ha venido saliendo adelante y esta muy feliz de tener su negocio propio, junto a su esposo han luchado para poder brindarles todo el apoyo a sus hijos y a su hogar, ella esta muy agradedida con todas las personas que le han ayudado en su vida, y ella quiere que su tienda sea mas grande para poder tener una vida mas tranquila con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ada G. is 42. She has a basic goods stores. Before that she had a candy store. She sold very little, and one day she proposed setting up her own mini market. This has been going well, and she is very happy to have her own business. Together with her husband they have fought to be able to offer their support to their children and their home. She is very grateful to all of the people that have helped her in her life. She wants her store to be bigger to be able to have a more tranquil life with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soup, butter, soft drinks, salt, coffee, bread, crackers, oil, corn, canned goods, toilet paper, churros, beans, rice,sugar, powdered milk, chilies, sardines, spices, pills

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista Pérez tiene la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Juan tiene 2 hijos yo todos estudian. La actividad económica es zapatero. Don Juan inicio este negocio desde muy pequeño, lo cual le ha permitido obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos, actualmente la ubicación  de su negocio es en el mercado central. Los propósitos de Juan con su negocio son de brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio que pueden tener. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar productos como pega, clavos, hilo nylon entre otros todo esto es para materia prima. Los sueños de Juan son de continuar mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista Pérez is a 62-year-old married father of 2 school age children. He is a shoemaker. He started this business at a young age, and it has allowed him to earn a living so that he can support his children. His business is currently located in the central market. Juan’s business goal is to offer the best customer service possible. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase glue, nails, nylon thread and other materials. Juan dreams of continuing to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: German

texts.es: La señor German es chofer propietario, y esta inscrito en el sindicato Arco Iris, su negocio es sacrificado porque el tiene que trabajar desde las primeras horas de el dia hasta muy tarde solo asi puede tener una ganancia significativa, su dia de descanso son los dias miercoles, ese dia  no puede entrar al centro de la ciudad. Su esposa se dedica a la costura y la vende en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto en el departamento de La Paz; ellos tienen dos hijos que colaboran a su madre en la elaboracion de ropa y al mismo tiempo estudian, el cliente ya ha trabajado varios años en la institucion por lo cual es considerado un cliente antiguo y puntual, el destino del credito es para la reparacion de la movilidad para que trabaje sin dar ninguna molestia.
texts.en:
Señor German is an independent driver and a member of the Arco Iris trade union. His business requires great sacrifice in order to succeed, which means working very early hours of the day until late in the evening. He takes Wednesdays off, since he is not required to travel to the city center on those days.

His wife is a seamstress and sells her goods at the “16 de Julio” (July 16th) market in the city of El Alto in the La Paz district. He has two children who help with his wife’s clothing business and attend school at the same time. Señor German is a reliable long-time client who has worked with Emprender for several years. His loan will be used to repair his vehicle so that he can continue to work without any hassles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: La joven Fátima de Jesús G., tiene la edad de 26 años, tiene una hija que cursa la primaria, su esposo es mecánico y reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua. Tiene una comidería que desde hace ocho años administra, este negocio lo inicio con prestamos y ayuda de su esposo. Con este préstamo lo quiere invertir en granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos y otros de consumo diario para sus clientes. Lo cual espera incrementar las ventas para tener mejores ganancias y poder ahorrar para que sus pequeña pueda tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Fátima de Jesús G. is 26 years old and has a daughter in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic and lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has an eatery that she has been managing for eight years. She started the business with loans and the help of her husband. With this loan, she wants to invest in staple grains, meats, dairy products and other daily use items for her customers. She hopes to increase sales to have better profits and to be able to save so that her daughter can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, meats, and other products to prepare delicious dishes.

loans.name: Yao Mawuko

texts.fr: Yao Mawuko A. est un homme de 44 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. il est revendeur de produits pharmaceutiques génériques depuis 2 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit louer un magasin et l’approvisionner de nouveaux produits afin de mieux satisfaire à la demande de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao Mawuko A., age 44, is married and the father of 5 children. He's been reselling generic pharmaceutical drugs for 2 years. He wishes to use this loan to rent a shop and supply it with new products, in order to better meet customer demand. He counts on this opportunity to improve the standard of living of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a shop and supply it with pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila C. is from the town of Pana-on. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lucila owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Lucila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vuy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuy B., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Soth, age 29, live in a small village along National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2007 and have a newborn child.
 
Vuy has been a fisherman since he was married. He fishes from the lake nearby his village and his wife sells the fish at Prek Phnao market. He doesn’t have all the supplies to efficiently operate the fishing business, so he is requesting his first loan of $700 to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a boat engine and fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Maria Gudela

texts.es:
La señora María Gudela P. O. es socia del banco Comunal  El Paraíso, María vive en El Amarillo, comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Cumbe en la ciudad de Cuenca, ella tiene 61 años  y está casada,  concibió 3 hijos de 41, 30, 27 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran casados y uno de ellos está en el extranjero, vive en casa propia que la construyo junto a su esposo cuando estaba con salud, su esposo tuvo un accidente de tránsito y se fracturo la pierna en dos partes y ahora ya no puede trabajar.

María Gudela tiene un negocio de ganado vacuno los compra pequeños para tenerlos un tiempo los alimenta y los vende, también compra ganado grande para la venta entre la semana que hay ferias, nos cuenta que ahora casi solo sale para la comida por que no existe mucha ganancia.

Ella trabaja con la fundación hace cinco años y es una de las socias fundadoras de su bankito comunal. Los préstamos anteriores le han ayudado para la compra de su ganado y también para la compra de medicamento para su esposo.

Con el préstamo solicitado a  la fundación va  a comprar más ganado para seguir incrementando su corral de animales; así como tambien la compra de vitaminas y comida para su crecimiento.

El  sueño de María Gudela es que la fundación le siga apoyando con los créditos para tener un mejor nivel de vida para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the El Paraíso Village Bank and lives in the El Amarillo community of Cuenca city. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children ages 41, 30, and 27. All of them are married and one lives abroad. She lives in her own house that she constructed with her husband back when he was healthy, before he suffered a road accident resulting in a leg fracture in two places and prohibiting him from working.

María has a cattle business involving the purchase of small cattle, which she feeds and then sells. She also buys larger cattle to sell during the week of fairs.

She has been working with the foundation for five years and is one of the founding members of her community bank. Her former loans have helped her buy cattle and also medicine for her husband.

With the loan she requests she will buy more cattle to continue increasing her corral of animals; she will also buy vitamins and food for their growth.

María’s dream is for the foundation to keep supporting her with loans so that she can increase the quality of life for her and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle, food, and vitamins

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Comercializar vidrios, repuestos, vender comida, hacer tejidos y tostar habas son los negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo San Luís que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani. Es el caso de Martha Q. de 29 años, esposa y madre de una niña, muy temprano se levanta para hacer las laboras de su casa, para luego empezar a hacer su trabajo como es el tostar habas. Ella compra haba, los más grandes, luego los remoja con bicarbonato, para luego tostarlos y por último embolsarlo. Cuando ya tiene suficientes paquetes de haba, los fines de semana reparte a diferentes puestos y tiendas, este producto es muy consumido por los niños escolares. En esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar haba en mayores cantidades y seguir operando en su negocio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también necesitan del préstamo e invertir en sus negocios, comprando mercadería. Su presidenta Alicia C., indica que les gusta
texts.en:
Selling glass, replacements, food, weaving fabric and toasting beans are the businesses that the members of the San Luís group - part of Centro Focal Collpani- are dedicated to. Martha Q., who is 29 years old, a wife and mother of a girl, wakes up very early to do the chores in her home to later do her work toasting beans. She buys beans, the largest ones, covers them in baking soda, to later toast them and then finally bag them. When she has enough bean packages, on the weekends she delivers to several shops and stores; this is a product that is purchased by many school children. This time she needs the loan to purchase larger quantities of beans and to keep operating her business. The rest of the members of the group also need the loan to invest in their businesses, purchasing merchandise. Their president is Alicia C..

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This is the client’s fourth loan from the microfinance institution. The loan is to buy inventory for his electronics shop: DVD players and DVDs. The client has a good repayment history with the microfinance institution. He is timely and punctual. He has been able to generate good income with the help from the previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia D. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 53 years old. Nelia is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to start a new business. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kavita

texts.en:
Mrs. Kavita A. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Dipendra A., is an electrician. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 3 and daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. Kavita A. owns a cow and sells cow’s milk in her neighborhood. She carries milk containers and sells door-to-door every day in the morning and evening. To meet the increasing demand of her customers, she is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es parte del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desD. hace 1 año atrás, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores.
Victoria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrà comprar cuyes y gallinas para D. esa manera aumentar su negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave. 
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria has been a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank for a year. She lives in the District of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. Victoria is 50 years old, married, and has 8 children of whom 4 still live with her. She completed her elementary school education and trades small animals for a living.

Victoria tells us that she requested her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 500 soles so that she could increase her capital. She is now requesting another loan for 1500 soles in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens so that she can expand her business.

Victoria’s dream for the future is have her own house in Ilave. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs & chickens

loans.name: Ideal Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ideal lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, independientes y con deseo de auto superarse. Una de ellas es Telma Rafaela G. F. de 60 años de los cuales la mitad de su vida los ha dedicado a vender frutas y verduras que junto con su esposo cultivan en una pequeña huerta.

Según G. el éxito de su negocio es trabajo arduo en conjunto, el amor que le tiene y la dedicación sin estos tres componentes ningún negocio prospera. 

Irene del Carmen G. de 39 años se dedica a vender ropa típica como cotonas, guayaberas, camisones y trajes de baile. Ella inicio con pocos recursos según comenta tan solo tenia dos variedades de estilo en cotonas  pero con el tiempo, el esfuerzo  y el trabajo arduo fue creciendo y prosperando.

 La otra integrante es Ivania del Carmen A. de 28 años quien desde hace tres años se gana la vida  vendiendo granos básicos.
texts.en:
The Ideal group is comprised of three hard-working and independent women who have the desire for self-improvement. Telma Rafaela G. F., 60, is one of them. She has spent half of her life selling fruits and vegetables that she and her husband grow in their small garden. According to G., the success of her business is working hard together, love for the land, and dedication. Without these three components, no business will prosper. Irene del Carmen G. is 39. She sells typical clothes like shirts, “guayaberas” (lightweight men's shirts with pockets and sometimes embroidery), nightgowns, and dance outfits. She started with few resources, she comments, with only two styles of shirts. With time, effort, and hard work her business was growing and prospering. Ivania del Carmen A. is the other member. She is 28. For the last three years she has been earning a living by selling basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crops

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita G. is from the village of P-9, Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is married and has four school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business selling a variety of soft drinks in the local community. She also has a videoke business that provides "sing along" services to the public. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alamhon

texts.ru: Шарипов Аламхон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шарипов Аламхон имеет среднее образование. В области торговли более 11 лет. Шарипов Аламхон продает женскую и детскую одежду. В этом ему помагает жена. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alamhon S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 children. Alamhon has a secondary education. He has been working in the retail sales field for over 11 years. Alamhon sells women's and children's clothing. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old and married to Antonio Portillo. They have two children together. The couple lives a stone's throw from the center of town, where they have owned a corner store for more than 15 years. Carmen provides her clients with all types of basic food products, such as sugar, yerba mate, charcoal, dairy, soft drinks, noodles and deli meats. 

Carmen's daughter runs the store while she goes to downtown Itá or to San Lorezo to purchase her merchandise. Carmen has an established client base and has a cash-only business. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2008 and has made all of her repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, yerba mate and other food products

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: El señor R. U., es de oficio transportista, cuenta con un camión en el cual traslada materiales de construcción, brindando servicio de forma particular al que lo necesite, sus hijos son mayores de edad, pero tiene a su cuido dos nietos que está educando, con este préstamo construirá un muro en el patio de su casa, para darle seguridad a su familia. Con los prestamos que anteriormente ha solicitado viene realizando mejora a su casa y con el servicio de transporte viene realizando sus abonos.
texts.en:
Sr. R. U. is a truck driver who has his own vehicle for hauling construction materials. He provides this particular service to anyone who needs it. His children are grown, but they are taking care of and paying for the education of his two grandchildren.

With this loan, he will build a wall in his backyard in order to provide his family with security. His previous loans have been used to make improvements to his house. With the income he generates from providing transport services, Carlos is able to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall in his backyard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his market garden, buying manure and other supplies

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a 36-year-old married woman living in Illuppalla, Akurassa in southern Sri Lanka with her husband and child. 

Renuka has been managing her business, which consists of cultivating tea.  She devotes her full effort towards cultivating her tea plants, and uses the income to help support herself and her family.  Her husband also provides her with good help.  

She has managed her tea cultivation for ten years. She works hard in her business, and enjoys good land upon which to grow her tea.  

Renuka has asked for a 20,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand the land for cultivation and to purchase chemicals for her tea plants. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for her tea plants and expand her plot of land

loans.name: Phou

texts.en: Phou R., 28, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells porridge and boiled rice for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband provides money exchange services and sells gold, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to expand her husband’s businesses. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R. is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To expand the money exchange business

loans.name: Segundo Gerardo

texts.es:
Segundo Gerardo M. C. tiene 27 años, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos que se llaman: Samid de 5 años, Shelmy de 6 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba ubicado a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, trigo, cebada.   Vende los productos en el cantón San Miguel.
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes e insumos químicos  para sus cultivos.  Su meta es construir una casa y mejorar la situación económica. Los desafíos que enfrentan son los cambios climáticos que pueden perjudicar sus sembrios. Segundo  manifiesta que solicitó antes un crédito y lo utilizo para pagar a los peones de los trabajos de agricultura realizados. Segundo manifiesta que en  su comunidad festejan las fiestas del carnaval y los jueves sale a la feria a San Miguel.
texts.en:
Segundo is 27 years old, single, and has two children called Samid (who is 5 years old) and Shelmy (who is 6). They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, located an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel in Bolivar province. Segundo is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumi Pamba", which is composed of 25 members in total, of whom the majority are farmers. Segundo works in agriculture. Among the most outstanding crops of his area are corn, wheat, and barley. He sells his produce in the town of San Miguel. Segundo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and chemical inputs for his crops. His goals are to build a house and improve his economic situation. One of the challenges he faces is that climate changes could hurt his crops. Segundo says that he previously requested a loan and used it to pay laborers for agricultural work they had done. He says that in his community they celebrate carnival and that on Thursdays he goes out to the San Miguel fair.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and chemical inputs for his crops

loans.name: Badoussi

texts.fr: Née en Janvier 1960 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, A. Badoussi est une veuve ayant à sa charge deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont ses enfants. Badoussi vit donc seule avec ses enfants au quartier Ahito à Allada, depuis quatre ans. C'est Badoussi seule qui s'occupe donc des différentes charges de la famille. Badoussi n'est jamais allée à l'école. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Badoussi mène comme activité la vente de tissus au marché de Allada. Badoussi s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis quatre ans déjà que Badoussi mène cette activité, et Badoussi a obtenu une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé. La clientèle de Badoussi devient de plus en plus nombreuse. Afin de mieux les satisfaire et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Badoussi sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in January 1960 in Allada, in the Atlantique province, A. Badoussi is a widow raising two children, both enrolled in school and both her biological children. She has been living alone with her children in the Ahito neighborhood in Allada, for four years. She is the sole breadwinner for the family. Badoussi never attended school. To support herself, she sells cloth in the market of Allada. She buys her inventory in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She has been in this business for four years already and has received one loan from ALIDé. Her clientele has become ever more numerous and so as to satisfy their needs and increase her sales, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 13 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 41-year-old motorcycle “boda boda” driver.  "Boda bodas" are privately owned motorcycles used extensively throughout Kenya for public transportation. Boda boda drivers pick up and drop off pay-as-you-go passengers as a motorcycle taxi.  Emmanuel operates from the municipal business center, where there is a constant flow of customers, and he has been in this business for 1 year.  

Emmanuel is married and has 4 children, 3 boys and 1 girl, from 8 to 15 years old. The primary business challenges he faces are stiff competition from competitors with more than one motorcycle plus regular breakdowns of his motorbike.   His wife is a tailor/dressmaker, a business Emmanuel was involved in before driving his motorcycle.

Emmanuel plans to use the 60,000 Kenyan Shilling loan to purchase a second motorcycle.  He has successfully repaid three previous loans of 20,000, 40,000, and 60,000 Shillings.

In the future, Emmanuel hopes to buy his own land and build a home.  In 5 years, he dreams of having at least five motorcycles operating as boda bodas and being involved in the taxi business.

He describes himself as hard-working, humble, and humorous.

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle

loans.name: Olivier Fabrice Guichard

texts.fr:
Jeune coiffeur de 29 ans , celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 ans et 3 mois, il ouvre son salon de coiffure homme  en 2003 apres avoir arreter ses etudes  en classe de premiere par manque de soutien.
Il a des nombreux clients dans le quartier, des enfants et des adultes, ses recettes varient entre 10000frs a 15000 frs par jour. 
Avec l'octroi de son pret, il compte acheter  deux tondeuses electriques, deux tondeuses manuels, les lames rasoirs, des produits cosmetiques, des mousses a raser,de l'alcool et de la poudre.
Il a des grandes ambitions , se faire un nom en faisant connaitre son salon par la qualite de ses services et ouvrir un autre salon avec le temps.
Il pense avec le temps epargner au fur et a mesure , ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille et etre un grand homme d'affaire.
texts.en:
This young 29-year old hairdresser is the single parent of two children, a 5-year old and a 3-month old. He opened his barbershop in 2003 after having to quit primary school for lack of support. He has many customers in the neighborhood, including both children and adults. His revenues range from 10,000 to 15,000 francs per day. With the loan, he intends to buy two electric clippers, two manual ones, razor blades, cosmetics, shaving foams, some alcohol and some powder. He has great ambitions. He hopes that the quality of his services will help him make a name for himself and eventually open another salon. Over time, he plans to save his money, improve the living conditions of his family, and become a successful businessman.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two electric clippers, razor blades, and cosmetics

loans.name: Shakooran's Group

texts.en:
Shakooran lives in three room brick house in the city called Borewala in Pakistan. She is a widow and one of her sons earns income to support the family. He is the only breadwinner after his father. He owns & operates a food stand where he keeps the food such as (Nan Chanay and Payay) which people love to eat in breakfast. Shakooran helps him with cooking these items so that he can start selling them early in the morning. 

Shakooran wants to help her son in expanding his business because he is working very hard for his family. Shakooran is applying for a loan for her son who will buy food items such as chick peas, cooking oil and spices in bulk for his stall.

Shakooran is a second year member of Asasah, has successfully repaid her first loan and has a good record of repayment. With her first loan her son started his food stand and now with the loan amount he will increase his sales.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his food stand

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and two children. Ali has owned a grocery shop since 2008 with 4 years of experience.  Ali sells fruits and vegetables, and he exudes the qualities of a responsible and friendly person. A constant flow of tourists visit his shop and the environment is very animated in the mornings when house wives meet in his shop to get their daily food needs. Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to add more shelves and stands to show the wide variety of goods he has, in addition to a front display refrigerator to show and keep the fruits fresh as long as he can. He would like to develop his work in the future through purchasing sodas, rice, sugar and other products.

loans.use: To add more shelves and stands.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.en:
Rosa Elvira M. S. is 58 years old. She is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 5 children who are 36, 35, 34, 32, and 14 years old. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of 15 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Rosa works in the agricultural sector and earns on average $130 per month. She buys and sells her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Rosa hopes to be able to produce more crops with the help of this loan. Her dreams are to keep improving and expanding in agricultural production and to provide her children with a good education. She says that there is a lot of competition among the farmers in her area, and she hopes that the credit helps her remain competative in the sale of her crops. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and do domestic chores.

loans.use: to produce more crops

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Blandón es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña en el cargo de cocina en el Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria de dicho municipio donde tiene cuatro años de laborar para dicho centro. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cinco créditos consecutivos para gastos de su hogar. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de una refrigeradora y un televisor con el objetivo de amueblar su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blandón is from the municipality "El Sauce." She is a cook in the school "Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria" which is located in the same municipality. She has been doing this job for four years. She has also worked with Ceprodel for four years, where she has been given five consecutive loans for household expenses. She is taking out this loan to buy a refridgerator and a television in order to furnish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To a refridgerator and a television.

loans.name: Letresita

texts.en:
Letresita C. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Bal-os, Basay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  General Store, Ready-to-Wear Clothes and Food Vending businesses.  Her husband, Novelito C., who is 45 years old, works as a Security Guard to earn his living. They have three children who are between the ages of 12 and 19. 

Letresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $140, thus raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 8th cycle cycle loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase new products for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future and send her children to school. Letresita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Rita Soraya

texts.es: La señora C. N. elabora cosa de horno (es una repostería) que la comercializa en la zona de Nindirí con este negocio ha podido sobrevivir y salir adelante en conjunto con su esposo y su hija la cual es menor de edad, posee una experiencia en esta actividad de 5 años, ha logrado construir poco a poco su casa ya que anteriormente era de tabla y ahora la está haciendo de concreto, se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para mejora de vivienda ya que quiere comprar laminas de zinc, hierro de 3/8, cemento, perlines, golosos, anticorrosivo y zener, para así vivir bien con su familia y no mojarse en la temporada de invierno.
texts.en: Ms. C. N. owns a confectioner’s shop where she prepares “Cosas de Horno” (a typical Nicaraguan pastry) that she then sells in the Nindirí area. Thanks to this activity she has succeeded in surviving and getting by together with her husband and their young daughter. She has been engaging in her activity for 5 years, and little by little she has succeeded in building her house: previously made of planks, she is now having g it rebuilt in concrete. She asked CEPRODEL for a loan she will use to make improvements to her house: she wants to buy zinc sheets, iron bars with a 3.8” diameter, cement, purlins, screws, antirust and paint thinner in order to live well with her family and avoid getting wet during the winter.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Thanh H. N. has 2 children who are at secondary school. He opened a fresh fruit shop in 2008 after he received his first loan from our credit program. His business is running quite well. Every month he earns 3,500,000 VND profit. It is a stabL. income which he can use to manage his family life and to pay for his children's school fees. Since joining our program, he has been a good group leader. Currently, he wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to invest in his shop.

Hanh T. L. is 28 years old and has 2 children who are at elementary school. She is managing a grocery shop in the local market. Currently, she wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more products for her shop.
Hien T. N. is 36 years old and has 3 children who are attending high school and secondary school. She has a shop that sells aquatic products in Kim market. Now, she needs a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.
Nhung T. N. is 42 years old and has 2 children. She is a farmer and is raising 5 pigs for meat. She wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to invest in his shop

loans.name: Dalila De Fátima

texts.es: La Sra. Dalila de Fátima E. E. ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de lotería y raspadita ella vende ambulante, tiene quince años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les vende las raspaditas y loterías, es casada actualmente y  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y   cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de lotería y raspadita para ampliarle a su negocio y poder abastecer a sus clientes, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Dalila de Fátima E. E. sells lottery and scratch-off tickets as a walking vendor. She has been working in this business for 15 years. She already has customers to whom she sells the scratch-off and lottery tickets. She is married and has a son of school age. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and she has taken out each one to purchase lottery and scratch-off tickets to increase her business and be able to supply her customers. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly since in this way she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Buy lottery and scratch-off tickets to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James M. is 28 years old and married. His wife stays at home to take care of household chores while James goes out every day to provide for his family. They have one child aged 3 years old whom they hope to educate to university level. James has been running a studio and selling picture frames to local people for three years. His business is located in Mwingi and he is served by SMEP's Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. James says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more picture frames to sell. In the future, he hopes to diversify to a retail shop. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy picture frames

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny Marisol C. C. tiene 32 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Jenny se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 10 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Jenny Marisol C. C. is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. They have 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C. “UNIDOS SOMOS MAS” {Together We Are More] are in the area El Maranon, near the Puerto Pechiche parish part of Pueblo Viejo Canton. This service point is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Jenny has grown corn, rice and beans for ten years. She buys her supplies in Comercial Lopez in Ventanas y sells her products in the market of Ventanas in the area of Maranon. 

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. It will provide economic support to her household. They face challenges like plagues, illnesses and weather changes. She likes sports, and her dream is to provide for her children's schooling and to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Elimelich

texts.en:
Elimelich is a 34 year old tailor married to Catherine, 30 years old, who is also a tailor. They are blessed with one child who is five years old. Elimelich has been in the tailoring business for the last five years which has enabled him to identify his potential clients and fast moving types of clothes. With the combined efforts from his wife, he is likely to succeed because of a division of labor whereby each can specialize in what he/she is good at. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to hire extra staff so as to boost his production and increase his income.

His future aspiration is to own a clothing company.

loans.use: Add stock to his tailoring business

loans.name: Reina Idalia

texts.es:
Reina, es una joven de 20 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, ella está casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, negocio que inicio para obtener una fuente de ingreso y poder dar a apoyo a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, no tiene horario fijo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo ya que no tienen fondos para invertir en la compra de cerdos, pero con esta ayuda espera aumentar el número de cerdos en su pequeña granja, de esta manera continuara dedicándose a este oficio y generando ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia.
Su deseo es crecer, ampliar su granja, comercializar los cerdos a buen precio y ayudar a sus hijos en la educación para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Reina is a young woman of 20 and lives in Santa Elena, in Usulután department.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children aged 8, 5 and 3.  Her business is raising pigs, a business that she started in order to have a source of income so that she could support her husband with their household expenses.  She does not work regular hours.

Reina is currently requesting a loan because she doesn't have enough money to invest in buying pigs.  With this help, she is hoping to increase the number of pigs on her small farm.  In this way, she hopes to continue working in this business, making income to support her family on a daily basis.  Her wish is to grow and expand her farm, to sell her pigs for a good price and to help her children with their education so that they can improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Lelita is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Lelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Lelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and instant noodles. This will be the second loan taken out by Lelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & instant noodles

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa D. habite à Camberene depuis plusieurs années. C’est dans le secteur de l’élevage de moutons qu’il évolue depuis prés de 50 ans. Il est sociétaire au guichet de Camberene depuis octobre 2003. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acheter quelques moutons qui seront prévus pour la vente. L’objectif de Monsieur D. est de développer son activité et renforcer ses revenus afin  d’’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D. has been living in Camberene for many years. He has been involved in sheep breeding for nearly 50 years. He became a member of the Camberene branch in October 2003. 

He is seeking a 200,000F loan to buy a few sheep for resale. His goal is to expand his business and bolster his income in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, donde vive con sus hijos de 18, 17, 9 y 8 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia y sus hijos actualmente estudian, María sostiene el hogar a través de un negocio que administra de comida y antojitos, este negocio surge por iniciativa propia hace 10 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para mejorar la vivienda,  específicamente necesita fraguar y encementar el piso de la cocina, para ello necesita comprar cemento y arena, que hasta el momento no ha comprado por falta de liquidez, este préstamo le dará el apoyo para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos el estudio necesario y estos obtengan un titulo con el que se puedan defender en un futuro.
texts.en:
María, age 37, lives in the Arambala department of Morazán.  She lives with her children; ages 18, 17, 9, and 8.  She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house.  Her children currently go to school.

María supports her household through the food and snack business that she runs.  This business emerged through her own initiative ten years ago.

She is currently requesting a loan to improve her house.  She needs to set and cement the kitchen floor.  However, she needs to buy the cement and sand.  Up until now she has not purchased those items because of her lack of liquidity.  This loan will give her the support to improve the condition of her home.

Her dreams are to give her children the necessary education, and that they get a degree so that they can use it to fend for themselves in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
A. Ikromjon is 30 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Ikromjon makes his living raising cattle. He's the kind of man who works hard to provide for his family. Every day, from very early in the morning he tends to his cattle, feeding them and milking the cows. 

Currently, Ikromjon needs to buy young cattle to continue his business and, in turn, maintain his humble household. With your help, this young and energetic man can achieve his goals.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Helping other people is an immense goal. Nelson G., age 45 and unmarried, is willing to take on that goal even as he lives out the spirit of entrepreneurship. Nelson reached college level in his education and is now pursuing his own business. One way in in which he helps is offering financial support to a family member. He has lived in Silang, Cavite, for five years. During that time, Nelson has operated a pig raising business and a farm. He is adept at raising healthy pigs to offer for for sale and has a true green thumb when it comes to producing quality crops. He is well aware of the techniques and the seasons involving these agricultural small-scale businesses, and this level of experience allows him to earn Php 6,000 every month. Nelson employs one person to help him with the routine tasks of the business.

To help him grow his business, he is applying for a Php 40,000 loan. He will purchase pig feed and fertilizer for his farm with this money. Also, he plans to take measures to maintain the condition of his farm. His business requires real effort, and the loan will be a great help toward sustaining his business.

The decrease in the production of piglets in his piggery has recently greatly affected his business. But rather than focusing on his loss, Nelson aspires toward raising thirty productive sows in a set span of time. Greater than this business goal is his overarching aim of being able to serve the Lord in whatever he does, which leads eventually to serving others for His name’s sake. Nelson also dreams of going abroad to work someday.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with 2 children. She is 28 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for 2 years. Riza sells items like sugar, noodles and canned goods. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP per month. Riza's husband is a fisherman. She helps him sell his catch at the market.

Riza is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods. Riza hopes her business will grow. She also wishes that her children would go to a university some day.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Donya

texts.ar: دنيا عمرها 24 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الهواتف وخطوط التعبئة والاكسسوار للهواتف النقالة لها في عملها سنتين تحب عملها وهي مثابرة وطموحة تسعى الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها فهي تساعد العائلة ماديا فهي مثابرة وطموحة تعمل بجد ونشاط تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعةالى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المصلحة بشراء خطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وكومبيوتر نقال للعمل
texts.en: Donya is 24 years old and single. She works selling mobile phones, mobile phone lines and mobile phone accessories. She has two years of experience in her line of work. She likes her work, and she is dilligent and ambitious in her work. She is trying to improve the financial and social position of both herself and her family, seeing as she is a contributer to her family's income. It is because she wants to help her family that she is so diligent and ambitious in her work, and it is for the same reason that she works very hard. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Donya would like to buy goods for her business, including mobile phone lines and a laptop computer.

loans.use: to purchase goods and supplies for her mobile phone store such as mobile phone lines and a laptop computer.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 32 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su esposo en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 2 años tiene un restaurante, en donde se asocio con su madre, quien se encarga de la atención de los clientes y ambos preparan comida de manera diaria y su trabajo comienza desde las primeras horas del día con las compras de los ingredientes perecibles como carne y verduras ya que estos tienen que ser frescos. La buena sazón de su socia es una gran fortaleza de su negocio ya que asegura la permanencia de sus clientes en su consumo y le genera las ganancias necesarias que cubre todo lo que ha invertido y para los próximos meses  procurará el mejoramiento de su negocio. Es la primera  vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, ya que ha recibido comentarios favorables de los créditos para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas mesas, sillas que le servirán para abrir una sucursal en un local cercano a un centro educativo.
texts.en: Violeta is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children at a relative’s house.  For the past two years she has had a restaurant that she and her mother are associated with.  Her mother is in charge of serving the customers and both prepare the food daily.  Her work begins in the first hours of the morning when she shops for perishable ingredients, such as meat and vegetables because they need to be fresh.  Her delicious spices are of great strength to the business and it assures that her customers will return to eat.  It also brings her the necessary income that will cover everything she has invested in and will show improvement in her business in the coming months.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she has already received favorable remarks about improving the condition of her business.  She is committed to repaying her loan on time.  She will use the money to buy new tables and chairs that will allow her to open a branch in a location near a school.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
A sus 23 años de edad y como madre de un hijo de 7 años, Elizabeth se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar como independiente desde muy joven, pues con lo que su esposo ganaba no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar.  Por ello, esta emprendedora empezó a elaborar diferentes manualidades las cuales son parte importante de la fuente de sustento de su familia. 

Aunque en oportunidades Elizabeth debe vender a bajos precios sus productos poco a poco ha ido ganando màs clientes lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante con su negocio. 

La sala de su casa y el comedor son los espacios donde esta emprendedora realiza su labor pero en el futuro sueña tener un local independiente donde además pueda exhibir sus productos. 

Actualmente Elizabeth necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaborar mayor producción y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: At 23, Elizabeth was already the mother of 7 and began to work independently to support her family, as her husband's salary was not enough to cover household needs.  In this way, she began making and selling handmade crafts as a way to supplement the family's income.  Elizabeth started selling her crafts very inexpensively but as her client base grew, she has been able to expand her sales and profits.  She works from home, in the living and dining areas, and hopes in the future to open her own shop to better exhibit her crafts.  She seeks credit to buy more basic materials for her crafts and thus increase her production and sales.

loans.use: To buy craft materials

loans.name: Cinthia Magaly

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia  junto  con su esposo   tienen una cerrajería , la cual  representa    la manera  de  obtener   ingresos  permitiéndoles sustentar  su  hogar , en esta  ocasión  ella  requiere de  nuestro  apoyo  para  invertir  en su  negocio  realizando   la  compra  de mercancía y  material ,   ya  que  ellos  se  preocupan por  brindarles  un excelente  servicio  a  sus  clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Cinthia and her husband have a locksmith shop which is their source of income for covering household expenses.  With our support she wants to invest in the business and buy merchandise and material in order to provide excellent service to customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Soun, 51, and her husband, 49, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River which is the best place for fishing. They use many kinds of fishing tools to catch fresh fish. After the fishing, they take all the fish to the market; they can sell at a suitable price. As Soun’s house is located along the river, it is affected by flooding and also needs repair. She has requested her loan to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house. Soun has four single children, two of whom work in construction.

loans.use: to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Mario Salomao

texts.pt:
Natural de Gaza, Provincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos,de idades entre 2  a 11 anos de idade os mais velhos vao a escola. Fez 7a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os irmaos enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.   
saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Trabalha na empresa caminhos de ferro de Moçambique ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.880.00mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez do colega que tambem e cliente desta instituiçao. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 10.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para aumentar a sua residencia.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades, pretende concluir a sua obra e iniciar um negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Mario is from Gaza in the province of Gazo in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of 3 children who range in age from 2 to 11.  The oldest 2 are in school.  He studied through seventh grade but did not continue due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his siblings by sending them money to help with their food costs.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employment and better living conditions.  He has worked at the railroad comapny of Mozambique for more than 7 years and makes 3,800 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account.

He has never has a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague that is also a client of our institution.  This is his second loan in the amount of 10,500 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, rocks, etc.) to expand his home.

He is confident that he will pay back his loan without any difficulty.  He wants to finish the work on his home and start a business, for which he is planning to request more loans.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand, rocks, etc.)

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. She is married to a barber. Iman's husband started his shop three years ago and has established a good number of customers.

Iman came to FATEN and took out a $1,000 loan to help her husband improve the shop. Iman's husband needed a new barber kit and hair creams. He also wanted to use the entire space in the shop but he couldn't cover the expenses from the shop's income. Therefore, she took out the loan.

Iman is a religious woman, as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants. Therefore, her husband is shown in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase a barber kit and creams

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti, a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. For the past two years, Binti has operated a food business, selling in the nearby school to both students and teachers. She faces the major business challenge of high transportation costs but dreams of expanding her enterprise in the future to meet growing customer demand.

Binti decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder and beans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder and beans.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years. 
Shirley is borrowing 13,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall. She earns extra income from a general store.
Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y dos hijas de 07 y 04 años de edad aún estudiantes de nivel primario e inicial.
Ella es de carácter emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante, anteriormente apoyaba a su suegra a ofrecer sus cosméticos, tuvo a sus hijas y sintió la necesidad de obtener sus propios ingresos económicos, gracias al Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos consiguió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con éste capital decide iniciar su negocio de venta de bocaditos con entrega a domicilio, actualmente tiene su puesto de refrigerios en un local acondicionado de la Municipalidad de la zona, incrementó sus productos como golosinas, juanes, tamales, humitas, huevos cocidos y refrescos de frutas y otros., Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son los trabajadores de la municipalidad y  público en general, tiene una buena sazón en sus comidas, le van muy bien y brinda un servicio de calidad.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, aceites en litros, asimismo cajas de galletas de diferentes sabores, golosinas, paquetes de gaseosas y otros.
Gladys, es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a conseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys belongs to the Communal Bank "Esmeralda", in the District of Tarapoto, which is in the Province and Department of San Martín.  She lives with her boyfriend, she is 28 years old, and two daughters aged 7 and 4 who are still students at elementary school and kindergarten.

She has an entrepreneurial spirit and is keen to get ahead in life.  Formerly, she helped her mother-in-law in selling cosmetics.  She had her daughters, and felt the need to earn her own income.  Thanks to the Communal Bank of Manuela Ramos, she got an initial loan of 300 New Soles.  With the capital, she decided to start her business selling snacks with home delivery.  She now has a snack location near the neighborhood's Municipal government building, where she increased her range of products such as candy, juanes (a Peruvian version of the tamale), tamales, humitas (another type of tamale), cooked eggs,  fruit drinks, etc.  Over time she has become well known among her clients, who are employees at the Municipal government and also the general public.  Her food tastes great, the business is doing very well and she provides quality service levels.

With this loan of 1,500 New Soles, she will buy ingredients for preparing her snacks, such as sacks of rice, bags of sugar, crates of eggs, bunches of plantains, and liters of oil.  She will also buy boxes of cookies with different flavors, candy, soda, etc.

Gladys is a woman who strives hard.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients: rice, sugar, candy, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  She is 56 years old, married to Makumi, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Nancy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chanhorn

texts.en:
Chanhorn and her husband are weavers. Besides weaving, Chanhorn’s husband is also hired by villagers to farm. He gets paid with fees. The couple has been married since 2003 and has two young sons. They are living on an island in the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Weaving is a traditional profession. Chanhorn is asking for another loan of $100 to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

Photo: Chanhorn with her loom.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Hamed fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « mettons ensemble ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 50 ans. Il est marié avec 7 enfants de 7 à 16 ans, dont 7 scolarisés. 

Hamed est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer une bonne qualité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Hamed voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hamed is part of the "Twibumbirehamwe / RSZ" group. The name of the group means "get together". Hamed was born in Rwanda 50 years ago and is married with 7 children aged between 7 and 16, all of whom go to school. 

Hamed is a rice farmer and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm. He plans to grow his business over the next few years by planting good quality rice and harvesting large quantities of produce. He will use his profits to take care of his children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan is a 30-year-old villager who has been living in Steung Sen district of Kompong Thom province. To earn a living, Mrs. Yan works as a farmer, growing rice crop. Her husband, Mr. Hak, works as a local construction foreman. They are blessed with two school-aged children. Together, they typically earn the equivalent of $15 USD per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Currently, Mrs. Yan has only a few plots of farmland, which produces an unsatisfactory amount for the family’s requirements during the year. Therefore, Mrs. Yan requests a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. She will use this loan to purchase additional farmland for growing rice. She hopes that this loan will make her living conditions better.

loans.use: to purchase additional farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ayessi Group

texts.fr: AYESSI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Francisca Ablawa. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement et de diversifier leurs activités, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Francisca Ablawa est âgée de 64 ans et est mariée à un militaire retraité du nom de célestin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leurs charge. Francisca Ablawa vit avec sa famille et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges du ménage.Francisca Ablawa n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Francisca Ablawa  mène comme activité la vente de condiments, de riz et de poissons fumés dans son quartier. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Francisca Ablawa achète ses produits au Bénin. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Francisca Ablawa et aux autres membres du groupe AYESSI, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: AYESSI is a group consisting of three people whose representative (she with a raised hand in the photo) is named Francisca Ablawa.  The group members live in the same neighborhood. In order to increase their working capital and to diversify their business, this group is asking for their third loan from ALIDE.  Francisca Ablawa is 64-years old and married to a retired soldier named Celestin.  The couple have five children, all in school, two of which remain in their care.  Francsica Ablawa lives with her family and ensures together with her husband the various household expenses. Francisca did not attend school.  For about 10 years, Francisca has been in the business of selling condiments, rice, and smoked fish in her neighborhood.  This business generates income that helps her contribute to family expenses.  Francsica Ablawa buys her products in Benin. This third loan will certainly enable Francisca Ablawa and other members of the AYESSI group enhance the level of their business and grow their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, bags of rice, and fish.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (in the photo) and her husband, Sarom, are vegetable and flower farmers. Sarom also drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

The couple lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five sons--two are construction workers, one is a monk and the other two attend school.

Mom is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike because the old one was stolen.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Kimsang

texts.en: Kimsang, 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. She sells pigs and cows, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Kimsang is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony (in the photo) has full-time employment, while his wife is a weaver. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two young sons. 

Sony is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives, making a new stairway and walls.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives, making a new stairway and walls.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is from the village of Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Herminia has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for over 16 years, earning approximately 6,065 PHP a month.

In 2007, Herminia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Yeb

texts.en:
Yeb, 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and her husband is a carpenter. Her two children are students.

Yeb requests a loan of USD 1200 to purchase wood to produce tables, chairs and beds. In the future, she wants to run a new business, remodel her house, and send her children to a good school.
