loans.use: buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is 38 years old and lives with his wife and his four children in Gaza.

He has a poultry farm and he earns a monthly income of US $455. He started his business in 2011.

He needs this loan to expand his yard and get a new chicken plucking machine and cages for the chickens, which will increase his stock and help him to improve his financial conditions and will lead to support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Saleem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his yard and get a new chicken plucking machine and cages for the chickens.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 22 years old and lives with his family. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education so he became fisherman. He has been fishing since 2013, but before that he was working with assistance from his boss. He has earned around $550 monthly. 

In order to increase his business capital and to expand his selling capacity, Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan. He plans to buy new fishnet, a small motor, and an aquarium.

Mohammad hopes that this loan will lead to supporting the needs of his family and reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: to buy new fishnet, a small motor, and an aquarium.

loans.name: Wilfried

texts.fr: Wilfried âgé de 24 ans, célibataire a arrêté l'école au niveau universitaire. Wilfried vit seul et assure tout seul ces divers besoin, pour y arriver Wilfried vend des boissons depuis quatre ans dans sa région. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Afin de renforcer son activité, Wilfried sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons.

loans.name: Mukta

texts.en:
Mukta is a 33-year-old differently-able woman who lives with her husband and five-year-old child in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. Her son is in school. She owns a grocery shop where she sells basic household items and earns 2,500 INR to 3,000 INR per month, which is very little for family expenses. Her husband helps her in her business. Her husband is engaged in farming rice and vegetables but does not earn sufficient money. Mukta is a very responsible and hardworking woman. 

Mukta has requested a loan of 35,000 INR to purchase rice, edible oil, sugar, spices and biscuits in bulk for resale. She hopes to do well in business. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, edible oil, sugar, spices and biscuits in bulk for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
\"For years ago, I decided to turn my pickup truck into a mobile resturant. The city is growing and there are a lot of construction workers that don\'t have a place to eat. I prepare the food in my house and I bring it to their place of work.\" Senor R. asks for $1000 to buy a stove and to paint \"My Mobile Resturant.\" This has been reported by Senor R..

Loan Use: To purchase a stove and to paint \"My Mobile Restaurant

“Hace 4 años decidí convertir mi camioneta en un Restaurante, la ciudad está creciendo y muchos trabajadores de la construcción no tienen donde comer; yo preparo la comida en mi casa y la llevo hasta su lugar de trabajo” El Sr. R. solicita 1,000 dlls. para la compra de una estufa y pintar “Mi Restaurante Móvil” comenta el Sr. R..

loans.use: Para la compra de una estufa y pintar “Mi Restaurante Móvil”

loans.name: Murdiah

texts.en:
Murdiah, 26 years old, is a mother of 2 children of 5 and 3 years old. Murdiah runs her small kiosk business together with her husband, Sayadi.

As a new member of MBK, she will get a maximum of $50 loan which she will spend to add more items to be sold in her small kiosk. With this loan she expects her revenue to increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to support her kiosk to grow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his butchery business to include a mini restaurant

loans.name: Vitervo

texts.es:
Business Description

Vitervo has 15 years of experience in agriculture and knows how to grow rice, corn, beans and such. In addition, he is an experienced cattle-trader, a pursuit which takes up much of his time, though of course, on the farm, time is always at a premium.

Use of Loan

Vitervo will use this loan to purchase more cattle, supplementing his income from farming.

Personal Information on the Borrower

Vitervo is married to Santa with whom he has five beautiful children, two in school. He works very hard to care for his family and their small, charming cement home. He hopes to increase the acreage and head of cattle under his care.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Vitervo es agricultor en la cual se a dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 15 anos ganando cada día mas experiencia en el manejo de los cultivos como arroz, maíz, gandul etc.…a mas también se dedica la compra y venta de ganado, ya que la ganadería es otro tipo de ingreso que Vitervo posee, la mayoría del tiempo la dedica a esta actividad, que por ser netamente del campo siempre la disponibilidad de tiempo es total.

Uso del Préstamo

Vitervo necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor cabezas de ganado, ya que no solamente de la agricultura se mantiene, sino que busco otra manera de ingresos y una de esas actividades es la ganadería.

.

Información Personal

Actualmente Vitervo es casado con dona Santa, en donde han llegado a procrear 5 hermosos hijos, que en la actualidad estudian 2 de ellos. Vitervo con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo mantiene su familia unida, en su pequeña y acogedora casa de estructura de cemento. Nuestro amigo Vitervo tiene por objetivos tener mayor número de terrenos para cultivarlas y tener mayor cantidad de cabezas de ganado

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 29 years old, married, has six children and her husband is a rural worker and she is dedicated to embroidering blouses, table cloths, cushions and selling them to locals in who sell products in other states. She belongs to a group "Espina 8" together with Mrs. Micaela Díaz Hernández, who sells fruits and vegetables and Mrs. Matea Hernández Díaz, another craftswoman. Matea and María will use the loan to invest in linens and Micaela in fruits and vegetables so they all can increase their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , tiene 29 años , es casada , seis hijos , su esposo es campesino y ella se dedica al bordado de blusas , tapetes , cojines y lo vende con personas de su misma localidad que llevan sus productos a comercializar a otros estados .Pertenece al grupo Espina 8 junto con doña Micaela Díaz Hernández (vende frutas y verduras) y doña Matea Hernández Díaz(artesana) .Con sus prestamos Matea y María invertirán en hilos y Micaela en frutas y verduras para incrementar sus ingresos .

loans.use: craftsmanship

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Wamaitha K. is a 26-year-old single lady. She is in the business of selling new shoes at Mlolongo town where she resides. She started her business in the year 2000 with capital of Ksh 15,000 (US$ 220), which she saved while under employment at a small retail shop in Rongai town from 1999 –2000.

Anne started selling her goods in an open-air space because she didn’t have a stall where she could sell. However, luck was on her side, and in the year 2005, Anne teamed up with her cousin Fridah Wanjiku, who is also requesting a loan from Kiva, and together, they rented a stall and agreed to share the rent. Anne deals in the sale of shoes and an assortment of other items, while her cousin deals in the sale of clothes, hence their businesses are complementary. During the holiday seasons like the upcoming month of December, the demand for clothes and shoes is always high because this is when many people buy such things as gifts for their families, both in urban and rural places.

Anne’s business has been growing because of the high population in her area, and she finds that she always runs out of stock due to the high demand for the items in her stall. She now needs to purchase a stock of men’s shoes, ladies’ shoes, children’s shoes, plastic items, cutlery, and also bedcovers. Anne is therefore requesting a loan of USD 750, with which to increase her inventory. With an increase in her stock, she will be able to increase her profit, resulting in more income. She also intends to employ an additional person to help her around the boutique. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase stock of assorted shoes, assorted plastic items, cutlery and bedcovers.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro (Walking Towards The Future) Group #1

texts.en:
Nery is 38 years old and raises her two daughters (ages 14 and 17) by herself. Her business is gasoline sales. She buys gallons from the nearby town of Samana and sells it in small quantities to her community. Most of her customers are motorcycle drivers who are passing by, or her neighbors.

Other businesses in this group include: small convenience stores and clothing sales. They meet in one of the associate’s backyard. Their community is about 20 minutes from the nearby town of Samana.

Nery found out about Esperanza through her cousin, who is a loan associate in a different Bank of Hope. She decided to start her own group so she and her neighbors could take out a group loan. Right now, this is the only group in the larger Bank of Hope, but as they start their second loan cycle more neighbors are becoming interested and are starting to form additional groups.

With her first loan, Nery was able to buy more gasoline upfront which she was able to sell to her community and increase her profit. She is going to use this second loan to gradually increase the amount of gasoline she can buy and sell.

Andres O. not present when this photo was taken

NOTE: This is a group loan. Nery is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of the loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: She is going to use this second loan to gradually increase the amount of gasoline she can buy and sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
The desire to get ahead constantly encourages Milagros to find a way to satisfy her household needs. She currently lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter, to whom she owes her daily joy. Based on a sister-in-law's advice, she decided to join the business world selling the country's top brand-name cosmetics. She has successfully been selling for eight years, in spite of not having a fixed selling stand. She has a display case to sell her products to neighbors. Every day Milagros walks from house to house selling her products. Her warmth and experience helps her sell the products. Just like every enterprising woman, she wants to continue to succeed, and this is why she wants to have a stable locale where she can not only sell cosmetics but also sandwiches and sweets. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to achieve each of her goals. Support an enterprising woman like Milagros. She appreciates your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Los deseos de progreso motivan constantemente a Milagros a buscar la manera de cubrir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar. Actualmente vive con su esposo y su pequeña niña de seis años de edad, a quienes le debe su alegría diaria.Por consejo de unas de sus cuñadas empezó su incursión en la actividad mercantil con la venta de cosméticos de las mejores marcas de su país, lleva ocho años dedicándose a esta actividad con mucho éxito y a pesar de no contar con un puesto de ventas seguro, sus ventas compensan muy bien esta falta. Acude a su esposo amistades vecinas y a su hermana para exhibir su vitrina con los productos para su comercialización. Adicionalmente día a día Milagros camina para ir de casa en casa a ofrecer sus productos y con la calidez de su trato y experiencia en la venta de estos productos asegura la venta de sus productos.Como toda mujer emprendedora desea seguir superándose, por esa razón desea tener un local estable donde no sólo ofertará cosméticos sino también ofrecerá bocadillos y dulces. Con este propósito solicita un préstamo para alcanzar cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto.Apoya a una mujer emprendedora como Milagros, ella agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: A boost of capital will increase product sales and help to rent a safe business space.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Born on October 4, 1964 in Cotonou in the LIttoral District, Mrs. Chantal A. is married and the mother of 7 children, of whom only one is still her dependent. She is presently requesting her third loan and has been very punctual in reimbursing her previous loans. She is also a very careful manager of her little business. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNée le 04/10/1964 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral, Dame A. Chantal est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont un seul est encore à sa charge. Elle est au troisième crédit et a toujours été prompte dans le remboursement des crédits passés. Aussi, est- elle très rigoureuse dans la gestion de son affaire.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cases of liquor, 2 cases of pasta, and 6 cases of various sorts of canned goods Achat de 05 cartons de liqueur, 02 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 06 cartons de boîte de conserve de diverses sortes

loans.name: Selma

texts.en: Selma is a 41-year-old woman  from Križ, a small village near Visoko. She is not married  but she has  3 children 7, 8, and 10 years old. Selma sells  clothing at the market  and she can  earn about US$ 300 monthly. This is her  first loan  through MCO WWI in the amount of  US$ 925. Selma will invest it in clothes in order  to expand  her business  and earn  some  additional money.

loans.use: Invest in clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. G. has a business selling ingredients to bake bread in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She has a stand in the market Mercado Micaela Bastidas Number 4, where she sells eggs, grains, butter, and more.

Teresa is 69 years old and has four children. Her husband died eight years ago, and her children live in Lima. Without her business she would have nothing; it keeps her going. She used to have a general store, but she didn’t have the capital to keep it open after her husband died.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Teresa is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy more frijol canario, frijol ucayalinio, panamito, frijol castilla, and maiz morado.

loans.use: To buy more bread-making ingredients to sell

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo from kyela mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Bupe Mwakifinange. She is married and has 3 children aged 6, 8 and 12. She has 2 dependents who live with her because are they are a neighbor's orphan family. In 2007, Bupe established her rice-selling business. She is now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of rice. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice.

loans.name: Chankosal Choy Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chankosal C. is the leader of a group of six members in Kosh Khtum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a subsistence farmer and firewood seller, but neither of these two business activities supports his family adequately. His plantation has faced a drought and his last crop was not very good. As well, last year Mr. Chankosal C. experienced stomach problems and suffered from malaria, which cost him $200 for treatment. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to start a white wine production business in the village..

Mr. Chankosal C. is 36 and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other one is yet too young to attend. His wife, Mrs. Sophorn Keb, is a farmer. Two of the male group members are not presented in the picture. Their wives are pictured instead.

loans.use: To start a wine business.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr:
Mame D., age 49, is  married and has four children in her care.  She has been a member of the village bank of Château d’eau Bignona for three years.  She does business in shoes and second-hand clothing next to the TOTAL station.  Mame buys merchandise in Dakar for resale in Bignona.  She want to bolster her business to better help her family.    The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer


Mame D., 49 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait un commerce de friperies et de chaussures à coté de la station TOTAL. Mame achète la marchandise à Dakar pour revendre à Bignona Elle veut renforcer son activité pour mieux aider sa famille. Le  prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and resell second-hand clothing and shoes

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
K. Farhod is 28 years old. He is a loving husband and father, and for a long time has been running a grocery store which he rents. Farhod began his own store with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He has been selling fruits, vegetables and different kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store for the past 7 years. During these years Farhod acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. Vegetable and fruits sales are flourishing for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables.

His wife Amina helps Farhod with the business. They were able to make it grow and they want to turn it into a great success. Since he started their store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with good service. He is requesting a loan of 950 USD for the term of 12 months, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en:
Olubisi S. sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. Olubisi needs a deep freezer to cool her drinks for her customers.

Olubisi is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She is a LAPO client and lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan amount of $425 to buy one deep freezer so that she can cool her drinks for her customers. Olubisi says that this will increase her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and one deep freezer

loans.name: Pequeño Milagro (Small Miracle) Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su segundo ciclo cuenta con 17 integrantes.

Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias las cuales se detallan a continuación:

-Lida C., cantina

-Francisca C., Vta de mercaderias varias

-Letizia T., Venta de ropas

-Nilda A., Venta de comestibles

-Mirian N., Venta de ropas

-Marina C., Venta de ropas usadas

-Liliana N., Venta de lenceria

-Lourdes C., Venta de bebidas y ropas

-Maria Dolores E., Venta de comestibles

-Blanca B., Venta de lenceria

-Paola O., Venta de comestibles

-Ramona S., Kiosko

-Maria Victoria E., Peluqueria

-Sonia V., Venta de minutas

-Angela G., Vta de comestibles

-Maria C., Vta de frutas

-Marcelina R., Vta de comestibles.

La Directora de este comité es la Sra. Lida Chávez quien es vendedora de golosinas desde hace 5 años, ella empezó vendiendo algunas golosinas frente a una escuela de la zona, y actualmente tiene su propio negocio dentro del predio de la institución es la cantinera. El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes.

Cabe destacar también la puntualidad en los pagos y asistencia de la mayoría de las integrantes a las reuniones.
texts.en:
This committee has 17 members and is currently in its second cycle.

The members work in various activities, as listed below:

-Lidia C., Cantina

-Francisca C., Sale of various merchandise

-Letizia T., Clothing sales

-Nilda A., Food sales

-Mirian N., Clothing sales

-Marina C., Used clothing sales

-Liliana N., Lingerie sales

-Lourdes C., Beverage and clothing sales

-Maria Dolores E., Food sales

-Blanca B., Lingerie sales

-Paola O., Food sales

-Ramona S., Kiosk

-Maria Victoria E., Hairdressing

-Sonia V., Food sales

-Angela G., Food sales

-Maria C., Fruit sales

-Marcelina R., Food sales

The director of this group is Mrs. Lidia C., who has sold sweets for the last 5 years. She began selling sweets in front of a school zone and nowadays has her own business within the institution's land, where she serves beverages. The committee has good internal relations and respect among its members.

It is also worth emphasizing the punctuality of their payments and the attendance of the majority of the members at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, sodas, beer, wine, liquor, etc., to buy vegetables, to buy sugar, herbs, flour, oil, bread, dairy products, meat, noodles, rice, starch, etc.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: ABLAYE S. EST COMMERCANT DE DENREES ALIMENTAIRES DEPUIS SON ENFANCE. ACTUELLEMENT IL GERE SON PROPRE NEGOCE AU QUARTIER SOM A THIES. IL EST CELIBATAIRE SANS ENFANTS A CHARGE
texts.en:
ABLAYE S. has been a merchant of grocery items since he was a child. He currently has his own business in the SOM district in THIES. He is unmarried and has no children in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Sikyoomu Women's Group

texts.en:
Harriet N. is the chairperson of the Sikyoomu women’s group in Katosi, Lugazi. She is 38 years old and divorced. She lives with her three children in Katosi. Harriet has a retail shop that she has owned for 10 years. When she restocks her shop, she buys from the wholesale shops in Katosi so she does not have to incur more transportation costs. However, when it’s time to pay school fees, she is short on money to restock her business. She is the only bread winner at home, so she is grateful for the loans that allow her to restock her shop to a state where she can make enough profit to provide for herself and her children as well as to repay her loans on time.

She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Domingo Rufino

texts.es:
El Sr. Domingo Rufino Zeledón A. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Rosa López quien  vende tortilla la cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad. Sin embargo estos viven en sus propias casas y también tienen  limitantes económicos.

Hace 13 años El Sr. Zeledón  hace sorbetes caseros sus clientes son los transeúntes que la prefieren por  ofrecer productos caseros. El  Sr. Zeledón no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar en grandes cantidades los ingredientes de su producto, por eso necesita comprar: 1 quintal de  azúcar a $ 38.00  dólares el  quintal y 4 caja de leche a $ 28.00 dólares la caja, con esta inversión podrá  aumentar su ganancia.
texts.en:
Domingo Rufino Z. A. is originally from the city of Bluefields. He is 64 years old and married to Rosa Lopez. Rosa sells tortillas, but only earns a small salary from this and it's not enough to cover basic costs. They have five grown children who live in their own houses, but still have limited income.

For 13 years, Mr. Z. has been selling home made ice creams. His customers are those passers by who prefer his homemade product. He does not have the money he needs to buy ingredients in large quantity. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, milk and other necessary ingredients to increase his income.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk for his ice cream business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is year 48-year-old Asia D. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 17 and 27 years. Asia has been running an animal feed business since 2004. Her business is to sell chicken, cow and pig feed.  She works at the business for 14 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Asia currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase additional stock of animal feed.  In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asia thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 46 años de edad, habita en Villa libertad, con dos hijos de 19 y 24 años de edad, el mayor es independiente y el otro estudia, su esposo se desempeña como operario de maquina en  una de las empresas de zona franca. La sra. Maria vende ropa, zapatos y refrescos, negocio que inicio con una liquidación de su trabajo anterior, con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa y zapatos para ofertar a su clientela. Vende al contado y al crédito quincenal, para ella es de mucho beneficio este préstamo que le otorga Afodenic para mantener su negocio. Sus planes es poder hacer crecer su inventario para poder poder ayudar a su hijo a terminar los estudios para que sea un profesional
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 46 years old and lives in Villa libertad with her two sons. Her 24 year old son is fianncially independent, and her 19 year old is in school. Maria's husband works as a machine operator at a company in the industrial park. Maria sells clothing, shoes, and soft drinks. She started this business with the liquidation of her former job. This loan will be used to invest in inventory, including clothes and shoes to sell to her clients. Maria sells on credit and layaway, and because of this a loan from Afodenic is very beneficial and will keep her business running. She plans to expand her inventory in order to help her son finish school so that he can be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling onions, cooking oil, and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a chairperson for local council 3. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur N. habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile à moteur dans une cabine qu’il s’est fait construit par un menuisier, il a appelé cette cabine «  DAVID SON », il a commencé ce commerce en 2002, il s’approvisionne chez des fournisseurs au port autonome de lomé et  au bénin. La plupart de ses clients sont de conducteurs de taxi moto. Il veut rehausser son stock .Etant client de wages il demande un crédit pour acheter de l’huile à moteur.
texts.en:
Mr. N. lives in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé. He makes his money selling motor oil from a stand he commissioned a carpenter to make him. He calls his stand "David Son". He has been in business since 2002. He gets his stock from distributors in the autonomous port of Lomé and from Benin. Most of his customer are moto-taxo drivers. He wants to increase his stock. Because he is a client of WAGES, he is asking for a loan to buy more motor oil.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil

loans.name: María Celia García

texts.es: María Celia G. de 48 años de edad, reside en Ahuachapán junto a sus tres hijos una nuera y una nieta. A pesar de esto María Celia trabaja únicamente para sostener a dos de sus hijos los cuales son menores de edad y se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un negocio en el cual vende tortas, panes, sodas, golosinas y frutas, en todos los alrededores de Ahuachapán, ya que posee varios carretones en los cuales distribuye sus productos. María Celia tiene más de 13 años de trabajar de esta manera, logrando expandirse por todos los alrededores del lugar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio, ya que como madre soltera se esfuerza día con día para llevar el sustento para sus hijos y poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, es por esto que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Celia G. is 48 years old and resides in Ahuachapán with her three children, a daughter-in-law and a granddaughter. Despite this, Maria Celia works only to support two of her children who are minors and are in school. She owns a business where she sells cakes, breads, sodas, candy and fruit, all around Ahuachapán. She has several carts from which she distributes her products. María Celia has been working this way for more than 13 years and has been able to expand her business to the surrounding areas. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest more in her business. As a single mother, she strives every day to support her children and be able pay the household expenses. This is why her greatest desire is to continue to expand her business and be able to provide a better life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell from her carts.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja, Andrés de 42 años y sus hijos; Michael de 16, Yubitza de 13 y Didier de 2 añitos de edad, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar muy duro para el bienestar de los suyos, ya que su madre llegó a la capital sin una moneda, teniendo que mantener a cuatro hijos entre los cuales se encontraba Liliana. Aun pequeña tuvo la necesidad de apoyar a su madre que se desempeñaba como costurera para poder mantenerlos, felizmente su arduo trabajo dio frutos y pudo comprar un pequeño terreno donde se trasladaron a vivir entre esteras, esto en el distrito de Ventanilla en Lima. Hoy en día, Liliana recuerda el esfuerzo de su madre, de sus hermanos y el de ella misma, por los diferentes oficios que tuvieron y tuvo que realizar para generar ingresos para su hogar, no hay oficio que haya dejado de lado, desde la confección de joyas (bisutería), venta de gelatina, organización de polladas (actividades donde se vende platos a base de pollo frito), venta de ropa, etc. y aún tiene muchas ideas de negocio en su mente. Actualmente tiene una pequeña bodega, la cual ha ido abasteciendo poco a poco para obtener los ingresos que necesita, Liliana piensa que no hay nada difícil en el trabajo, que uno simplemente debe ponerle muchas ganas y esfuerzo ya que el éxito viene detrás, ahora espera hacer crecer su negocio y seguir incursionando en nuevas ideas, ya que su imaginación no para cuando de hacer negocio se trata. Este es su cuarto préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA, y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad productos para implementar su tienda; como comestibles, gaseosas, etc. así como vitrinas, las cuales le sirvan para mostrar mejor sus productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Liliana, 35, lives with her children: Michael is 16; Yubitza is 13; and Didier is 2. They also live with the children’s father, Andrés, who is 42. They have their own house. Since she was very young she has had to work very hard for the well being of her family. Her mother arrived in the capital with no money, and she had to take care of her four children. Even though she was little, Liliana had to help her mother, who worked as a seamstress, to support her family. Happily, her hard work paid off. She was able to buy a small piece of land where they lived in the swamps in the Ventanilla district of Lima. Now, Liliana remembers the efforts her mother, her siblings, and she made in the different jobs they had to do to generate income for their home. There is no job that they would not do: from making jewelry; selling gelatin; organizing fried chicken dinners; selling clothes; etc. She has even more business ideas in her head. She now has a small store, which little by little she has been stocking, in order to get the income she needs. Liliana thinks that it is not hard work. One simply needs to have the desire, put forth the effort, and success will follow. She now hopes to have her business grow and continue investing in new ideas. Her imagination has no end where business is concerned. This is her fourth micro loan with Prisma. She has always made her payments on time. With the loan she will buy more products to put in her store, such as food, soft drinks, etc. She will also buy display cases to better show her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a business venture primarily raising pigs for sale. She is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two small children. N. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock. N. is now requesting a loan of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the revenue to expand her business. No. 1014060415.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
DIANA D. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” vive en el Jr.Cesar Vallejo Mz.B.Lt.21, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 21 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es moto taxista.

Se inició en el negocio de artículos para belleza , perfumes, y la venta por catálogos, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pocos productos para poder ofertarlos a sus compañeros de la universidad, su negocio ha ido creciendo con el paso del tiempo.  

Hoy, ella está trabajando en sociedad con su hermana en un mismo local vendiendo abarrotes, perfumes y cosméticos.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos, una vitrina y nuevos productos que servirá para surtir su negocio. 

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Diana D. D. belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank. She lives at Jr.Cesar Vallejo Mz.B.Lt.21, in Pucallpa city. She is 21, has one son, and her husband is a “moto taxi” (motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment) driver. She started her business of selling beauty items and perfumes by catalog with her first loan for 300 PEN. She bought a few products to be able to offer them to her colleagues at the university. Her business has been growing with the passage of time. She is now working with her sister in the same place selling groceries, perfume, and cosmetics. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy perfume, cosmetics, a display case, and new products to stock her business. “Manuela Ramos is an ONG (non governmental agency) that supports a great number of families with small loans that let the women of this zone start or improve their businesses. I am very happy with this help,” she comments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and cosmetics.  Buy a display case.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María del Pilar A. Díaz tiene 27 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Incompleta,   tiene 3  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de productos como pantalones jeans, zapatos escolares y de vestir.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como pantalones jeans, zapatos escolares y de vestir para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Pilar A. D. is 27 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She has not completed all of secondary school and has 3 children, who depend economically on her. Maria sells shoes and clothes. She runs her business from her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received from New Hope II Community Bank, she invested in the purchase of products, like jeans and school and dressy shoes. With this loan of 500 soles, she will invest in the purchase of products like jeans and school and dressy shoes to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like jeans and school and dressy shoes to stock her business

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 63 años y 07 hijos que ya son independientes.

Grimanesa, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, nos cuenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, se inicio poco a poco y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido ubicado en el Mercado Central de la ciudad, un ambiente acondicionado tanto para ella como para sus clientes, esta muy orgullosa por haber salido adelante con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos que le ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto en el mercado a comprar  carne y  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará 04 cerdos enteros desvicerados. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cuchillos y bandejas nuevas.

Grimanesa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio a ella y a otras mujeres Sanmartinenses.
texts.en:
Ms. Grimanesa is a member of Santa Ana Community Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, State of San Martin. She is single and has seven children, all of whom are on their own.

Ms. Grimanesa sells pork for a living. She has told us that she had to overcome many difficulties at the beginning and started her business gradually. Her business is now well established in the city's Central Market, in an area well equipped for her and her customers. She is very proud to have been able to get ahead with the support of the Manuela Ramos Movement, which helped her considerably to improve her services.

She currently operates the same business and has a loyal customer base. Her customers come to her stall at the market to buy meat on a daily basis, where she personally takes care of them with her usual charisma.

With this S/. 2,000.00 loan she will buy four eviscerated pigs. She will use a portion of the money to buy new knives and trays.

Ms. Grimanesa is very satisfied with her accomplishments and is eager to continue to get ahead as long as God gives her the ability to do so. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help provided in establishing her business and those of other women in San Martin.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 whole eviscerated pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28 year-old mother of 2 who runs a shop where she sells spare parts for motorbikes. Grace has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy stock and expand her business. She hopes to one day open a second location, and perhaps combine it with a business selling cell phones. Grace wants to give her two children, a 5 year-old boy and a 1 year-old girl, a bright future. She describes herself as open, friendly, and hard-working.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She sells sarongs, shoes and bags to make a living.

Grace is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto M. is 41 years old and works as a tricycle driver in San Andres Bonifacio, Diffun Quirino. Aside from his transport business, he is also a fruit dealer in the same village, to provide additional income. He buys his fruits every Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.

Loreto would like to buy additional fruits so that he can generate bigger income. In this regard, he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 11000 that he can use as additional capital for his vending business and motorcycle maintenance.

Loreto is thankful because he is blessed with a supportive family. He is very optimistic that Kiva lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: Additional Capital.

loans.name: Gemima Joyce

texts.es: Gemima es una mujer extrovertida y colaboradora, de 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de un año de edad, es madre soltera, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su domicilio y tiene muchos clientes ya que da buen trato. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores” desde hace dos años, y siempre es puntual en sus cuotas. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de  300 soles, monto que invirtió en golosinas para vender. Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, lo cual invertirá en la compra de productos para su tienda como golosinas, bebidas, fideos, azúcar, etc. La meta de Gemima es agrandar su negocioya que es pequeña ,vender todo tipo de artículos para regalo y seguir trabajando por su niño para brindarle la mejor educación.
texts.en:
Germina is an extroverted woman who is a good collaborator. She is 28 years old. She has a one year old son and is a single mother. She has a grocery store in her house. She has many customers since she treats them very well. She has been a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank for the past two years. She is always punctual with her payments. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles, money that she used to buy candy to sell. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy products for her store such as candy, drinks, noodles, sugar, etc. Germina's goal is to enlarge her grocery store (it is small). She also wants to sell gift items and to continue to work in order to provide her child with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy products for her kiosk such as noodles, sugar, candy and drinks

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Ramona M. es una dama muy esforzada y muy trabajadora  que se ha propuesto brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y para ello ha decidido invertir en la remodelación de su vivienda en el municipio de Somotillo debido a que necesita mejorar las condiciones porque ha raíz de los fenómenos climáticos la vivienda se ha venido deteriorando.

Por este motivo es que ella ha acudido para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida brindándole a su familia un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Ramona M. is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She plans to give her children better living conditions. To do that, she has decided to invest in the remodeling of her home in the Somotillo municipality. She needs to improve its condition because the climate has caused its deterioration. That is why she has come to ask for a loan to buy construction materials. She will continue improving their living conditions by giving her family a decent roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Halawin

texts.en: Halawin M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar for making tea. Halawin is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Halawin hopes to be able to purchase foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy sugar for her restaurant

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda  es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Olinda se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas (comida rápida) por las noches en la vereda D. su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas y papas. Actualmente requiere un crédito D. 1200 soles, monto que será utilizado en insumos para salchicha: pollos, papas y gaseosas. La meta D. Olinda es ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Olinda is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 adult children. She sells salchipapas (a form of fast food maD. of sausages and potatoes) at night on the sidewalk in front of her house. Her husband helps her with the business.

Four years ago, Olinda joined the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sodas and potatoes. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan of 1200 soles to purchase supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and sodas. Her goal is to increase her business so that she can obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and sodas

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia L. is from the village of Zone 7, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Rogelia is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Rogelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rogelia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rogelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rogelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, razón por la cual, pone mucho esfuerzo con el trabajo que realiza.

Orfith, es mujer joven trabajadora y luchadora, que decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de salchipapas/pollos y lleva varios años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las tardes de 6:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Orfith is a member of the Communal Bank “La Marginal II”, which is located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and has a dependent school-age child, who is the reason behind everything she does.

Orfith is a hardworking and determined young woman who decided to start her own business selling salchipapas and salchipollos (local versions of fast food). She has been in operation for several years at her location that is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. Orfith says that her daily sales have been very good, due in part to the rich flavor of the food that she prepares. Her main customers are residents of the city, pedestrians, and regulars who know her well.

Her business continues to this day and she is very pleased with the work she has accomplished. She begins selling food in the evenings at 6pm. Orfith personally welcomes her customers with warmth and charisma.

With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy supplies for daily food preparation such as oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, as well as utensils to help her continue her business and provide better service to her customers. Orfith is eager to move forward and has many dreams and goals in life, such as opening a grocery store. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & utensils

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Irma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar ovejas y gallinas.
Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Irma, 41, has been a member of the "Gregoria Apaza" communal bank in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, for 4 years now. She is married and has 4 children. She completed secondary school and she raises small farm animals. She tells us that she used her first Manuela Ramos Movement loan of 300 new soles to increase her working capital. She will now request 500 new soles to buy sheep and chickens. Her dream for the future is that her children become professionals. What she likes the most about her communal bank is the savings and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and chickens.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva de 24 años es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia  junto a su esposo Wilson de 25 años y su hijo Kevin de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Cerca de una  mina ubicada en una fría ciudad peruana se encuentra el negocio de Eva, su tienda de lubricantes para carros es una de las más solicitadas, ya que siempre tiene lo ultimo del mercado. Los productos los lleva desde la ciudad, donde los compra al por mayor, para venderlos por unidad en su negocio, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de cuales son sus necesidades; y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los viajes son  muy largos y accidentados, además los lubricantes tienen que estar muy bien sellados para que no se derramen. Con el tiempo espera ampliar su tienda, ya que cada vez tiene mayor  demanda.Es el primer préstamo de Eva con  MFP, tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de  lubricantes  para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Eva is 24 years old and is a happy and hard-working young woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Wilson who is 25 years old and their son Kevin who is two years old. They are motivation behind all of her hard work. Eva's business is located in a cold Peruvian city near a mine and is a store that carries automotive lubricants. Her store is one of the most popular as she always has the latest goods. She brings in the products from the city where she buys them wholesale and she sells them individually as she has been doing for the last 8 years. What she likes the most about her work is talking to her customers and understanding their needs. The most difficult part of her job is transporting her products as the trips are long and full of difficulties and the lubricants need to be very well sealed so that they don't leak. Over time, she hopes to expand her store as demand is increasing. This is Eva's first loan with MFP and she's eager to pay back the money on time and with no delays so that she will be able to apply for future loans. She will use the loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy a larger quantity of lubricants for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Mr. Moa C. is 46 years old and lives in Thnal Bat village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pea Touch, are farmers who own 1.6-hectare (4-acre) piece of land on which they cultivate rice.

In order to support the farming, Mr. Moa C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticides. The rest of the loan he would use to buy gasoline to support his rice field.

Mr. Moa C. is the father of two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other one is a silk weaver. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticides and gasoline to support his rice field

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Elena es soltera, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Elena viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de Pisco en donde vende cereales, papa, haba y arveja verde, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa amarilla.
Los sueños de Elena son educar a sus hijos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. She is 42, single, and has five children. She travels weekly to the city of Pisco, where she sells grains, potatoes, beans, and green peas. She buys these products in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Elena needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy yellow potatoes. Elena’s dreams are to educate her children and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yellow potatoes

loans.name: Yepete

texts.en:
Yepete E. currently runs a shop where she sells various items. She is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, beans and posho to sell. Yepete is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 5 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting and to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans and posho to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel V. is from the village of Poblacion IV in the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental province, the Philippines. She is a single 28-year-old who has been running a general store offering products such as bread, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, and candy for over 3 years now. She earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Raquel joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services that would help to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 7000 PHP and is now requesting a 10000 PHP loan to help expand her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her general store.

loans.name: Lenh

texts.en:
Mr. Lenh L., 41, lives in a commune located in the rural area of Phnom Penh. He is disabled, having lost his right foot from civil war. To earn a living, he owns a pond, which is full of the lotus he grows. He will harvest and sell to buyers when the lotus is mature. He also depends on the income from his wife, who sells a few groceries and vegetables in the village. 

Lenh L. will be using his loan to buy fertilizers to fatten his lotus and the rest will accumulate more inventory for his wife’s grocery store. Lenh L. and his wife are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and grocery inventory

loans.name: Nirodani Madurangi

texts.en:
Nirodani is a 20-year-old married woman living with her husband and three-year-old son.  They live in the town of Hikkaduwa, along the southern coast of Sri Lanka. Her husband is a fisherman and his dream is to purchase a boat.  

So far, they have not received any financial assistance. So Nirodani has requested this loan for her husband's affairs.  They started this business seven years ago and have a good market to sell their fish. Nirodani and her husband are very close and work well together. She is hardworking, active, and a clever woman.  

Nirodani has requested a 40,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's fishing business.  Both of them want to create a bright future for their small son.

loans.use: To help purchase a boat

loans.name: Reynaida

texts.en:
Reynaida A. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 54 years old. Reynaida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Reynaida has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $300 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Reynaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: EL SR. FRANKLIN TIENE UNA MOVILIDAD VAGONETA CON LA QUE TRABAJA COMO SERVICIO DE TAXI. SU ESPOSA, MAGALI, SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS A CREDITO Y ADEMAS SIGUE ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LE FALTAN DOS AÑOS PARA TERMINAR SU CARRERA DE DERECHO. ELLOS TIENEN UNA HIJA EN EDAD ESCOLAR. VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE ALTO PAMPAHASI QUE ESTA A 25 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CUIDAD. FRANKLIN TRABAJA COMO TAXISTA DESDE HACE SIETE AÑOS PERO YA ES UNA AÑO Y MEDIO QUE COMPRO SU VAGONETA Y ESTA MUY FELIZ YA QUE AHORA TIENE MAS TIEMPO PARA COMPARTIR CON SU FAMILIA. ÉL DESCANSA LOS DÍAS MARTES DEBIDO A QUE EN NUESTRA CUIDAD EXISTE UN REGLAMENTO QUE ORDENA QUE CADA MOVILIDAD TIENE RESTRICCION DE INGRESO AL CASCO URBANO CENTRAL UN DIA A LA SEMANA Y ESTE DÍA SE DESIGNA SEGUN EL NÚMERO DE PLACA DE CADA MOVILIDAD. ESTE DIA FRANKLIN APROVECHA PARA REALIZAR UN CONTROL A SU VAGONETA. ÉL TRBAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION DESDE HACE VARIOS MESES EN LOS CUALES DEMOSTRO SER UN PERSONA PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE CON SUS PAGOS. EN ESTA OCACION SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO GENERAL DE SU VAGONETA.
texts.en:
Franklin owns a vehicle he uses to provide taxi services. His wife, Magali, who is still studying at the University and who will complete her Law Degree in two years, sells cosmetics on credit. They have a daughter of school age, and they live in the Alto Pampahasi area, 25 minutes from the city center. Franklin has been working as a taxi driver for seven years, but one and a half years ago he bought his own vehicle, and he is very happy because now he has more time to spend with his family. Tuesday is his established day off, as there is a rule in our town governing traffic according to which every car has no access to the urban area for one day of the week: the day is determined by each car’s license plate number. Franklin uses his day off to check his vehicle. He has been working with our institution for a few months, during which he has demonstrated being responsible man and accurate with his payments. In this occasion he is asking for a loan to provide for the general maintaining of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Oretha D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "United Women". She is 42 years old, married and has eight children who range in age from 3 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial difficulties. 

For 10 years now, she has been selling rice and oil. She also sews garments for women and children at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as hardworking.

Oretha plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 54,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, oil and cloth to sew more garments. Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Charles S. is holding the sign and Esther D. is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and cloth to sew more garments

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 1, Kampala

texts.en:
She is a 40-year-old married mother with four children. To shoulder her responsibilities as a family breadwinner, N. Sarah has been selling electrical gadgets for the last five years in Kampala. This business has sustained her and her family due to the hard work, time and investment, she has put in.

Sarah’s journey into this business was like a leap in the dark by virtue of the fact that she did not have any prior business experience. She had to go through the tough mill of running a business with no requisite experience. Her high sense of self esteem was the trump card she played in getting herself acquainted with operating a business. Her resilience has paid off given her business longevity.

Sarah makes profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings a month. With this loan, she says she wants to buy more electrical items like bulbs, switches and PVC-covered wire for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical items like bulbs and switches

loans.name: Rebeca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rebeca está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rebeca Rosalina Lezama E., coordinadora del grupo quien inicio hace ocho años con vendiendo  frijoles cocidos hoy en día por medio de los préstamos comercializa hueso, ropa y calzado. Ella es una mujer fuerte, emprendedora y luchadora quien es madre y padre de un joven de 26 quien tiene problemas motores y es su razón de ser y un pequeño quien es como otro hijo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son  María del Carmen S. U. la cual hace más de 15 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y tortillas, en la actualidad ella desea invertir en el destace de chancho negocio muy fructífero ya que además de vender la carne puede producir  nacatamales, frito, moronga, chicharrón etc. e  Ileana Chevez desde hace nueve años vende zapatos, frutas y sopas de hueso, queso, mondongo, de cola etc.
texts.en:
The Rebeca group is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Rebeca Rosalina Lezama E., the coordinator of the group. Eight years ago she started selling cooked beans. Now, with the loans, she sells bones, clothes, and footwear. She is a strong, enterprising, and tenacious woman. She is mother and father to a 26 year old young man and a little one who is like another son. The 26 year old has motor problems; he is her reason for living. María del Carmen S. U., a member of the group, has been selling clothes and tortillas for over 15 years. Now she wants to invest in the very fruitful business of butchering pigs. In addition to selling the meat, she can make "nacatamales" (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), fried pork, blood sausage, and "chicharrones" (pork rinds), etc. Ileana Chevez, the other group member, has been selling shoes, fruit, bone soup, cheese, blood sausage, tripe, and cola, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, bones, clothes, and footwear

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia G. is a married woman who lives in GK Village, Brgy. Villareal, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food-vending business. Celia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Celia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she could continue to save up for future household expenses and the education of her children. Celia G. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela O. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns a living by operating a beauty salon. Her husband, Eduardo O. who is 42 years old, works as a barber and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are 10 to 19 years old. 

Maristela  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maristela  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 45,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 75,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 49,500 which she intends to use as additional working capital and to purchase equipment for her beauty salon. She can then continue to save up for the future and security of her children. Maristela O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to provide additional capital and to purchase materials

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia M. tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Miscelánea Karen” que ya tiene 6 años, la señora nos cuenta que desde que llego a esta ciudad ella inicio con su negocio en lugar de trabajar en maquiladora y ganar el mínimo; sobre todo para estar con sus 3 hijos al cuidado de ellos. Apolonia pide el apoyo para pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos que próximamente entraran a la escuela y así tener una buena preparación académica.
texts.en:
Apolonia M. has run a grocery store called "Karen's Mix" for the last 6 years. She tells us that she started this business when she arrived in this city instead of earning minimum wage at a sweatshop and so as to be able to take care of her three children. Apolonia is asking for help to pay her children's school fees because she wants them to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his house: purchasing corrugated metal roofing sheets, wood and beams

loans.name: Ruphelle

texts.en: Ruphelle R. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Ruphelle is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Ruphelle owns and operates a mini-grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ruphelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruphelle is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery stock in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty foods for desserts and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dui's Group

texts.en:
Dui T. N. is 52 years old and has 3 children who live separately from her. She has a motorbike repair shop. Her shop opened in 2007, one year after she received her first loan from our credit program. This kind of business generates 100,000 VND profit per day. Currently, she wants a loan  of 7,630,000 VND to buy an automatic pumping machine.

Chiem T. N. is 51 years old and has 2 children who work. She runs a soft drink business. Now, she needs a loan of 7,630,000 to buy a refrigerator.
Giang T. N. is 30 years old and has 1 son. She is running a stationery shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop.
