Charito, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Charito is a member of the El Triunfo Communal Bank in the San Hilarion district of the Picota province, department of San Martin. She is a 28-year-old married mother with 1 dependent child.

A hardworking woman, Charito used to sell firewood with the optimism and self-confidence that she is noted for. She then took the initiative and started her own candy business, which she set up in a well-equipped area of her house, where she attends to her customers. She has only been in business for a short time, but she is very satisfied with her accomplishments as her business is prospering.

She currently has faithful customers, her main ones being her friends and local residents, since they visit her stand on a daily basis, and she attends to them with the charm and politeness for which she is noted.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase packages of cookies (assorted flavors), chifles (fried plantain chips) by the dozen, and chocolate (Cañonazo and Sublime brand) to increase her inventory and satisfy her customers. Charito is prepared for everything, and she feels that she still has the strength to continue working to get ahead in life. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets

loans.name: Sapah Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sapah' group in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. This group of entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 2,900,000 to enable them to expand their businesses.

The leader of this group of borrowers is Hawanatu T. on the right. Hawanatu was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-four years of age, single, with one child who is in class one.

Hawanatu sells cottons, lace, and school uniforms. She has been doing this business for over four years now. With this loan, Hawanatu will buy five packets of lace and six lengths of cotton cloth. A packet of lace costs something between SLL 80,000 – 100,000 and a length of cotton costs something between SLL 50,000 – 60,000.

loans.use: Buy five packets of lace and six lengths of cotton cloth

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Gaviotas pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, están juntas por primera vez, agrupándose para acceder al préstamo y los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de polleras (faldas), verduras, zapatos.
Una de las integrantes es María C. de 20 años se dedica a vender ropa variada en diferentes ferias ofreciendo persona a persona, otra integrante es Patricia M. de 24 años vende celulares en la Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto en un lugar fijo.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer sus negocios y así generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de comida, vivienda, ropa y educación de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Gaviotas Communal Association is part of the German Busch Community Center. The members of this group have joined together for the first time to access a loan and take advantage of other services offered by Pro Mujer. They all have different retail businesses such as selling skirts, vegetables, and shoes.

One of the members is María C., who is 20 years old and sells different types of clothing at the various fairs. She offers her products on an individual basis, one customer at a time. Another member is Patricia M., who is 24 years old. She has an established vending location on the outskirts of El Alto where she sells mobile phones.

All of the members are in need of loans so that they can strengthen their businesses and generate enough income to cover expenses such as food, housing, clothing, and education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math A. S., 39 years old, is a vegetable seller from Phnom Penh City. She has been operating her business in the Toulsong Kei Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. 

Math is married to Mr. Teur As Math who is a motorcycle and a boat driver. He also works with her in selling vegetables. Math A. S. cares for four children, all of whom are single; one of her sons is also employed as a vegetable seller. 

Math A. S. is taking out her second loan to buy materials in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia, es casada, vive en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 65 años. Ignacia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo de venta de comida. Ignacia nos cuenta que esta encargada del comedor de trabajadores de la empresa “Backus”, ella prepara almuerzo para 150 empleados. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. Ignacia forma parte del banco Comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 700 dólares, que invertirá en comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar. Ya son varios  años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. Ignacia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
 
(Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”).
texts.en:
65 year-old Ignacia is married and lived in the city of Cusco. She alternates her household tasks with her work selling meals. She is in charge of the workers’ dining area of the ‘Backus’ business where she makes lunch for 150 employees. She’s had the business for two years, and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Ignacia is a member of the Arariwa Association’s ‘Yanapakuy’ community bank. She needs a loan of $700 which will be used to buy rice, oil, and sugar. Ignacia is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan in this way and promises to repay the money according to the schedule. (‘Yanapakuy’ is a Quechua word meaning ‘Let us help’.)

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Asejere

texts.en:
N. is 35 years old, is married with three children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to support their men in keeping the home.

N. operates a restaurant and bar, selling drinks and cooked foods in order to make a living. With the profit from the business she is able to save a little money and assist her husband in running the home.

N. hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Leonora's Group

texts.en:
Leonora M. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin. She is 39 years old. Leonora is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members.

Leonora is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, sugar, salt, candies, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan A. is currently in the business of selling ice cream and groundnut paste at home and is requesting a loan to purchase onions and cooking oil to sell.  Juan is 32 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Usmonbek

texts.en:
C. Usmonbek is a 37-year-old businessman. He is married and together with his wife they have 4 children. Usmonbek is a farmer, like his wife. They started their work 15 years ago. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife, he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land. 

His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. Usmonbek requests the loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. This will allow him to better provide for his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Concepcion Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción trabaja con Emprender desde al año 2001, en un grupo llamado Elección, grupo bueno ubicado en el Mercado Los Pinos, la Sra. Se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, ella trabaja en ese mercado hace mas de 20 años, ella tiene hijos ya profesionales y estudiantes universitarios, el esposo es empleado de la Policia, con muchos años de servicio, la Sra. solicita este crédito para compra de mercaderia y en parte para cubrir gastos de estudios de tesis de su hija menor, es una persona muy buena y responsable, ambos esposos compraron un terreno hace pocos años por la zona de Reyes Carvajal, camino a la Florida e hicieron construir su casita con los ahorros que tenian y los prestamos que sacaron, en fin es una persona muy trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos. Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Concepción has been working with Emprender since 2001, in a group called Elección, a fine group located in Mercado Los Pinos. She sells seasonal fruit and has been working in this market for more than 20 years. Some of her children have already a job, and others are university students, and her husband is a policeman with many years in the line of duty. The loan she is requesting will be used partly to buy products, and partly to cover the expenses for the university graduation of her youngest daughter. Concepción is a very good and responsible person; a few years ago she and her husband bought some land in the Reyes Carvajal area, on the way to La Florida, and had their house built there with their savings and the loans they obtained; she is a very hard-working woman, always very accurate with her payments. They are really grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Gustavo Hidalgo

texts.es:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa e hijos, Gustavo (24) y Diego (18), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Gustavo es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Gustavo es agricultor y los productos que cultiva son maíz, trigo, habas y arbeja.  Hace las compras y las ventas cada mes en el mercado de San Miguel, cuando se necesita. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para invertir en la agricultura. Piense que va a ser más fácil con el crédito. Su sueño seria de poder hacer una casita para su familia y crecer más el negocio. 
Le gusta hacer deportes en su tiempo libre: jugar volley y también pasar tiempo con sus hijos
texts.en:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. is 50 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, Gustavo (age 24) and Diego (age 18), and live in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Gustavo is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Gustavo is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and peas. He buys and sells each month at the market in San Miguel as needed. Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy compost for his farming activities. He believes the loan will making things easier for him. His dreams include building a house and expanding his business. He enjoys sports in his free time, such as volleyball, and spending time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Richard Eduardo

texts.es: Richard tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente tine una hija de 6 meses de edad, el y su familia viven en la casa de su suegra, vivienda que esta ubicada en AA.HH Tarapaca en casa de adobe de un piso. Richar se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte urbano por la ciudad, en una moto taxi alquilada. Se inicio desde muy joven a esta actividad. Su sueño y objetivo es poder tener su vehiculo propio, con el dinero que solicita sera para gastos personales, construira una parte del terreno que le dio su suegra.
texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old year old, in a common marriage, and has a six month old daughter. He and his family live in the adobe house of his mother-in-law which is located in the settlement of Tarapaca. Richard provides urban transportation services throughout the city using a rented motorcycle taxi. He started this business at a very young age. His dream and goal is to have his own vehicle. The money he requested will be used for personal expenses, specifically to start building on part of the land given to him by his mother-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin building on the land given to him by his mother-in-law

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es: La señora Juana Julia V. O. tiene 28 años de edad, Casada, se dedica a la Artesanía “elaboración de delantales Típicas”, también cuenta con una tienda de consumo diario, su tienda se encuentra en un sitio muy reconocido, por la misma razón es que necesita más capital para poder ampliar su tienda y tener todos los artículos que sus clientes demandan, se decidió efectuar un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para la tienda, esto con el proposito de contribuir con sus vecinos al ofecerles diferentes articulos  de consumo diario al alcance de su hogar y tambien mejorar sus ganacias, como también mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Julia is 28 years old, married, and presently dedicated to artisan crafts, making traditional aprons. She also has a store that sells all types of snacks. She has approached the ASDIR association for a small loan to be able to purchase more products for her store. Juana notes that the store is situated in a very recognized location. And she also needs more capital to be able to expand the store. With this small assistance, she could improve its utility, as well as bettering the condition of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mas producto para su tienda

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou C., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of $1 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of $2.10 per day. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a computer for one of the children to operate a business of transferring data into mobiles. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Koboyodou

texts.fr: S. est une femme  célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, elle s'est lancée en  2000 dans la vente de boissons alcoolisées appelé tchoucoutou faite à base de sorgho. le stock de sorgho dont elle dispose est épuisé, elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 sacs de sorgho au nord du togo dans la ville de ketao et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Koboyodou S. is an unmarried woman. In 2000, she began selling alcoholic beverages made from sorghum called tchoucoutou to support herself. As she has run out of her stock of sorghum, she is requesting a loan to re-stock with 4 bags of sorghum from the north of Togo in the town of Ketao and to provide for the transport of the merchandise.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of sorghum

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lluvia lo conforman Lorena del Socorro Calderón de 37 años, Flor de María U. y Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro, es la coordinadora de este grupo, en su casa tiene una tortillería, es ahí que vende también frijoles cocidos, cuajadas y otros rubros. Flor, vende hielo, chocobananos y frijoles cocidos, ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materia prima y desea añadir en su negocio la venta de leña. Martha Lorena es dueña de un cafetín en el cual tiene muchos productos como chiverías y golosinas y con el crédito desea mejorarlo invirtiendo más en gaseosas y refrescos.
texts.en:
The members that make up the Lluvia Solidarity Group are Lorena del Socorro Calderón (37 years old), Flor de María U. and Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro is the group leader. In her home she has a tortilla restaurant where she also sells cooked beans, curds, and other items. Flora sells ice, chocolate-covered bananas and cooked beans. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and also wants to start selling firewood. Martha Lorena is the owner of a small café in which she sells many products like snack foods and candy. With this loan she will improve her business by investing in more sodas and other drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Adolfo De Trinidad

texts.es: Adolfo C. V. labora para UNICA como guarda de seguridad resguardando el local de la Universidad, es casado tiene un hijo de edad escolar dos personas dependen de el, su esposa y el hijo .Este es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga por lo que lo implementara en mejorar el techo de su casa compra de zinc y perlín.
texts.en:
Adolfo C. V. works for UNICA as a security guard, protecting the premises of the University. He is married and has a school-aged son. Two people are dependent upon him: his wife and his son. This is the first disbursement that CEPRODEL has granted him. He will use the loan to improve the roof of his house by buying corrugated metal roof sheeting and structural beams.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing sheets to repair his roof

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes G., 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Widowed and left to support her child, Lourdes works hard to be able to do so. By the grace of God, Lourdes has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide for her family. A dream for most Filipino parents like Lourdes, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old. Cepriana is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 29 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Cepriana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cepriana wishes for her children to finish college someday and have a bright future.

Cepriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cepriana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
Loeb M. is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She stays at home to care for three school-aged children and cooks for her family. Besides her housework, she is also a clothes seller around her community. The family income is contributed to by her husband who works in construction building. Her husband appears in the photo. 

Presently, Loeb M. has been planning to expand her business because she thinks that it is a profitable one for her family. That is why she requested a loan that will enable her business to purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
El señor Jose Maria B. C. es trabajador de la Alcaldia de Chinandega con quienes se firmo convenio para deducciones de salario quincenalmente, el señor habita carretera a Leon, se desempeña como Vigilante y tiene 11 años de laborar, es casado con 01 hijo y su esposa trabaja lavando y planchando.

El Señor B. C. solicito credito para  compra de una motocicleta de segunda para transportarse de su casa a su trabajo, pues le queda bastante retirado, lleva ya 04 creditos con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser muy responsable.
texts.en:
Jose Maria B. C. works at the Mayor's Office in Chinandega.  He has an arrangement with them whereby they deduct his repayments from his salary every two weeks.  He lives on the road to León.  He works as a watchman and has been working for 11 years.  He is married with one child and his wife works washing and ironing.

Mr B. C. is requesting this loan to buy a second-hand motorbike so that he can get to and from work since he is quite far away.  He has already had 4 loans with CEPRODEL and has shown himself to be very responsible.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es: Sra. Lisseth tiene 21 años de edad  oriunda de Santa Cruz el Torno  actualmente vive en la zona de Puerto Rico hace  12 años. Su Actividad es la venta de productos medicinales en la zona del torno y nueva terminal hace 3 años normalmente vende sus productos medicinales antes que salgan los buses, también ofrece sus productos en los buses, su estado civil separado hace 2 años y cuenta con 2 hijos a cargo,  El Destino del crédito es para la compra de productos medicinales por cantidad, es una persona joven pero muy  trabajadora que sola tiene que velar por la salud y educación de sus pequeños.   La Sra. se siente muy agradecida con emprender por la confianza depositada
texts.en: Mrs. Lisseth is 21 years old, she hails from Santa Cruz el Torno and at present she lives in the Puerto Rico area where she has lived for 12 years. She has sold medicinal products for some 3 years in the el Torno area and in a new bus terminal. She usually sells her medicinal products before the buses leave; she also offers her products on the buses. Mrs. Lisseth has been separated for 2 years and she has 2 children under her care. The loan will be used to buy medicinal products; she is young but she is a very hardworking person since she is alone and has to watch over the wellbeing and education of her children. She is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) for the trust given to her.

loans.use: To buy merchandize wholesale.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan K. is a 35-year-old man who lives and works in Sabirabad. He is married and has 2 young sons. Rovshan runs his own general store with the help of  his brother. He started his business in 2005. This is Rovshan's first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy more goods to sell in his store. His business is the only source of income for his family. Rovshan plans to open another store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Susana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Susana vive en casa de alquiler  con sus dos hijos. Ella quedo muy joven viuda cuenta que fue un golpe duro para ella, pero tenia que salir adelante, y tubo que buscar a que dedicarse ya que antes solo su esposo se dedicaba a la mantener el hogar,  ahora se dedica a la venta de pescado y  mariscos, lo hizo con el poco capital que tenia, poco a poco fue siendo conocida por restaurantes famosos. Ahora ella entrega al por mayor y menor, le va muy bien en esta actividad, pero no tiene suficiente espacio para poner los mariscos ya que estos le mandan desde Perú o Ecuador y es por ese motivo que solicito el crédito para comprar dos nuevas heladeras y así se mantengan frescos sus productos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susana lives in a rental house with her two children.  She was left a widow at a very early age.  She tells us that it was a very hard blow for her but that she had to get ahead and had to look for a business activity to make money since, up until that point, her husband had been the only one who supported their household financially.

Susana now she sells fish and seafood.  She set herself up with a bit of capital that she had and gradually became known by some famous restaurants.  Now she delivers her products wholesale and retail.  She is doing very well in this business but she doesn't have enough space for her seafood  since they send them from Peru or Ecuador.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy two new fridges to keep her products fresh.  She is grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy two fridges

loans.name: Los Solares 1 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is one of the members of Los Solares 1 (her community is called Plot 1). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, education, etc. in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, which is famous for its athletes and its sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry and other minor activities like tourism. Sonia is the mother of three children and, together with her husband, she has been able to proviD. the necessities for her family. 

Sonia is receiving her ninth loan. For each loan, she has maD. her payments on time and has maD. good investments. She is planning to invest her new loan to purchase new clothes for men, women and children. She is going to use her earnings to save and continue providing the necessities for her home. By saving regularly, she will be able to build a new home - this is her more difficult challenge. Her favorite activity is reading.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya Kibuga-Mpigi Group

texts.en: 34 year old S. Jalia is affiliated to Kyosimba onanya Kibuga group-Mpigi.  She has been running her retail shop in Mpigi town for ten years. At her shop she sells a variety of general merchandise retail commodities which are mostly of high preference to families around her operating area. Monthly this business generates her shillings 800,000. Jalia who is happily married with six kids has side coffee and ginger sells businesses. With this loan, Jalia says she is going to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell at her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Virginia P. Martínez de 29 años es propietaria de una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. Ella inicio con la venta de tajas con queso, tacos y enchiladas luego gracias a los préstamos invirtió en carne y pollo. 
Ella tiene la meta de invertir en otro negocio en futuro próximo con el fin de proporcionarle una  mejor calidad de vida a su hijo de 6 años.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Virginia P. Martínez is 29 years old and is an owner of a "fritanga" which is a fried food restaurant. She started out selling cheese slices, tacos, enchiladas, and was later able to buy meat and chicken thanks to a previous loan.
She has in mind growing another business in the future to be able to offer her children a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat and chicken.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael D. L. C. es un hombre D. 52 años que vive en el municipio D. Soledad, a 15 minutos D. BarranquilL., con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades D. 18 a 23 años;   allí tiene un negocio llamado “Panadería y Refresquería L. 12”  ubicado en el local D. L. misma casa,   donD. habita el con su familia, allí venD. frutas, refrescos, panes y carnes frías. Este negocio  el lo en el año 2007 cuando solo producía y vendía panes, posteriormente fue agregándole una refresquería  y con ello L. venta D. frutas y carnes. Los panes y derivados D. L. harina D. trigo que fabrica, solo los venD. en su panadería, L.  que se encuentra  bien posicionada; en su negocio, además D. Rafael,  trabajan un empleado, su esposa y una hija. El negocio tiene buen movimiento D. clientes, porque además D. ubicarse en esquina, en el sector funciona un colegio D. gran tamaño   y los estudiantes compran permanentemente.  Su margen D. contribución  es del 35% y en L. actualidad  presenta una utilidad neta que le permite cubrir su cuota esperada del crédito. Los gastos familiares y operativos son similares. Sus cuentas por pagar son bajas y es poca L. venta a crédito. L. mayor parte D. los activos totales los representan sus activos fijos. Tiene un bajo endeudamiento actual y todo a corto plazo, L. razón corriente es buena porque es poco el endeudamiento. L. rotación del inventario es bastante alta porque muchos D. los productos son perecederos. L. rentabilidad en ventas es del 21 %, por el alto margen D. contribución. El negocio presenta buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago.
 Su meta es adecuar mejor su refresquería con enseres y equipos que le permitan una atención efectiva. En L. actualidad acuD. a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo donD. aplica a su primer financiamiento a través D. L. línea credikiva, para comprar insumos al por mayor D. Panadería y refresquería, como harina D. trigo, azúcar, grasa y frutas;  con esta compra D. contado ganara descuentos y accederá a mejores ofertas lo cual augura una inversión exitosa.  Su sueño y gran desafío es tener un local propio para adecuarlo y brindar un servicio confortable, expandiendo especialmente L. refresquería D. tal manera,  que aumenten los ingresos D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael D. L. C. is a 52 year-old man who lives in the town of Soledad, 15 minutes from BarranquilL..  He lives with his wife and three children aged between 18 and 23.

Rafael has a store called 'Panadería y Refresquería L. 12' (Number 12 Bakery and Snack Bar) which is located in his family home.  He sells fruit, soft drinks, bread and cold meats.  He has had this business since 2007 when he only maD. and sold bread.  He later added a snack bar and started selling fruit and meat.  Rafael only sells the bread and wheat-flour-based products that he bakes in his bakery which is well positioned.  In addition to Rafael, an employee, his wife and one of his daughters also work in the business.  It has a good turnover of customers because, as well as being located on a corner, there is also a large school in the area and the students are always buying from him.

Rafael's contribution margin is 35% and he currently has a net profit that will allow him to cover his expected loan instalments.  His family and operating expenses are similar.  His accounts payable are low and he doesn't sell much on credit.  Most of his total assets are fixed assets.  He currently has  low debts and all are short term.  His working capital ratio is good because he has low debts.  His inventory turnover period is quite high because many of his products are perishable.  His profit on sales is 21% owing to his high contribution margin.  His business is very profitable and he has good creditworthiness.  His goal is to better equip his snack bar with fixtures and fittings that will allow him to proviD. a better service to his customers.

Rafael is approaching Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first loan through Kiva in order to buy bakery and snack bar supplies wholesale such as wheat flour, sugar, fat and fruit.  With this cash purchase, he will obtain discounts and will be able to access better offers.  This will make him a successful investment.  His dream and big challenge is to own his own premises that he can fit out in order to proviD. his customers with more comfortable service.  In particular, he would like to expand the snack bar to increase his business profits.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his bakery and snack bar such as wheat flour, sugar and fruit, wholesale

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Frances L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “God is Able.” She is 48 years old and married with 17 children between the ages of four and 31. Frances was only able to attend school through sixth grade.

For more than 25 years, Frances has been selling “fufu,” a local food that is made from cassava, in the Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of fufu to sell. Frances describes herself as a friendly woman whose goals are to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of fufu

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos  hijos  ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Elias  se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales cría en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente Luis tiene su mototaxi con el cual es más fácil la comercialización de sus animales ademas ofrece servicio de transporte de Olmos a sus caseríos. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Elias desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elias is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Elias' business is raising and selling animals.  He raises the animals on his property.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who visit his area.  Elias also owns a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting goods and / or passengers).  This makes the selling of his animals easier and he also offers transport services from Olmos to its surrounding villages.  With the money that he makes from these activities, he manages to get his family ahead in life.

Elias would like to expand his business, buying more animals and balanced feed so that he can increase his sales.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en:
Prisca K., who is in her early 40s, is married with three children. She has a business of selling liquid soap and toilet disinfectant. She has been in this business for two years and works from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. (just for six hours). She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Prisca's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to buy ingredients for her business. She sells her products on order -- her customers ring and make orders and they either collect them or she delivers to them herself. Her dream is to one day have a factory where she can be able to make a big amount of stock and make it easy for customers to come in and out instead of her going door-to-door.

Prisca will share this loan with her loan group, Kwembe, which has a total of 24 new members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Prisca is first on the left, sitting on a chair.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka M. is aged 27 years and has been in the farming business for ten years in her hometown of Kisii in South Rift, Kenya. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 4 years. Her farm produces tea, which she sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, and maize and tomatoes, which go to the local market.

Milka has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will help the family with nutrition and provide additional income to educate the children. She is glad the asset will improve the family status. 

Milka says fluctuating weather conditions are a challenge because they usually lead to destruction of farm produce. She adds that low market prices are also a challenge to the farmers due to reduced income.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol S., 40, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

S. sells groceries, earning an income of US $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in the city, earning an income of US $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $42 on food and US $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for one of her children to start a new business as a tuk tuk driver in the city. ( A tuk tuk is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for her child to start a new business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica P. is from Prenza Tangub City. She is 48 years old, and is married. To make a living, Monica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Monica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, dried fish and bagoong for sale. This will be Monica’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, dried fish and bagoong for sale.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yaneth de 50 años tiene un negocio a través del cual vende almuerzos, ella vive en el barrio los Calamares,   es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 28 años de edad, familia con la que sueña un futuro lleno de prosperidad.
Hace 10 años  limpió un lugar donde estaba ubicado un basurero,  le puso una capa de cemento e inició vendiendo sopas  en ese sitio, muy pronto los clientes empezaron a reconocerla, hasta que logró organizar un kiosco y posteriormente aprovechó su tiempo libre para vender minutos a celulares y adicionalmente agregó dulces enfocando su mercado también a los niños, actividades con las que empezó a producir otros ingresos. En la actualidad planea hacer desayunos porque sabe que hay un mercado potencial  l que nadie ha explorado y  este servicio no existe   en la zona, esta es la razón, esta es la razón  por la cual acude a su credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus deliciosos desayunos y obtendrá descuentos por compras en efectivo y por volumen que le permitirán disminuir un poco más sus costos de producción. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta porque para invertir debe obtener unas utilidades superiores por encima de sus gastos personales y en esto está trabajando persistentemente hasta lograrlo.
texts.en: Yaneth is 50 years old and she has a business through which she sells breakfast foods. She lives in the community of Los Calamares. She is married and she has 4 children aged between 11 and 28. She dreams of having a prosperous future with her family. Ten years ago she cleaned what was a garbage dump. She put in a cement slab and she started selling soups from this location. Very soon her clients started to known her. She even managed to set up a kiosk and later she decided to profit from her time by selling prepaid cellular phone cards and sweets to target children as her market. She started to earn additional income through these businesses. Currently she plans on serving breakfast because she knows there is a potential market that no one has explored. This service does not exist in the region and for this reason she has requested a Kiva loan. It is her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase products and ingredients she uses to prepare her delicious breakfast foods. She will obtain discounts for purchases paid for in cash and for the volume bought. She will be able to decrease her production costs a little more. Her greatest challenge is the small working capital she has to work with. She wants to invest in the purchase of better tools in addition to covering her personal expenses. And for this she is persistently working to achieve.

loans.use: to purchase products and ingredients she needs to prepare breakfast foods.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Alecia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Alecia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 51 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Melchor, who works with her in the business.  She is a mother of three children, all of whom are in college. By the grace of God, Consuelo has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level.  This has been dream for most poor Filipino parents like Consuelo, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance that parents can leave to their children.

Consuelo operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.  Consuelo's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue  the operations of her business, Consuelo is requesting a loan for Php13,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Consuelo dreams for her children to find a stable job after finishing college and also for her business to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: C9600 Kabare Ii Group

texts.en:
Dorothee is 41 years old, married and the mother of six children aged between 6 months and 18 years old. Dorothee is the leader of the group called "KABARE II". Her business is well-known, selling vegetables and has been in operation for 20 years, working from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She currently employs five people to help her. In the photo, Dorothee is the second person from the right.

Dorothee and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their vegetable businesses by purchasing more good vegetables for sale. They will reinvest additional profits into their businesses and save money to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more good vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Maman de 03 enfants, Ayawa revend des draps et torchons au  Grand Marché de Lomé. Ce prêt l’aidera à acheter plus de marchandises. Son conjoint est déclarant en douanes elle a démarré en 1996.
texts.en: The mother of three children, Ayawa re-sells sheets and dish cloths at the large market of Lomé.  This loan will help her to purchase more merchandise.  Her spouse is a customs officer.  She started her business in 1996.

loans.use: to purchase dish towels and sheets

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a farmer who has lived in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She has two single children who are enrolled in school. Her husband works a driver in a private company who serves tourist-service. He could be earned about $8 per day for his job. 
Currently, her husband always goes to achieve his work by hiring motor taxi, and sometime he missed his work because of nothing vehicle to travel. To solve this problem,    
Mrs. Sam and her husband are looking for a loan in amount of $600 in order to purchase second motorbike. With this, it will decrease the traveling expense and also to make easier with their traveling need when they need to go anywhere.

For her future expectation, Mrs. Sam wishes to buy a cow for breeding, to reconstruct a bigger house, and to send her kids to study in university.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Irene pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 49  años  y tiene dos  hijos de 22 y 15 años, el mayor es estudiante en la carrera de técnico en electricidad industrial y el menor es un niño especial con problemas mentales el cual demanda mucha atención.
Inicia su negocio de venta de abarrotes, pero todo era pérdida no generaba muchas ganancias, debido a que su negocio está ubicado en una zona alejada, de esta manera opta y decide cambiar de giro y comprar un motocarro con un capital  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que  le sirvió de cuota inicial, vehículo que es utilizado para transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, por lo que está muy contenta ya que las ganancias le sirven para ir pagando poco a poco el precio del vehículo. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, financiará la compra de un motocarro  más, que le servirá para mejorar sus ingresos  a través del alquiler diario de estos vehículos.
Irene es una  mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia. .
texts.en:
Sra. Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children (ages 22 and 15). Her older child is studying for a technical degree in order to become an industrial electrician. The younger one is a special needs child who experiences mental problems and requires a great deal of attention.

Irene started selling groceries, but this business was a total loss since she was not able to generate much income as a result of being located in a remote area. She decided to change businesses and purchased a motorcar. Irene used capital of 300 PEN as a down payment. She uses the vehicle for transporting passengers around the city. Irene is very pleased with the income it has generated and it has allowed her to gradually pay off the vehicle. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy another motorcar so that she can improve her income by making it available for rent.

Irene is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a vending stall at the market where she can sell groceries. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to earn more income and improve the quality of life of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcar.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Mrs. Phy is 25 years old. She is living with her old mother. She now generates her income by selling vermicelli in one market near her commune. From this business, she earns about $4 per day. Taking time from this business, she also works as a pig raiser. She would like to expand on her raising pig business but the lack of money to buy feed has led her to request some funds through HKL partner, with Kiva, with the purpose of purchasiong feed. She said that this loan is very useful for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a young man of 28 years. He is a married father with one child.

He is a professional teacher in Bushenyi, and he has taught for three solid years.

Leonard, like most teachers in Uganda, is hard pressed to make ends meet out of his monthly remuneration. He also subsists on side income from a modest farming business.

He is seeking this loan to buy corrugated iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, age 31, owns and manages a variety store in the village where she lives with her husband and their only child. She has been engaged in this business for almost six years and earns a profit of PhP 13,000 a month, which she utilizes primarily for the food, clothing, and school fees of her child. 

Margie believes that "success is the fruit of hard work and poverty is the consequence of being lazy." She aims to improve the business and make it a more viable source of income so that the family's standard of living can be improved. She wants more than anything to offer her child a bright future. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 35,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, cup noodles, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help considerably to improve the business. She hopes that through her patience and sacrifices, she can make her business grow and flourish in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, cup noodles, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Kuluipa's Group

texts.en:
Kuluipa is the treasurer of this group. She is 47 years old and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons and two daughters. The older daughter works in Bishkek and the other children study at school. 

Six years ago Kuluipa saved 3000 soms from her salary and purchased two animals for breeding.  Since that time she has engaged in livestock breeding.  

At the moment, she plans to repair their house, but she needs additional funds to purchase building materials.  Kuluipa applied for a loan to make the repairs. 

In the future, Kuluipa wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and lives in Upper Rizal, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 

Margarita has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,0000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks. 

Margarita has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future,  Margarita hopes to have a food stall. She is a hard-working mother and MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, celibataire avec deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 17 et 21 ans. Elle se lance dans la papeterie et vente des fournitures scolaires  très jeune , quand elle arrête ses etudes en classe de 1ere.

Elle a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise tel que des cartons de papiers rame, des cartons de cahiers, des stylos de tous genre, des feutres...
Son étalage est située non loin des bureaux administratifs et des differents écoles primaires , collèges et instituts techniques, il a des clients très fidèles depuis des années qui bénéficient de ses services et qui prennent parfois a crédits.
Très motivée,avec un bon caractère , elle veut aller loin et elle est entrain de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses deux enfants qui sont déjà a l'université.
texts.en:
This client, 41 and single, has two children aged 17 and 21. She got into selling office supplies and such at a very young age, when she left off her studies in high school.  

She has already received several loans, has reimbursed them successfully, and put aside considerable savings. With this fourth loan, she is going to expand her stock of merchandise, for example, boxes of paper, cartons of notebooks, pens of all sorts and felt-tip pens, etc. 

She displays her wares not far from the administrative offices and various primary school, middle schools, and technology institutes, and she has customers who have been buying from her for years and who sometimes buy on credit. 

Very motivated and possessing a good character, she means to go far and she is taking over paying education fees for her two children who are already at university.

loans.use: Purchasing reams of paper, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paints, markers, file folders, and boxes of pencils.

loans.name: Raylyn Group

texts.en:
Raylyn is 26 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamis City. She is married and has two children - one school-aged and one adult-aged. Raylyn has operated a shop selling canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. for almost one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Raylyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to save money for her children’s education. Raylyn is the leader of a two person group, with each member having her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en:
Chamreoun is a widow and she is also pregnant. She lives with her parents, brother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamreoun is a weaver. She is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business. He is a house constructor.  

Photo: Chamreoun is spinning.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of them are currently in school. For the past six years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items for resale, and will help Frank to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells children’s dresses and panties at Brasi near Abura as a peddler. The picture shows a display of the dresses she sells. Adjoa is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa has been selling dresses and panties for nine years. She assists her partner in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to purchase more dresses and panties to sell.

loans.use: purchase more dresses and panties for sale.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 30 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сабохат более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Sabohat is a resident of the city Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old and divorced. She has one child. Sabohat has worked with crop growing for more than 15 years. She owns a small plot of land by her house, where she sows wheat. 

Sabohat takes a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé  de 27ans. Il est marié å un/e couturière. Il a 01enfant.
Kokou travaille comme soudeur depuis 2004. Il travaille seul et achète les matériaux de travail à Lomé. Il a un atelier dans un quartier de la place.
Kokou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de travail pour mieux répondre à ses clients. Il veut voir son activité prospérer afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou, 27, is married to a seamstress. He has 1 child.
Kokou has been working as a welder since 2004. He works alone and buys his supplies in Lomé, where he has a workshop.
Kokou is applying for a first loan from WAGES in order to buy welding supplies and better meet the needs of his customers. He would like to see his business prosper so that he can better take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies.

loans.name: Sabali 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec ARAMA, 1ere assise de la droite vers gauche  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80000FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Rabie

texts.en:
Madam Rabie A. was born in 1963 at Danyi Konda in South-West of TOGO. She is married to a driver and is a mother of four (04) children. Her husband was early unemployed obliging thus Madam A. to face alone the family charges with her very derisory financial means. Despite the moral assistance of her unemployed husband and with all the desire of which she used to show the proof, Madam A. does not succeeding to provide for the family needs until the moment where she had benefited from a credit of $550 which she repaid without incident. This credit has allowed him to strengthen her activity and even to rent a shop in the big market of Hédzranawoé within the framework of her trade of foodstuffs. Equipped with a well appreciable attitude and aptitude, Madam A. was very early found as a good manager and very devoted for the success of her trade which she exercising very well. Currently, Madam A. is requesting a credit of $900 to constitute a sufficient storage of foodstuffs (pasta, rice, cans or tins of foods, oil, etc.) to respond to her customary needs for these coming year-end feasts. It goes without saying that this financial contribution would have a very positive impact on the trade profitability and will especially help Madam A. to face more and more her family charges.

Madame A. Rabie est née en 1963 à Danyi-Konda au Sud-Ouest du TOGO. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari s’est vite retrouvé sans emploi obligeant ainsi Madame A. à faire face seule aux charges familiales avec ses moyens financiers très dérisoires. Malgré le soutien moral de son mari chômeur et avec toute la volonté dont elle fait preuve, Madame A. n’arrivait pas à subvenir aux besoins familiaux jusqu’au moment où elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit de $550 qu’elle avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé sans incident. Ce crédit lui a permis de renforcer son activité et même de louer une boutique dans le grand marché de Hédzranawoé dans le cadre de son commerce des produits alimentaires. Dotée d’une attitude et d’une aptitude bien appréciables, Madame A. s’est vite révélée comme une bonne gestionnaire et très dévouée pour la réussite de son commerce qu’elle maîtrise bien. Madame A. demande actuellement un crédit de $900 pour se constituer un stock suffisant de produits alimentaires (pâtes alimentaires, riz, boîtes de conserve, huile, etc. pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle pour cette fêtes de fin d’année. Il va sans dire que cet apport financier aura un impact très positif sur la rentabilité du commerce et surtout aidera Madame A. à faire face davantage aux charges familiales.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (pasta, rice, cans or tins of foods, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy metallic pots to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman S. is thirty-five years old and married with five children.  He started carpentry work twenty years ago but his business was interrupted by the eleven-year civil war in his country that ended eight years ago.  Osman runs a small carpentry workshop with about four apprentices who help him with the work.  He makes chairs, beds, tables and school furniture.  Osman sometimes receives offers of contracts but can not take them on due to lack of capital to purchase enough lumber.  He is therefore requesting his second loan, this time of $350, to purchase lumber and to employ more two apprentices after their training.

loans.use: Purchase lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Sayaad Gulam Hussin

texts.en: S. Gulam Hussin lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an old man who has a  retail shop and he has good work experience. He has a lots of clients and he needs money to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy potatoes, onions, garlic, radishes, and beets. This will help him to make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy with AFSG group loans.

loans.use: To buy produce for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her rice-selling business

loans.name: Ebere

texts.en: Ebere I. is 28 years old, married and has a child. She comes from Afromedia, in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drugs and provisions. She has been in business since 2002 and needs the loan to buy more drugs and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and provisions

loans.name: Ant

texts.en: Mrs. Ant S., age 24, works with her husband operating a taxi to make on average $6 each day of profit. She has two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a new car to replace the old, broken down taxi. A more reliable car will allow them to operate the taxi business more efficiently and save them money that would have been spent on the car repairs.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr:
Born on January 29, 1960 in Cotonou, Mrs. Georgette A. is married and the mother of two children. She prepares and sells a type of dried beans that is greatly appreciated by motor-taxi drivers (commonly known as Zemidjan) and by workmen. She manages to attract more than 300 customers a day which allows her to do a substantial business. Unfortunately, she is living with a polygamous husband who does nothing to take care of her. She remains solely responsible for all her family's needs. It is for this reason that she is obliged to request a loan so that she can retain her customer base and expand her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 29/01/1960 à Cotonou, Dame Geogette A. est mariée et mère de 02 enfants . Elle prépare et vend du haricot; un met fortement apprécié par les conducteurs de taxi moto (communément appelés ZEMIDJAN) et par les ouvriers .Elle attire à elle plus de 300 clients par jour; ce qui lui permet de réaliser un important chiffre d’affaire. Malheureusement elle vit avec un mari polygame qui ne s’ occupe nullement de sa condition de vie .Elle reste et demeure la seule à régler tous les problèmes familiaux .C’est ce qui l'a obligé à recourir au crédit pour maintenir sa clientèle et renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 5 sacks of dried beans, 10 liters of palm oil, 1 bag of manioc semolina, and two sacks of voandzou (a type of groundnut)

05 sacs de haricot, 10 litres d’huile de palme, 01 sac de gari, 02 sacs de voandzou

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa C. V.’s business is located in the district of San Rafael, province of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. For a living she has been manufacturing and selling cheese for the past year and a half, and the production is between 30 and 35 pieces daily.

With the loan of S/.2,000.00 ($700) to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a new refrigerator as the one she owns is not in good condition and this kind of equipment is very important in her line of business to preserve the cheese. Rosa is 42 years old and has two children. She learned to manufacture cheese from her parents when she was very young and has now put learning into practice. Her future plans are to adapt premises for the exclusive production of these products as she is now doing it at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. V. tiene su negocio ubicado en el distrito de San Rafael, provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la elaboración casera y venta de quesos, es un negocio que inicio desde hace un año y medio diariamente producen entre de 30 a 35 quesos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprara una nueva refrigeradora, ya que la que tiene actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones, ya que este es un equipo muy importante en su negocio para la buena conservación de los quesos. Rosa tiene 42 años y 02 hijos, aprendió a elaborar quesos desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres, ahora esta poniendo en practica lo aprendido, tiene como aspiración hasta el próximo año implementar un local para la elaboración exclusiva de estos productos ya que por ahora lo esta realizando en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator to preserve the production of cheese.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena T. is a widow. She started her business because she could not cover the expenses of her home with the pension income from her husband. She could not even cover the basic costs because the pension was not enough. She decided to get into something that would suit her age and increase her financial income, that is how, eight years ago, she started selling food from a cart outside of a school. Later she rented a small space and that is where she is currently operating.

She needs a financial boost of USD $750 that she will repay in six months, to buy furniture since she needs tables, chairs and benches to improve her service to her customers. With your help, Elena will continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Elena T. es un mujer viuda, emprendió su negocio porque no alcanzaba a pagar los gastos de su hogar con el dinero de la pensión de su esposo, ni siquiera podían cubrir lo básico, debido a que la pensión es insuficiente, decidió ocuparse en algo acorde a su edad que le permitiera aumentar los ingresos económicos fue así como hace 8 años inicio vendiendo en un carrito de comida afuera de una escuela, después rento un local pequeño y ahí es donde opera actualmente su negocio.

Ella requiere un apoyo económico por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mobiliario ya que le hacen falta mesas, sillas y bancas para aumentar el servicio a su clientela. Con tu ayuda Elena podrá seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 40, is married with five children (ages 22, 20, 16, 10, and 13). Five years ago, Asha began her business of selling tomatoes, incense, and seafood. She works from 8am to 2pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

Asha hopes for a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She is a member of loan group Tusonge Mbele whose members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of tomatoes, incense, and seafood

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama N., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. She has a commercial business consisting of buying peanuts, honey, and lemons and selling them retail. With her income, she helps improve the living conditions, health, and education of the children. Adama is one of the best in her group and wants to maintain her business. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Adama N., 42 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle mène une activité de commerce qui consiste à acheter des arachides, du miel et du citron et revendre. Avec ses revenus elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Adama est une des meilleures de son groupe et veut maintenir son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in foods

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells clothing that she has sewn, as well as fabric. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Doris and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Happy's Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Happy is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 5. She has owned a small general store since 2007. She works from 7am to 6pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Happy now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma, Laurencia, Watende, and Rahima.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.en:
Greetings from Immaculee in her hair salon business in Kigali, Rwanda. Immaculee is 51 years old and married with four children.
