Viven por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, esta ciudad se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Rosa vive por la comunidad de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 9, 8, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo trabaja en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Rosa trabaja realizando la limpieza de varias casas hace 6 meses, labora de lunes a viernes solo medio día ya que el resto de su tiempo lo dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar.
 
El dinero de su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar algunos acabados a su casa. En el banco comunal se encuentra en su sexto crédito y es una socia fundadora del banquito.

Su meta es terminar su casa y  colocar un negocio en la misma.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. Son las fotos de María josé y María Aquilina.

Los tres niños de la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo community bank is made up of 11 women who work in different business activities which have enabled them to contribute to their household finances and get their families ahead in life.  The ladies are very kind and friendly people who live in Yanaturo district, in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the third most important city in the country and is a mixture of colonial and modern.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Rosa lives in Yanaturo community, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children aged 9, 8, 7 and 4.  Her eldest three children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa works as a cleaner, cleaning other people's homes.  She has been in this business for six months and works from Monday to Friday.  She only works half days as she spends the rest of her time looking after her children and her house.

Rosa will invest her loan money in buying construction supplies so that she can do some work on her house.  She is applying for her sixth loan through her community bank and she is one of the bank's founding members.

Rosa's goal is to finish off her house and set up a business there.

The small photos attached to the main group photo are those of two members who, for work reasons, couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.  They are photos of María José and María Aquilina.  The three children in the photo belong to the members.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ainakan's Group

texts.en:
Ainakan is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a coordinating manager. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son, and both children are employed. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 35000 soms Ainakan purchased a pavilion and began to provide hairdressing services. At the moment her monthly profit is 7400 soms. Ainakan applied for the loan because she needs some additional funds to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for celebrating her grandchild’s birth. In the future she wants to save money for purchasing a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to assist with building their businesses; also, to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for a celebration.

loans.name: Abatiganda No 6 Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel est  agri-éleveur né au Rwanda. Il est membre du groupe Abatiganda no 6. Il est marié, il  a 38 ans, il a 6 enfants entre 1 an et 10 ans et trois enfants vont à l’école,  il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a cinq  ans des études primaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs en vue d’accroitre la production. Sa vision il voudrait devenir le grand producteur du riz. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais du minerval pour ses enfants et les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel is an agricultural producer born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Abatiganda No 6 group. He is 38 years old and married. He has 6 children between the ages of 1 and 10 of whom three attend school. He has no employees. He has completed five years of primary education. This is his second loan with ACB.He will use his credit to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay for labor. He does not expect any difficulties with the repayment of his loan. His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the number of fields in order to increase his production. His ambition is to become a big rice producer. For his family he would like to pay the school fees for his children and medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and pay for labor

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Kanyshai, 49, is the treasurer of this group. Due to a terrible accident that happened to her husband, who later became disabled, Kanyshai became the main breadwinner of the family. She has been sewing national clothing and selling traditional home appliances for 15 years. With the help of her 17-year-old daughter she manages to attract additional income to the family budget by cattle breeding and reselling. At the moment, her monthly income is 3,000 soms, which helps towards the construction of her house. Her initial investment in the business was 10,000 soms. Her requested loan will be invested in the business by purchasing raw materials for sewing.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hard-working 31-year-old man. He and his wife have a five-year-old child who is enrolled in school. For the past year and a half, he has been providing tailoring services to make ends meet. His alternative source of income comes from working as a matatu driver. Previously, he used to operate a cafeteria. 

Over the next five years, he hopes to own more than one tailoring shop. This goal is in line with his dream to become a major distributor of clothing materials.

He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances well.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Winlight

texts.en:
Winlight is 23 years old and supports his mother. He buys and sells second-hand clothing. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.

Winlight has borrowed a loan of KES10,000 from KADET. This being his first loan, he hopes to use the loan to purchase a bale of t-shirts for resale. 

The profits will be used to purchase more clothing for the business. He hopes to live a happy life and to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand t-shirts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria forma parte del Banco comunal “Antu Domo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas por catalogo, desde hace 10 años, comenzó vendiendo en una empresa que tenía una sucursal en la ciudad de Temuco, actualmente trabaja directamente con una empresa de joyas de la ciudad de Santiago, por lo que en ésta compra su mercadería, que además exhibe sus joyas en la ciudad de Temuco una vez al mes. En estos catálogos ofrece diferentes productos. Paralelamente también cuenta con otro negocio que es la venta de productos de mar preparados, listos para servir, estos productos los compra en la ciudad de Puerto Montt, posteriormente los envasa, etiqueta y entrega en locales, eventos y restaurantes. Estos productos son exclusivos. Su horario en ambos negocios es flexible.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente cadenas, pendientes, pulseras, colgantes y anillos, joyas de la temporada primavera verano.
Sus metas para su negocio son cursar un curso de orfebrería para realizar sus propios e innovadores diseños y espera también abrir un taller que ofrezca sus joyas. 
Gloria vive junto a su hijo menor, el trabaja de manera independiente. Sus sueños son poder independizarse económicamente y que pueda solventar sus gastos solo con el negocio de la joyería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha brindado la oportunidad y confianza. Las capacitaciones y reuniones le han permitido conocer experiencias de sus compañeras del grupo del Banco comunal. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the "Antu Domo" community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She has been selling jewelry through catalogs for 10 years.

Gloria started out selling jewelry in a company that had a branch in the city of Temuco.  She currently works directly with a jewelry company in the city of Santiago.  She buys her merchandise from them and displays her jewelry in the city of Temuco once a month.  She sells different products from the catalogs.  In parallel with this, Gloria also has another business selling seafood which is prepared and ready to serve.  She buys these products in the town of Puerto Montt and then packages them, puts labels on them and delivers them to stores, events and restaurants.  These products are exclusive.  Her working hours for both businesses are flexible.

Gloria will use her loan to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings: Spring and Summer season jewelry.

Gloria's goal for her business is to attend a course to learn how to work precious metals so that she can make her own, innovative designs.  She also hopes to open a store where she can sell her jewelry.

Gloria lives together with her youngest son who works independently.  Her dreams is to be able to become financially independent so that she can cover her expenses herself through her jewelry business.  The training sessions and meetings have allowed her to learn from the experiences of her fellow community bank members.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the area there are a number of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna which can be found in nearby nature reserves.  We should point out that 50% of the Mapuche (the native people of our country) live in this region.

loans.use: to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings - Spring and Summer season jewelry

loans.name: Katcha's Group

texts.en: Katcha is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and five sons. The youngest son is at school, two sons went to work in Russia and the other children are married and live separately with their families. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. In order to earn additional money for their livelihood, Katcha sells dairy products. Her husband breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price after being fattened. With money received from the loan, Katcha wants to purchase more farm animals in order to expand their family business. In the future, with the profits gained from this activity, she wants to purchase construction materials for building a house for their son. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulzodahon's Group

texts.en:
Gulzodahon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a builder. Her husband works in Russia and each month he transfers to Gulzodahon about 15,000 soms. She takes care of a daughter and a son; both children are preschool age (under seven). Gulzodahon works as a teacher at school. Her monthly salary is 9,000 soms. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, the family cultivates agricultural products. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizers. In the future, Gulzodahon plans to rent a piece of land for farming and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nouen

texts.en:
Nouen (pictured here in the pink shirt) is 30 years old. She makes and sells baskets to earn a living. Her income is $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns an income of $2.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying and working. Every month, Noren spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $400 to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale. This loan will help her to be able to bring her baskets to other provinces where she can get higher prices than when she is limited to selling them in her own village. 

Her goal is to enable both her children to continue their education through university level.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale in other provinces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy peak powdered milk (one carton @ Le420,000), soft drinks (five crates @ Le30,000), stout drink (10 crates @ Le88,000), beer (five crates @ Le 49,000), pure drinking water (100 bundles @ Le3,000), and amoxicillin syrup (two cartons @ Le500,000).

loans.name: Nagdali

texts.en: Nagdali is a very hardworking man who has for the last 15 years earned a living by raising cattle and selling milk to local dairy wholesalers. He is married and has three children, two daughters and one son. He is seeking a loan of 1,200 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy more animals to raise and feed for them to eat. He believes that this will allow him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. This will be his fifth loan from our organization.

loans.use: to enlarge his herd and buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la producción y comercialización de alimentos como: comida rápida, fritos y comida típica de la región. Desde hace unos meses su negocio ha progresado, pues las ventas han aumentado y proporcionalmente sus ingresos, sin embargo actualmente solicita un prestamos con el cual comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos y hacer algunas adecuaciones locativas en la cocina, pues en época de fin de año las ventas y los clientes se incrementan y Angela no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir al por mayor y adecuar la cocina, es conciente que así su calidad de vida mejorará pues prestará un mejor servicio, la capacidad de producción será mayor y tendrá mas clientes satisfechos con la comida que Angela les ofrece.
texts.en: Ángela is an enterprising woman who prepares meals to sell.  She prepares fast food, fried snacks and traditional regional dishes.  Her business has been making progress the last few months because sales have increased and her income has done so proportionately too.  However, she is asking for loans at present to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some improvements in her kitchen because at the end of the year the number of customers grows and sales increase and Ángela does not have the necessary capital to stock up at wholesale and to equip her kitchen.  She is conscious that her quality of life will improve because she’ll provide better service; production capacity will also be greater and she’ll have more customers satisfied with the food she offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some kitchen improvements.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 10 лет. Он выращивает пшеницы, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Также он занимается скотоводством. Кроме этого он имеет дополнительный доход, который предоставляет услуги стройки домов. Дилмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью он хочет ремонтировать свой дом. Дилмурод запрашивает займ для покупки семена и скота.
texts.en: Dilmurod is married and is a loving father of one child.  Dilmurod has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  He grows wheat and then sells it at a more profitable price.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Besides, he has an additional income from providing housing construction services.  Dilmurod wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  He then wants to use this profit to make repairs to his house.  Dilmurod is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, and married with one child. 

Madelyn owns and operates a business providing trysikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 61 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. Perla has a buy and sell business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month from this business. Perla has requested a loan to buy used clothes to sell.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years, since October 2007. In the future Perla hopes to have her own space in the market for her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Awak

texts.en:
Awak is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. For five years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.

Awak requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and sugar. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice, aged 36, is married to Monica. They are blessed with four children aged between six and fifteen years. Maurice runs a hotel and a retail shop that have been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other supplies for the shop. Maurice hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for work and complete one of the orders

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is 50 years old and married to Johnson. They have four children living in a rural area – Rukungiri District. She is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 with the purpose of improving her banana plantation through mulching to generate more yield. Her agricultural business has helped her to pay tuition for her children of whom two are at the university. Her dream has been to increase her banana production, now standing at 200 bunches per month, to 500 with the help of a financial boost from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE. In the photograph are Kellen, her husband and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Josiane's Group

texts.fr: WANGNINA est un groupement composé de vingt personnes qui vivent dans le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Josiane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Josiane est âgée de 30 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Josiane est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Josiane et son mari. Pour cette raison, Josiane vend du riz et de l’huile végétale à son domicile depuis huit ans. Josiane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Josiane sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement WANGNINA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 43-year-old single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Agnes lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a very hard working woman who dreams of having a stable income-generating business. As a result, she owns houses for renting, supplemented by incomes earned from salary. She is seeking credit to complete her commercial house.

loans.use: to complete her commercial house.

loans.name: Novisssi

texts.en:
N. from Ahonkpè is a solidarity fellowship comprising twelve (12) women and created four (04) years ago. Its target is improving the living conditions of its members through economic activities, education, cultural and social activities, the creation of solidarity within the fellowship and mutual assistance to members. The members are in the 26-52 age group. All members are illiterate except the secretary that manages administrative and bookkeeping documents. The fellowship already received three credits of $400;$1000, and $1500 that were all reimbursed smoothly. Just like the entire Ahonkpè village, this group of women is confronted with a serious problem of potable water. The consequences are very dramatic in a village where child mortality rate is very high. The main drinking water source is a stagnant water pool exposed to all sort of water born diseases. So they had the interesting humanitarian idea of realising a drilling with views to providing the village with potable water to guarantee the health of the population chiefly the children. On that purpose, the female fellowship “NOVISSI of Ahonkpè” applied for a credit of $ 2000 to achieve its project of water drilling in order to sell water to the entire population of the village. Financing this project is not only an economic action but also a humanitarian one: it will help contribute to the reduction of the child mortality rate in the village of Ahonkpè, in the suburban area of Lomé.

NOVISSI de Ahonkpè est un groupe de solidarité constitué de douze (12) femmes créé il y a quatre (04) ans. Il a pour objectif, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres par l’exercice des activités économiques, éducatrices, culturelles et sociales, créer une solidarité en son sein et faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. L’âge des membres varie entre 26 ans et 52 ans. Tous les membres sont analphabètes à l’exception de la secrétaire qui tient les documents administratifs et comptables. Le groupement a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectivement de $400, $1000 et $1500 qui sont tous bien remboursés sans incident. Ce groupe de femme tout comme le village de Ahonkpè est confronté au problème sérieux d’eau potable. Les conséquences sont très dramatiques dans ce village où le mortalité enfantine est très élevé. La principale eau de consommation est un point d’eau stagnante exposé à toute sorte de maladie hydrique. Alors, elles ont eu cette idée géniale et humanitaire de faire un forage afin de doter le village d’eau potable pour garantir la bonne santé de la population surtout celle des enfants. A cet effet, le groupement féminin « NOVISSI de Ahonkpè » sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour réaliser son projet de forage dont l’eau sera vendue à la population. Financer ce projet, est un acte non seulement économique mais plutôt humanitaire : contribuer à la réduction du taux de mortalité enfantine dans le village de Ahonkpè, banlieue de Lomé.

loans.use: to realise the drilling

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando A., 32 years of age and a native of Nampula, did not attend school beyond the 5th grade because of the war. He arrived in the province of Maputo in the company of his oldest sibling in 1995 and encountered the necessity of starting a small business in an ambulatory regime. Later, he acknowledged this endeavor as a good idea now that the conditions of starting a business had already materialized in a fixed location, also because he had married and needed to better organize his life. Today he is a father of 2 children. Through his neighbors he obtained information about the services provided by Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he approached and solicited an initial low-cost loan. He was able to open a bank account and start a small savings in case of an emergency. Right now, he employs 4 people and supports the basic familial expenses. With this loan he intends to expand his business by diversifying the products he sells. His business’ impact on the community is a positive one: he provides employment for himself, his wife and his sister-in-law; he places the product as close as possible to the consumers of his village. His future plans include expanding the business and offering employment to more people in the community.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando A. de 32 anos de idade, natural de Nampula por causa de guerra não conseguiu estudar para alem da 5 classe. Chegou na província de Maputo na companhia do seu irmão mais velho em 1995 e viu a necessidade de iniciar um pequeno negócio em regime ambulatório mais tarde achou por bem e já criada as condições de fazer o negócio no local fixo também porque já tinha se casado e precisava organizar-se melhor. Hoje é pai de 2 filhos e conta que através dos vizinhos obteve a informação sobre os serviços que a HLUVUKU ADSEMA presta à população de Boane, tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro empréstimo num valor bastante reduzido tendo em conta as capacidades de financiamento da instituição. Conseguiu abrir uma conta bancária e começou a fazer pequenas poupanças para os momentos de crise. Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, suporta as despesas básicas da sua família. Com o este valor pretende ampliar o negócio diversificar os produtos de venda. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na sua comunidade, providencia emprego para ele próprio, esposa e cunhada. Coloca o produto, mais próximo do consumidor do seu bairro. Tem como planos de fazer crescer o negócio e dar emprego mais pessoas da comunidade.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the resources needed to start his flower farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his Jaggery (brown sugar) stocks

loans.name: Rodiyah

texts.id:
From her hobby cooking, finally Rodiyah was able to work independently and open a food stall in her home, with a capital of only Rp 300,000 (about US $33.00)/day, Rodiyah was able to collect a profit of about Rp 75,000 (about $8.00)/day from her sales of: rice, various kinds of small dishes, vegetables, drinks, and other various small selection of other light meals. The business that she worked since 10 years was barely enough to pay for her daily household expenses, and pay for schooling of her three children. Rodiyah opens her foodstall from daily form 09:00 to 23:00, serving mostly student renters who live in the same location as Rodiyah. The funds she will receive from DINARI will be used by Rodiyah to buy  a small push cart to sell meat-balls that her husband would use to sell those meatballs around the neighborhood, and therefore increase the household income for daily expenses and pay for the children schooling.

__________________

Dari hobinya memasak akhirnya Rodiyah mempunyai usaha sendiri yaitu membuka warung makan ditempat tinggalnya, dengan modal 300.000 rupiah/hari Rodiyah mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 75.000 rupiah/hari dari hasil jualannya berupa; nasi, berbagai macam lauk-pauk, sayur-sayuran, minuman dan makanan kecil lainnya. Usaha yang ditekuninya Sejak 10 tahun yang lalu ini mampu mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, bahkan menyekolahkan ketiga anaknya. Rodiyah membuka warungnya dari pukul 09.00 sampai pukul 23.00, para pembelinya adalah anak-anak kost yang tinggal selokasi dengan Rodiyah. Dana yang diterima dari DINARI dipakai oleh Rodiyah untuk membeli rombong bakso (gerobak bakso) yang nantinya akan dipakai suaminya untuk berjualan bakso keliling sehingga dapat mendongkrak pendapatan rumah tangga mereka untuk kebutuhan setiap hari dan membiayai anak-anak sekolah.

loans.use:
To buy Food ingredients and a small push cart to sell meat-balls
___________
Untuk membeli bahan-bahan makanan serta membeli Rombong Bakso.

loans.name: Lucrecia Yrayra

texts.es:
Lucrecia is hard working and optimistic, and her charisma and responsibility have made her an excellent seamstress and her work of high-quality. She began her business seven years ago, motivated by one of her aunts who inspired her to study cutting and sewing and gave her confidence that she would be good at it. Lucrecia is a native of Arequipa who moved to Sicaya when she got married, and now lives in her husband’s parents’ house. She is very satisfied with her work because it allows her to care for her little daughter. Through recommendations, she has been able to earn contracts with educational institutes for sporting uniforms, and this allows her to pay for her daily home expenses. Lucrecia performs her work in a small sewing shop in her home; among her many dreams is one of opening a small shop downtown with a line of sports clothing. To keep on with her work, she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her shop and in the purchase of fabric for sportswear. Help this young mother continue on her path to success with your important contribution, and she will be able to increase her happiness and her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lucrecia es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, su gran carisma y responsabilidad en sus trabajos han permitido que ella se desempeñe como una excelente costurera, gracias a esto realiza trabajos de excelente calidad; hace siete años empezó a desempeñarse en esta actividad motivada por una de sus tías que la animó a estudiar corte y confección dándole mucha seguridad de que ella podía ser muy buena en esta actividad.Lucrecia es natural de Arequipa y viene a radicar a Sicaya cuando contrae matrimonio y decide radicar en casa de los padres de su esposo. Ahora vive muy satisfecha con la labor que realiza porque le permite cuidar a su pequeña hijita y ha logrado a través de recomendaciones recaudar contratos con instituciones educativas para que diseñe sus uniformes deportivos esto le permite contribuir con los gastos que genera día a día su pequeño hogar.Su hacendosa labor la realiza en su pequeño taller de costura instalado en su hogar, tiene grandes anhelos y uno de ellos es el de poder abrir un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad con una línea de ropa exclusivamente deportiva.Para seguir trabajando solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la implementación de su taller de costura y la compra de insumos para la elaboración de ropa deportiva.Apoya a esta joven madre a continuar por el camino al éxito con tu importante contribución podrá seguir incrementando su felicidad y satisfacciones profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making sportswear

loans.name: Maruja Yesenia

texts.es:
Maruja is thankful for the care that her mother gave her for so many years. Despite the hard times that she has gone through, she was able to finish her studies in Pedagogy in a prestigious university. Now she is exercising her profession as a teacher. However, to be able to make ends meet, she has had to work very hard as a teacher and in the small business that she started. She opened her own business selling clothing mostly to her colleagues at work and other people that she knows. Thanks to this business, that she has been working at for six months, sometimes she travels to the capital to buy clothing at the bulk rate, and therefore she is able to earn more money. All of her hard work has the goal to be able to develop herself professionally, personally and to be able to pay for the costs of the medical treatment for her mother who suffers from heart problems. Presently she lives with her sister and her mother and she feels happy to be able to live in the company of the people who she loves most. Furthermore, the fact that she has started this new business has given her the opportunity to meet new people and make new friends. She would like to continue to sell these clothing items and for that reason she is asking for a loan to be able to purchase merchandise and then to be able to pay for the medical treatment necessary for her mother. Let’s support Maruja to be able to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Edith and Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Maruja, responde con gratitud el cuidado que le otorgó su madre por muchos años, a pesar de los momentos difíciles que le tocó afrontar logró terminar su carrera de pedagogía en una prestigiosa universidad y ahora es una profesora entregada a su profesión, sin embargo para poder sostenerse y debido al inmenso afán de progreso que posee, ha aperturado un negocio propio de venta de prendas de vestir y lo hace ofreciendo de manera ambulante, a sus colegas de trabajo y a personas conocidas, gracias a este negocio que ya lleva cerca de seis meses. Periódicamente viaja a la ciudad capital para comprar al por mayor prendas de vestir y obtener mayores ganancias. Todos sus esfuerzos tienen un único fin, el de poder desarrollarse profesional, personalmente y también el poder sostener los gastos que demanda el tratamiento médico de su mamá que sufre del corazón. En la actualidad ella vive con una hermana y su mamá y se siente satisfecha de vivir en compañía de las personas que más ama, además el hecho de realizar este negocio le ha permitido conocer a nuevas personas y poder entablar lazos de amistad. Desea seguir dedicándose a la venta de estas prendas de vestir y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y el tratamiento médico de su madre.Apoyemos a Maruja a seguir adelante con sus nobles anhelos de progreso.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing items in order to contribute to her family's development.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Thoeun has been married since 1987 and has four children, one son and three daughters. She has been in the business of running a grocery store since 1995. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home. Her husband, Mr. YOU Khat, is a farmer. He raises cows in the village. Their children are studying in the local school.
She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase more grocery items for her stock so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
She was born about 1978 in Lokossa (Mono District), is married, and has no children. Her business selling staple foodstuffs is located in the international Dantokpa market in Cotonou and is very worthwhile due to high consumption in the city of Cotonou. Married to a mason, she is aware of her role in their marriage. This is why she is trying to build up her working capital in order to expand her business and thus her income. This loan is necessary for her goal and would serve as a springboard for renewing her business. So she is quite right to come and request a loan from our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers 1978 à Lokossa dans le département du MONO, elle est mariée et sans enfant. Son activité de commercialisation des produits vivriers est exercé dans le marché international DANTOKPA de Cotonou et est très rentable à cause de la grande capacité de consommation de ces produits dans la ville de Cotonou. Epouse d'un maçon, elle est consciente du rôle qui le sien sous le toit conjugal. C’est pourquoi elle s’essaie à renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’élargir son volume d’activité et par conséquent son revenu. Le crédit est à cet effet une solution nécessaire, un tremplin pour donner un nouveau souffle à son activité. et c'est à juste titre qu'elle est venue solliciter ce crédit auprès de notre institution.

loans.use: To buy twenty 50-kg sacks of beans and fifteen 50-kg sacks of voandzou  (a type of ground nut)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị B., 48 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1998. In first few years, she took out loans to invest in her herd of pigs. The weekly repayments were handled by her husband’s wages. Recently, her husband’s health is bad and getting worse. The repayments become burdens and she has to sew gloves for extra income. Her two children are still in school that’s why she insists to work harder for their future. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 775USD to buy material for glove making and young chickens. She lives in Ý Yên, Nam Định.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị B., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Các năm đầu vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào việc chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi cũng khá, đủ để gia đình có một cuộc sống ổn định. Khoản tiền trả tuần thường do chồng chị B. đi làm hỗ trợ. Những năm trở lại đây sức khoẻ anh Tiến, chồng chị không còn được tốt, hoàn trả tuần đôi lúc khó khăn. Chị B. chủ động tìm thêm nghề phụ là may găng tay. Công việc này vừa giúp chị có tiền trả tuần vừa bảo đảm thu nhập thường xuyên. Hai con còn đang đi học nên chị B. xác định còn phải vất vả thêm vài năm nữa. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay thêm 775USD để mua vải may găng tay và mua gà con. Hiện chị B. đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves and buy chickens

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Ali owns a household goods store. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through A. Majmoua. He needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Gaudensia is a single woman. She owns a small general store, which she started in 2006. Everyday she works from 7am to 7pm and earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

In the past, Gaudensia has successfully serviced a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to open a new shop.

loans.use: to open a new shop

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
The growing business of Doris B. shows that she is utilizing the funds that she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells cosmetics and cooking utensils in her shop. She acquired the skill over three years of training and has been in business since 2001.

She needs a loan for $850.00 to buy more cooking utensils and cosmetics so that her business can expand. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Ulises Amilcar

texts.es:
Ulises is a hard working man dedicated to agriculture. He wishes to increase the output of his fields and therefore improve the income for his home, especially for the education of his children who are still school age and need many school supplies. This is especially true of his oldest daughter, who had to move away from her parents to get a better quality education and is currently living in a neighboring city at the home of a relative. Without a doubt, Mr. Sivestre wants to increase his income to be able to cover all these expenses. For this reason he needs to buy new seeds and fertilizer for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Ulises es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a la agricultura, él desea poder incrementar la producción de sus terrenos y así mejorar los ingresos para su hogar, en especial para la educación de sus hijos, quienes son aún escolares y requieren de mayor cantidad de útiles, sobre todo, su hija mayor, que tuvo que alejarse de sus padres para procurar una mejor calidad de educación y está ahora en una ciudad vecina en casa de un pariente de la familia. Pero sin duda, don Ulises requiere incrementar sus ingresos para tener la posibilidad de solventar todos estos gastos. Para esto debe comprar nuevas semillas y abonos necesarios para sus tierras.

loans.use: Acquire supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Manong

texts.en:
Manong M. lives in Tanzania. He has a shop where he sells a variety of food, including maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar. He purchases the items wholesale from shops around and outside the Dar-es-Salaam city center.

Manong's shop provides enough income to feed his family and pay the school fees for his three children. He requests a loan of $400 to purchase more items to sell and increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Sidiki

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sidiki O. a 32 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants, son épouse,  ses frères et soeurs chez son feu père à Mancourani I, un des quartiers de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après le décès de son père, Sidiki l’aîné de la famille comme l’exige la tradition devait s’occuper de la famille. Ainsi il fut obliger d’abandonner les études et entamer une activité génératrice de revenus afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il entama l’apprentissage du métier de tailleur auprès de plusieurs maîtres tailleurs de la ville de Sikasso. Après 17 ans d’expériences, il devient un maître tailleur connu de tout Sikasso. Son atélier  situé au grand marché de cette ville est un creusset de styles et de modèles qui est très visité par une clientèle variée.  
C’est pour faire face aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de cette clientèle, qu’il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder, acheter 7 pièces de bazin teintés à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et  200 mètres de tissus pour hommes à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’Ouest) pour les coudre (en chemises et pantalons) avant de les revendre. En raison de la marge bénéficiaire très intéressante monsieur O. compte  réaliser 150.000 FCFA de surplus qui sera utilisé pour subvenir essentiellement aux besoins de sa famille élargie.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidiki O., age 32, lives with his three children, his wife, and his brothers and sisters, in the home of his deceased father in Mancourani I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After his father passed away, Sidiki, the elder son, had to take care of the family, as required by tradition. For this reason, he had to abandon his studies and start making money to provide for his family. He was trained as a tailor by several master tailors in the city of Sikasso. After 17 years of experience, he became a master tailor known all over Sikasso. His workshop, located in the grand market, is a melting pot of styles and designs, and is very much visited by a diverse clientele. To satisfy an increasing number of ever more demanding requests from his customers, he decided to join the loan program of the microfinance organisation Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy a new embroidery machine, seven pieces of tinted "bazin" (a sort of damask) in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali), and 200 meters of men's fabric in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso, Western Africa). He intends to sew them to make shirts and trousers, that he will then sell. Due to an interesting profit margin, Mr. O. expects to make a profit of 150.000 XOF, to be used mainly to meet his family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine and fabrics

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 23 años, es madre de 1 hijo quien es su aspiración de seguir adelante,  tiene una bodega en un lugar muy apropiado dentro de su zona, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, huevo, azúcar, etc.) su esposo Edgar fue quien la incentivó con este negocio, puesto que él conoce mucho, ya que es agente vendedor de abarrotes, ambos quieren que su hijo siga estudiando y más adelante sea un profesional competente.En el futuro a Jessica le gustaría tener un minimarket, para ello requiere de un capital para ir incrementando su mercadería, lo que ayudará a cumplir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 23-year-old mother of one son, who is her motivation to get ahead in life. She owns a small general store in a suitable location in her area. She sells basic need items, such as rice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc. Her husband, Edgar, was the one who encouraged her to start her own business because as a grocery dealer, he knows a lot about this field. Both of them want their son to continue with his education so that he can become a competent professional in the future. Jessica would like to have her own mini market in the future, which is why she needs capital in order to increase her merchandise; this will help her reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise to start a mini market

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza M. M. es originaria de Cadereyta, Nuevo León. Ella tiene 54 años y su familia se compone por su esposo y su hijo. <

> Actualmente Lorenza solicita un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de 6 meses, con la finalidad de comprar mercancías y utensilios de cocina. <

> Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Lorenza y su esposo iniciaron en el comercio con una tienda de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 30 años,después ella decidio vender comidas. Hoy en día, Lorenza cuenta con un puesto donde vende tacos de guisos y comidas, desde hace poco más de 10 años. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Lorenza para que la gente puede seguir disfrutando de sus tacos!!! <

>
texts.en:
Lorenza M. M. is from Cadereyta, in Nueva León. She is 54 years old and married, with one son. Lorenza needs a loan of $475, which she'll repay in six months. She'll use the money to buy cooking utensils. Lorenza is hard-working and very dedicated to her business. She started a grocery store with her husband 30 years ago, and later Lorenza decided to sell home-cooked meals. Now she has a store where she sells tacos, which she has been making for 10 years. We invite you to help Lorenza so that everyone can keep enjoying her tacos!

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and cooking utensils

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with a 2-year-old daughter and lives in Belaya Tserkov, a busy town in the Kiev region. Yaroslav runs a kiosk selling varnish, coloring agents and dishware in the central market of Belaya Tserkov. He inherited this business from his father, generating his equity capital while working in Germany before returning to continue their family business. He has been running it for 6 years. Currently, he has about 10,000 Grivnas invested in inventory with income of about 6,400 Grivnas a month.

Yaroslav would like to get a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase assorted merchandise wholesale as retail prices might go up very soon. This would allow him to keep his selling prices competitive and bring him additional profit. Yaroslav is seeking to achieve financial stability for his family. He is the only breadwinner in the family and has to provide for his family and retired father who lives with them. We believe Yaroslav’s willingness to see his business become more diversified and sustainable will ensure success of his trade and prompt repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. sells tomatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Lucia is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has six children, who all attend school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Edda J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Edda M. from Tukuyu. She is married and has four children between the ages of 15 and 20. Edda has run a timber-selling business since 2004, buying wood from the forest and selling it in towns.

She works four hours a day, seven days a week and has one employee. Edda currently earns about $400 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase additional timber. In the future, she plans to increase her stock even further -- and by doing that, expand her small company. Edda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena Y. is a 47-year-old widow and the mother of eight children, five girls and three boys. Four are currently in school and the rest are working. Living with some of her children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, Abena works very hard to provide for them as a trader in bananas and cassavas.

While sometimes procuring foodstuffs such as plantain and maize, she mainly buys cassava and unripe bananas from farmers in her town and the nearby villages, selling to local retailers. She has been in business for 10 years, and her fondest desire is to save enough money to support the rest of her children in their academics. Abena is therefore requesting a loan to procure bananas and cassavas in bulk so as to maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas and cassavas.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Михтоджев Мошариф жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет , замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Училась в швейном лицее. Сейчас занимается пошивом базарных сумок , которые реализует  на базаре. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Теперь ей одной приходится обеспечивать свою семью. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mosharif M. lives in Vakhdat. She is 28 years old and is married with one child. She studied at a lyceum for tailors and makes a living by making shopping bags and selling them at the market. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, and Mosharif is the only breadwinner. She plans to use the loan for purchasing fabric. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha D. started her fish sales 26 years ago in Dome, a suburb of Mampong, where she lives. Martha prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 40 years old and married with four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of various fish to increase sales and income to support her children's education and grow the business. She mostly travels to Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region to purchase her dried and smoked fish in bulk. She would be grateful for the assistance. Martha belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive con su esposa la señora Anastacia y son una familia muy unida.
El trabaja para una empresa muy reconocida con una antigüedad de 5 años, su esposa es vendedora independiente de una línea de productos por catalogo, ingresos que contribuyen al patrimonio familiar.
Ellos tiene un proyecto que es el realizar los acabados exteriores de su casita (resanar las paredes) motivo por el que están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife Anastacia. They are a very close family. He works for a well-known business that has been around for five years. His wife is an independent vendor of a line of products she sells by catalogue, and the income from this is contributed to the family. They have a project, which is to finish the exterior of their house (plaster the walls), which is why they have applied for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve exteriors (plaster exterior walls)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una madre que trabaja por el  bienestar de sus hijos, ya que desde su separación de su pareja, tuvo que asumir el rol de padre y madre en su hogar, lo cual es muy difícil, pero cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le brindaron su casa y su cariño. Con todo los problemas que tuvo que atravesar nunca dejó de ser optimista en cuanto a su porvenir, pues tuvo las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar en muchas actividades y solventar los gastos de su hogar, como también ahorrar lo necesario para tener un negocio propio que junto a su hermana se tornó realidad, pues ambas adquirieron un puesto en el mercado hace 8 años y desde entonces no paran de trabajar, y aun más ahora que tienen pensado adquirir otro puesto. Sin embargo, para lograrlo tendrán que seguir vendiendo desde las seis de la mañana, pues las madres de familia visitan los mercados en las mañanas desde tempranas horas, teniendo las tardes libres para atender las necesidades de su hogar, pues nunca deja de cuidar de sus hijos a pesar de la recargada labor que tiene durante en día. Encontrarse en su octavo crédito con MFP la ayuda a saber que su responsabilidad dentro de su grupo no es tan sólo los pagos, sino el grado de amistad y solidaridad que hay entre todas, pues no es fácil interactuar y aprender el trabajo en equipo. La cantidad que solicita es para adquirir otro puesto en el mercado, para incrementar sus productos y capital.
texts.en:
Francisca is a mother who works for the well-being of her children. Since she separated from her husband, she has had to take on the role of both father and mother in her home, which is very difficult. But she has the support of her parents, who offered her their home and their affection. With all of the problems she had to go through, she never stopped being an optimist with regard to her future. She had all of the strength necessary to work in many jobs to pay for her home's expenses and saved enough to have her own business with her sister. Now they are planning to obtain another stand in the market. However, to accomplish this, they will have to keep selling starting at 6:00 a.m. Mothers start visiting the markets very early so they can have the afternoons free to attend to the needs of their homes. She never stops caring for her children in spite of the hard work she does during the day. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. It helps her to know that her responsibility within her group isn't only making her payments, but also the friendship and solidarity that the members have. It isn't easy to interact and to learn how to work in a team. The amount she is requesting will go towards acquiring another stand in the market and to increase her amount of products and capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another stand in the market

loans.name: Yataka Moyo Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items (wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items) for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 26 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Siasa who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items for her business

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
ZAIDA G. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS”, su domicilio está ubicado en el Carmen cabrejos Nº 834 Distrito de Calleria, tiene 40 años, 2 hijos y su esposo es chofer (transportista).

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió para la compra de artículos de pasamanería, los cuales vendió en el puerto de la hoyada, pero no le resulto como esperaba, por lo tanto cambio de actividad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega (arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar, etc.)

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 8 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó.
texts.en:
Zaida G. S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 40 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is a chauffeur. The first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos program was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of decorative fringe items that she sold in the port of La Hoyada; this business did not turn out as she expected, and for the meantime she has changed activities. With this loan of 1,300 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of groceries to add variety to her small grocery store (rice, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.). She thanks the Manuela Ramos program, and remarks that the 8 years that she has worked with the program have permitted her to establish her business, which has been an interesting form of help that has allowed her to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as noodles, rice, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm.

Afia is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny B., 28, and her husband, Mr. Run Kong, 25, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have two young sons. 
Vanny has been selling mangoes. Her husband is a horse cart driver and wooden house builder. Unfortunately, his horse was old and got sick. Therefore, he decided to sell it. Now, Vanny is asking for her second loan of $300 to purchase another horse for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Petrona Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Petrona es originaria de la comunidad de Coxom del municipio de Totonicapán a  ocho kilometros de la ciudad su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta articulos de consumo diario y como el servico de molino de Nixtamal ella viene ejerciendo dicha actividad desde que hera una ñiña ya que el el ingreso de sus queridos padres y por ser la unica hija la heredaron dicha activida y que hasta la fecha lo ha podido mantener ella visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicita un credito la cual le servira para ampliar sus productos principalmente en la compra de tarjeta de telefonos ya que por su comunidad  son muy solictados la tarjetas ya que la mayoria de persona utilizan un telefono celular.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona is originally from the Coxom community in the town of Totonicapán, which is eight kilometers away from the city. Her main sources of income are selling daily household products and renting out her Nixtamal grinder (a brand name apparatus for milling corn and other grains). She has been working since she was a young girl and always helping her parents generate an income. Since she is the only child, Doña Petrona inherited the business and has been able to keep it going.

She came to the ASDIR office to request a loan so that she can increase her inventory of products, primarily to buy phone cards. These cards are widely sold in her community because most people have a mobile phone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Union Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Los socios del banco comunal “Unión y Progreso” esta representado por el señor Hernando y 13 miembros todos con calificación AA debido a que ya van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad responsabilidad y unión en el grupo. Una gran mayoría de los socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, libros, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, comida, ladrillo y  a la confección de prendas de vestir de todo tipo. En el tiempo que trabajaron con el grupo han demostrado ser capaces de salir adelante a pesar de cualquier adversidad o competencia en el mercado ya que saben como trabajar. El nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y materia prima para seguir agrandando sus negocios para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias y poder perseguir un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank 'Union and Progress' are represented by Mr. Hernando and 13 members, all with AA rating due to the fact that they are in their third loan cycle, demonstrating punctuality, responsibility, and unity in the group. A large majority of the members work selling clothing, books, groceries in neighborhood stores, food, and bricks and making articles of all types of clothing. In the time they have worked with the group they have demonstrated that they are capable of moving ahead despite any adversity or competition in the market since they know how to work. The new financing is for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and primary materials to continue expanding their businesses in order to give a better quality of life to their families and be able to pursue a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the village of Pta.Sulong,Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 43 years old. Eva is married and has 2 school-aged children. Eva owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Eva has been working in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2004, Eva joined PMPC to help improve her living situation by gainning access to financial services and capital. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for rice production. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the school tuition of the her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for rice production

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mariposas” esta representado por la señora Carmen y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales han demostrado honradez y ganas D. salir adelante. Las señoras se dedican a diferentes actividades como por ejemplo Cristina hace bordados en sandalias ella lo realiza a mano en diversos colores y modelos, Maria Luisa trabaja hace 25 años con repostería como cubanitos dejando a los colegios y M., El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como pan, comida, cosméticos y a la elaboración D. tejidos a mano, como la competencia es alta en el M. las socias realizan entregas a domicilio o en mercados alejados. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. capital para la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para realizar un trabajo D. calidad y en mayor cantidad.  En cuanto a los antecedente crediticios  las socias van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando  ganas D. trabaja y salir adelante para poder darles a su familia una mejor vida y a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The “Mariposas” (“Butterflies”) group is represented by Carmen. Its 12 members have shown integrity and the desire to get ahead. The women have a variety of businesses. For example, Cristina hand-embroiders sandals in an array of styles and colors. Maria Luisa has sold pastries at high schools and in the local market for 25 years. The rest of the members of the group sell products such as bread, food, cosmetics, and hand-woven fabrics. As the local market is very competitive, the members proviD. home delivery or work in markets that are far away.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase merchandise, supplies, and tools to proviD. quality products in greater quantity. The group is in its third loan cycle and its members have demonstrated the desire to work hard and get ahead in order to proviD. their families a better life and their children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es: Hilaria  A. es la presidenta de la asociación “illimani” del centro Focal Villa Adela, en la ciudad de El Alto, ella al igual que muchas de sus compañeras necesita elevar sus ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia, Hilaria tiene cinco hijos,  junto a su esposo hace cuatro años se dedican a la venta de repuestos para automóviles, tienen un puesto en el cruce taquiña (El Alto). Otras de las socias son artesanas, realizan tejidos de mantas, también venden artículos de plástico, ropa, muebles, manzanas y otros. La asociación Altiplano necesita incrementar su capital para poder variar e incrementar su mercadería, solo de esta manera podrán generar la clase de ingresos que se necesita para satisfacer las necesidades de sus familias.
texts.en:
Hilaria A. is the president of the“illimani” association in the Focal Villa Adela center, in the city of El Alto. Along with many of her fellow members, she needs to increase her income to support her family. Hilaria has five children, and with her husband, four years ago they have been selling automobile parts, and have a little stall in the taquiña intersection (El Alto). Other members are artisans, they knit blankets, and they also sell plastic goods, clothing, furniture, apples and other items. The Altiplano association needs to increase their capital to have variety and increase their merchandize. It is the only way that they can generate the necessary income to fulfill the needs of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize.

loans.name: Belkis Mercedes

texts.es: Belkis Mercedes O. P. tiene 26 años con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Y surgió con la necesidad de salir adelante, ya que anteriormente quien se dedicaba al negocio era su Mama ya que siempre le gusto ofrecer productos de manera ambulante en las calles, y así salían todos los días en los diferentes mercados en busca de clientes. Por lo que más adelante decide encargarle el negocio a su hija Belkis así fue como ella no tuvo ningún problema en mantener esta actividad. Ella espera muy pronto proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan vivir con las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas y mercadería variada.
texts.en:
Belkis Mercedes O. P. is 26 years old and by working hard has helped her family get ahead. She has had to work hard because her mother used to be the one running the business. She has always liked roaming the streets selling goods. They used to go out together to all the various markets looking for clients and since Belkis was good at it, she decided to turn the business over to her. She hopes to do some home improvement very soon so her kids can live in good conditions. Her loan is for working capital to buy clothing, perfume, creams, and other merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Zakerullah

texts.en:
Zakerullah, son of Q., is married and lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He studied up to class nine. Because of some financial problems, he couldn't continue his education. His father is a good shoemaker who cannot work anymore because he is above 60 years old. Zakerullah decided to help his family and to work in his father’s shoemaker shop. Zakerullah is a hard worker and he wants to enlarge his business. For this purpose he needs 50000 Afghani loans.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to enlarge his shop and to expand his business to be more successful. He wishes to become strong in his business and to make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: He wants to buy leather for shoemaking.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina A. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Lucina owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lucina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for fishing, such as nets, and for pumpboat use. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. Lucina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for fishing, such as nets, and materials for pumpboat

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is from the village of Bungad in San Pablo, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Lina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lina grows fruit trees and then harvests and sells the fruit. Lina has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2007, Lina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to expand her business. Lina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Lina's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her fruit-growing business

loans.name: Jhonny Mario

texts.es:
El Señor Jhonny Peláez tiene 31 años, y está casado y tiene 3 hijos pequeños de los cuales 2 acuden a la escuela y el otro se queda con la mama en la casa.
