El señor  Jhonny se dedica a brindar servicios de policía de seguridad en un Súper Mercado de La zona Oeste de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, donde según información otorgada por el dueño del súper mercado el señor Jhonny en una persona muy trabajadora, confiable y cumplida con todas las normas de la empresa.

El señor Jhonny  vive en la zona de Cero verde en Cochabamba, en una casa en alquiler. Después de algunos años de ahorrar plata pudo comprarse un lote en la zona de Huallani que es una Zona ubicada en el sector Este de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, pero no les alcanzo la plata para poder construir su casa.
Es por eso que el crédito será utilizado para la construcción de su casa así de este modo podrán mudarse a su casa y no pagar alquileres y poder cumplir su sueño de tener una vivienda propia y un lugar donde sus hijos puedan estar comodos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhonny P. is 31 years old, married, and has 3 small children, 2 of whom attend school, while 1 remains at home with its mother. Jhonny serves as a security policeman in a super market in the western zone of Cochabamba city. According to the owner of the super market, Jhonny is a very trustworthy, responsible, and hard-working person who complies with all the norms of the enterprise. Jhonny lives in the Cero Verde zone of Cochabamba in a rental house. After several years of saving money he was able to buy a house lot in the Huallani zone, located in the Eastern sector of Cochabamba. But they lacked the funds to be able to construct their house. For this reason the loan will be used to construct a house, enabling them to move and avoid paying rent. This will fulfill their dream of having their own home and a place where their children can feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de Vivienda

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with two adult children. She plants and harvests rice for sale. She nets 3,000 Philippine pesos monthly from the said business. She has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years. In 2004, Virginia joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her rice production. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for rice production

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey O. is a businessman in Bungoma, which is a town in Western Province of Kenya. He is married to Hellen O. and they have four children. Their first-born son is 26 years old and in college and the last-born just graduated from high school.

Geoffrey currently provides laundry services for a fee and is looking for more funds to add inventory to his business. He is planning to buy laundry chemicals and wrapping paper. He will use part of the money to pay the staff’s salaries and the remaining money for family upkeep. Geoffrey borrowed his first loan from us. He completed payment of the loan successfully without problems. 

His desire is to buy an original dry-cleaning machine to improve his general performance and also to expand his business into wholesale so he can to create more employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy laundry chemicals and wrapping paper, and to add to his inventory

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Active group. They are small scale businesswomen in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They want a loan of SLL 800,000 each to add more goods to their businesses so that sales and profits will increase. In this way, they can better look after their children in terms of feeding, clothing and schooling.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu S.. Kadiatu, 35, was born in Makeni. She is married and has 5 children. Two of her children are in primary school and three are in secondary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells rice, palm oil, firewood, honey, bulgur wheat and much more.  She will use this loan to buy bags of rice and bulgur wheat to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and bulgur wheat to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana esta casada, se dedica a la venta de cd´s musicales y películas en un puesto ubicado en la Av. Buenos Aires, una zona muy concurrida y comercial de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene ya 7 años en esta actividad. Vive con su esposo y sus suegros, en la zona de Valle de las Flores, su suegra es una cliente antigua y muy puntual de nuestra institución. Su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado en el Sindicato "Simón Bolívar", y junto a ella están ahorrando dinero para ir comprando muebles y electrodomésticos  poco a poco, no tiene hijos todavía. El crédito será invetido en la compra de mercadería como cd´s musicales, películas y demás pedidos que tiene.
La Sra Ana Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Ana is married. She works selling music and films on CD in a stall located on Buenos Aires Avenue, a very busy commercial zone in the city of La Paz. She has been doing this for 7 years. She lives with her husband and her in-laws in the Valle de las Flores ("Flower Valley") area. Her mother-in-law is a long-time and very punctual customer of our institution. Her husband works as a salaried chauffeur in the "Simón Bolívar" union, and together they are saving money to buy furniture and appliances little by little. Ana has no children yet. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise like music CDs, films and other orders she has. Ana is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her with the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jorgen

texts.en: Jorgen T. is a newly-recognized member of ASHI. Her desire to start up her own business in fish sales led her to such a decision with the support of her husband. The vision of her two children enjoying a life that is not under the umbrella of poverty inspired her to request a loan that will be invested into a business. Profits gained from the business will allow her to augment her husband’s income; hence the needs of her children will be supported. Jorgen now is 29 years of age while her two children are five and nine years old. Considering the amount time before their children will go to high school and college, Jorgen and her husband still have time to grow their business in order to finance their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is happy with her business. She sells pepper soup, drinks and sachet water. Her peak time for business is in the evenings when her customers finish their jobs and they relax and chat in her restaurant.

She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She needs the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and a fridge. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. 

She is married with children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a fridge

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Madame Maty S. est un agent de santé communautaire au niveau de l’ONG Child Fund depuis 2003.  Couturière de métier, Madame S. est devenue agent de santé après avoir réussie aux tests de sélection organisés à cet effet. Elle fait partie à présent des principales motivatrices communautaire de l’ONG au niveau de ses bases qui se trouvent à Thiès.
A présent, Madame S. Maty avait entamé des travaux de construction d’un bâtiment pour sa chère maman. Ainsi  pour la finition des travaux à savoir le dallage et autre, elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000 FCFA  afin de loger dans les plus brefs délais sa maman dans un bâtiment neuf et de la rendre plaisir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maty S. is a public health agent with the Child Fund NGO since 2003. She is a seamstress by trade, and has become a public health agent after successfully passing qualifying tests. She now belongs to the main group of NGO community organizers based in Thiès. At present, Mrs. Maty S. has launched theconstruction of a house for her beloved mother. In order to have masonry and other skilled work completed, Mrs. S. is seeking a loan of 300,000 West African Francs so that her mother would be able to move into a new house and enjoy it as soon as possible.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the construction of a house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es: Maura tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Maura tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio este negocio con fondos propios, por lo que anteriormente vendía ropa de manera ambulante, pero lamentablemente tuvo muchas perdidas y decide emprender otro negocio como es la pulpería, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son sus propios vecinos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar granos básicos, arroz, aceite, frijoles, arroz gaseosas. Ella siempre sueña con obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Maura has worked with the Fundación for a long time. Maura has four children, and they all work. For over seven years she has had a mini-market. She started this business with her own funds. She previously sold clothes as a street vendor, but, unfortunately, she had a lot of losses. She decided to establish another business, the mini-market. Most of her customers are her own neighbors. The loan is for work capital to buy basic grains, rice, oil, beans, and soft drinks. She always dreams of getting another business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Eriyasi

texts.en:
Eriyasi is a father of three children, aged 47. He operates a bar in a rural township of Bugwara, Kibaale in Uganda which sustains his children and his peasant wife. He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda with his family of five people. He has been in the bar business for six years now. He says he used to be in the piggery business before starting his own bar. 

Besides the bar, Eriyasi deals in selling beans and maize to earn additional income for his family. In his area, produce is a good business venture to earn or supplement income as trucks from the urban areas flood the rural areas buying food to sell in towns. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy beer, sodas, and airtime to sell in his bar.

loans.use: buying beer, sodas and airtime for his bar business

loans.name: Test

texts.fr: حالياً، يعد موقع الإنترنت الخاص بـ Kiva من أكثر مواقع تقديم القروض المصغرة زيارة على مستوى العالم، كما أنه في طريقه ليُصبح من أكبر مواقع التمويل بقروض مصغرة حول العالم. حيث تتيح شركة Kiva للممولين من الأفراد إقراض الأفراد في مختلف أنحاء العالم. ولتسهيل هذه العملية، فإن شركاء Kiva من مؤسسات التمويل المصغر ذات السمعة العالية (MFI) – يتم تسميتهم بشركاء المجال في Kiva. بالنسبة لمؤسسات التمويل المصغر (MFI)، توفر Kiva بيئة عمل لرفع التكلفة المنخفضة ورأس مال القرض قصير المدة بشكل مباشر من المُمولين الأفراد حول العالم، وذلك لعرض أعمالهم على الجمهور العالمي.
texts.en:
testing

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: على رأس مال القرض قصير المدة

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is widowed with three children. All her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Kalerwe selling all types of merchandise. She buys merchandise like sugar, soap,,salt and tea leaves from Kampala city shops and goes shopping once a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and two boxes of soap. She has been in this business for 25 years. Besides this retail shop, she also sells cooked food near her shop and sells to all categories of people. both on retail. At times, she does outside catering. Her customers are students from nearby schools and the community around. Rose works seven days a week. Her business challenges includes rainy season because she resides in a floody place. She is aspiring to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only, and even building rental rooms.  Rose decided to work with MCDT because she need additional capital. Rose resides in and owns a four-roomed house, and the family has access to electricity and no piped water at home. Her greatest monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a widow. Her husband passed away a few months ago and left her with two children, both of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more jerycans of local brew (gin). Rose changed her business from owning a food stall in Naguru to selling local gin a few months ago and she has no additional income. She operates her business from home and so doesn’t pay rent. 

She buys jerycans of local brew once a week from Nakulabye market and uses public transport to and from Nakulabye.  Her customers are the local people around the area. She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are seasonality and transportation.   

Rose decided to work with MCDT because it was offering loans at low interest.  She owns and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local gin

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Joel de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Dolores tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la mayor de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus campos agrícolas de los cultivos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dolores, who is 31 years old, is a simple and hard working mother. She lives in her parents' house with her 29 year old husband, Joel, and their 2 beloved children, to whom they want to give a better quality of life. The arduous work days that Dolores has spent on her small farm have served to improve her crop and make her land more productive. She works together with her older daughter starting very early in the morning. They cultivate potatoes and beans, products that she will later bring to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to sell. What she likes best about her work is sowing her land and seeing her crops grow. She has been in this business for 5 years and feels that the most difficult part is taking care of the crops on her farmland. With time, she hopes to purchase more land and increase her production quantity. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She was very timely in the repayment of her first loan, and she expects to be so now as well. She is a very happy member of her communal bank, which is why she is well liked by the rest of the members. With the 3000 PEN ($1075 USD) that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhcase more sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Phoeun K., age 34 (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Nang Un, age 31, are vegetable farmers. The couple does not have their own transportation for commuting, which means that they must spend a considerable amount of money on traveling costs. Phoeun has decided to ask for his first loan in the amount of $600, which will be used to purchase a motorcycle. He will also apply some of the loan money toward his farming business. 

He and his wife live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers from the city. They have been married since 1998 and have two sons and a daughter. Two of the children are in school and the youngest is still very small.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María Isabel C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conserje en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene ocho años de laborar. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ropa y zapatos escolares para sus hijos ya que se avecinan las fiestas patrias en nuestro País.
texts.en:
María Isabel C. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a custodian in the Simeón Pereira school in the municipality of El Sauce, where she has been working for eight years. She has been working with CEPRODEL for four years where they have provided her with four loans for personal expenses. She requested this loan for the purchase of school clothing and shoes for her children since the national holidays in their country are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D. is a widow  who lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Tabuan, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and buying and selling rice & corn businesses.  Josefa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP13,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for the future, improve the business and uplift their standard of living. 

Josefa D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila P. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Leonila is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional flowers to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Presentacion Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Presentacion del Carmen N. se dedica al comercio es propietaria de un tramo en  el  sector de ropa el Bisne, es soltera no tiene hijos a cargo y habita en la mora, lleva ya 6 años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha obtenido 39 creditos los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma es muy responsable.
La señora Presentacion N. vende ropa de todo estilo y a diferentes precios.
texts.en:
Mrs Presentacion del Carmen N. is the owner of a spot in the clothes section of El Bisne market.  She is single, doesn't have any children in her care and lives in La Mora. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 6 years.  She has had 39 loans all of which she has paid on time and in full.  She is very responsible.

Mrs Presentacion N. sells all types of clothes in a range of prices.

loans.use: To buy clothes to increase her stock

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma S., age 51, opened a small hotel business five years ago. In her hotel, she prepares and sells Newar food. This is a popular food item in Kathmandu Valley because the majority of the people in this area are Newars. She is seeking a loan to buy necessary foodstuffs for the preparation of these meals, such as grains and vegetables, in order to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to improve her family's standard of living as well as to provide for a better education for her daughter and granddaughter. 

Mrs. S. lives in Tangal, near the famous market, Mangar Bazaar, in the Lalitpur district of Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this area are engaged in traditional work. She has eight members in her family, including herself. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Gopal, is a retired government officer. Her older son works in a travel agency and her younger son works in a shop. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her granddaughter is enrolled in primary school..

loans.use: To buy grains, vegetables, and other foodstuffs necessary to prepare the Newar meals she serves to her customers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 3 años ofrece el servicio de transporte, con una movilidad que alquila, desde entonces recorre las calles de la ciudad, llevando al cliente a su destino. Sin embargo, sabe que correo riesgo de se asaltado o ser victima de accidente, por ello siempre se mantiene atento a todo para la seguridad del clientes como para su propia seguridad. Diariamente logra alcanzar los ingresos necesarios para el beneficio de su familia, considera que éste trabajo el es rentable, porque es un servicio que tiene mucha demanda, por ello desea tener más adelante su propia movilidad. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de la movilidad que esta a su cargo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old.  He lives with his partner and his daughter in his parents' home.  For more than three years he has been offering transport services with a vehicle which he rents.  He works  the city streets, taking customers to their destinations.  However, he knows that he runs the risk of being assaulted or suffering an accident.  For this reason, he is always alert to everything for his customers' safety as well as his own.

Every day he manages to make enough money for his family.  He considers that this work is profitable because it is a service which is in high demand.  For this reason, he would like, in the future, to own his own vehicle.

This is Carlos' fourth loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  He also likes being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  He is grateful to all the people who will fund his loan since it will be very useful to him in making progress in his business.  He will use his loan to pay for a service for the vehicle which he is using.

loans.use: To pay for a service for the car which he is using for his work

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla López M. es una excelente  vendedora , y tiene más  de 15 años de dedicarse a las ventas.
A pesar de que vende de todo, tiene ya 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de artesanías lo cual le ha generado una fuente de ingresos suficiente para mantener su familia. 
Sin embargo ella asegura que no vende más por falta de inversión, es por eso que Doña Leyla quiere ₡600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para la compra de mas artesanías, pinturas y además de ropa y telas para la venta.
Ellas es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Leyla López M. is an excellent saleswoman.  She has been selling for over 15 years.  Although she sells everything, she has been selling handicrafts for two years.  This has generated a sufficient  source of income for her to support her family.

However, she does not sell more due to the lack of capital.  That is why Leyla wants ₡600 000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy more handicrafts, paintings, clothes, and fabrics to sell.

She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe.  It is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever, de 29 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Betty de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Josira de 7 y Aldair de 6 meses, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida. El trabajo al que Ever se dedica, es el cultivo de café y stevia, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que la ruta es muy accidentada. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, para incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ever is 29 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 26 year-old Betty, and his two beloved children, 7 year-old Josira and 6 month-old Aldair, for whom he wishes to provide a better life.

Ever's business is growing coffee and stevia.  After he has harvested his crops, he takes them to sell in the city of Pichanaki which is where he obtains the best prices for his products.  What Ever most likes about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products since the road is very rough and rugged.

Over time, Ever hopes to be able to buy more land, to increase the quantity of crops that he produces.  This is his first loan with MFP and he would like to be very punctual in making his repayments.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank since he infects the other members with his happiness which is contagious.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure to better fertilize his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Ziyodakhon

texts.en:
Ziyodakhon S. is married and has two grown children. She lives in Kanibadam, Tajikistan. 

Ziyodakhon runs a small business selling general goods in the local market. Her business place is located on the main market where there are many customers every day. Ziyodakhon has been in business for more than 12 years. 

Ziyodakhon is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. Her professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of her business. 

Ziyodakhon is requesting a loan for 6,000 TJS to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She is hoping that this loan will help her venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Ziyodakhon's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow her to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods for selling

loans.name: José Ulises

texts.es:
Don José Ulises M. A., es trabajador de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado desde hace 19 años, desempeñando el cargo de Fontanero de sistemas de agua potable.

Es casado de 37 años de edad, tiene 4 personas que dependen de él, tres de estas están en edad escolar. El vive en la ciudad de Granada en el Municipio de Diriomo.

Este crédito que es el primero con CEPRODEL lo solicita para realizarle mejoras a su casa de habitación, el agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle la oportunidad de mejorar su casa de forma progresiva y poder construir un patrimonio mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr José Ulises M. A. has been employed for 19 years by the Nicaraguan Water Utility Company, where he is charged with plumbing tasks for the drinking water system. He is married, 37 years old and supports four people, three of them being of school age. He lives in the city of Granada in the municipality of Diriomo.

This is the first time that he applies for a loan with the microfinance institution Ceprodel. He will use it to improve his home. He thanks Ceprodel for providing the opportunity to gradually improve his home and be able to increase his personal assets for the sake of his children.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El Sr. Faustino  tiene 38 años y vive con su hermana.
El desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  como limpiador de paradas de taxi y luego como chofer, gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar un vehículo y trabajar en él.
Él necesita de este crédito para la compra de cubiertas y también para realizar algunos arreglos que le faltan al vehículo  para que de esta manera pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Faustino anhela comprar otro vehículo y así obtener mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Faustino is 38 years old and lives with his sister. At a very young age, he began working as a taxi cleaner and later as a driver. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to purchase a vehicle to use for his work.

He needs this loan to buy hubcaps and also pay for repairs since his vehicle is experiencing a few malfunctions. By correcting these problems, he hopes to provide better service to his customers. Faustino plans to buy another vehicle so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase new hubcaps & pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
Hannah B., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God First. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children aged 10 and 3 years. She is currently attending adult literacy school; she received no previous education due to lack of financial support.

For 10 years, Hannah has been selling charcoal in Jallah’s Town Monrovia, Liberia, and plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Hannah describes herself as a friendly woman whose dreams are to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es: Luis tiene 32 años de edad y vive en el distrito de Chochope con su esposa y dos hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de nuevas llantas y otros accesorios faltantes. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Luis puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Luis es muy trabajador y su negocio se ha visto incrementado ya que ha ahorrado su dinero. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y tener ingresos para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 32, lives in Chochope District with his wife and two children who are 1 and 2 years of age.  For the last three years he has been earning his livelihood providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport passengers in its interior. 

He wants to use his loan to buy new tires and other needed accessories.  He also wants to repair his motorcycle which is showing some wear and tear due to use.  With these repairs Luis will be able to keep his motorcycle in better condition which will allow him to provide better customer service thus increasing his income to meet family expenses.

He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Luis is very hard working and his business has grown and he’s been able to save some money.  His greatest wish is to continue improving his quality of life and to have income for his children’s future.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi and buy new tires.

loans.name: La Verite Group

texts.fr: Nyirarudodo  A.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « La Vérité », âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, tous ont leurs propres foyers.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La  cliente  Nyirarudodo  A. est vendeuse de fruits Mangues, oranges, avocats, etc. Elle vit de cette activité de fortune. Il fait longtemps  qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser  4 cycles en  bénéficiant des crédits de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produis fruitiers (mangues, avocats, oranges, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise, améliorer sa maison d’habitation et vivre paisiblement en paix avec ses enfants et ses  petits fils. La cliente Nyirarudodo  A.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe « La Vérité » est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en: Nyirarudodo  A. is an entrepreneur and leader of the group La Vérité (Truth).  She is 52 years old and has three children who all live on their own.  Her husband is unemployed. Nyirarudodo  A. sells fruits such as mangoes, avocados and oranges. She makes a living from this business. She has been in this business for a long time. She has just completed four rounds of loans with the micro-finance institution (MFI) Hekima which increased her capital. She will purchase an inventory of new fruits such as mangoes, avocados and oranges with the new loan.  Moreover, she hopes to make her business stable in the long term, make some home improvements and live peacefully with her children and grandchildren. Nyirarudodo  A. thanks the MFI Hekima for their committed work with poor women excluded from the traditional banking sector. The group La Vérité has 35 members.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, avocados, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata  es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Honorata se dedica la preparación y venta D. comida, se inició hace 7 años, para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. la casa y le va bien. Honorata vive en el distrito D. Socos y los sábados y domingos se levanta temprano para viajar a Ayacucho. En el mercado Nery García Zarate, tiene un puesto donD. venD. comidas como: Mondongo, Puca picante, Cau cau, Lomo Saltado, Garbanzo, Pallar.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D.: arroz, fideos, azúcar, entre otros para la preparación D. alimentos. Los demás días D. la semana se dedica a la agricultura siembra cereales.
Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque pueD. acceder a los créditos y pueD. ahorrar ya que en la casa no se pueD. lo que ahorro en lo ciclos anteriores lo invirtió en su negocio.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children.

Honorata prepares and sells food. She started her business seven years ago so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and is now doing well. Honorata lives in the District of Socos and wakes up early on Saturdays and Sundays so that she can travel to Ayacucho. At the Nery García Zarate Market, she has a stand where she sells food such as tripe stew, “puca picante” (a dish consisting of pork, roasted potatoes, peanuts, and peppers), “cau cau” (beef tripe and potatoes), marinated steak and potatoes, chickpeas, and butter beans.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. On the other days of the week, she engages in farm work by growing grains. Honorata enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to access loans and accumulate savings. Since she already has a home, she did not set asiD. savings in previous cycles so that she could invest in her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak S. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. Chak S. is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. Chak S. is married to Phin Pei, age 56. This couple, who work together in the farming business are blessed with four children, two of whom are employed in different jobs to earn a profit. The remaining two are students who attend the local school. In order to earn extra income, Chak S. will be using the loan to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes. She hopes to use the remaining cash to pay the arrangement fees of her child to go to work overseas.

loans.use: to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

Josephine  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 56-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a teacher and her youngest one is a student. She operates a hat trading business out of a rented booth at a trading center. She started her business in 2001. Now she sells a variety of imported hats of all ages. She imports her goods once a month from China. She is very good at picking modern and stylish hats for her business. Therefore her goods are well-known among her customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to buy more hats to increase my business sales." She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories.

loans.use: To purchase more hat inventory.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 36 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. He earns about Php 30,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Domingo grows corn and has been doing it for 15 years. Domingo is asking for a loan of Php 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Domingo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is married with 5 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Veneranda hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Fasokounawolo II est constitué de  10 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOURANI, qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Fasokounawolo II is made up of 10 women, all of whom are married, are on average 35 years old, have on average two children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Koba, one of the villages in the Massigui commune, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali.

They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal to better organize their businesses for the start of winter. They grow, among other things, millet, rice, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Kourani, who is the first one standing on the right, plans to buy the ingredients and small tools and pay for labor to maintain .7 hectares of millet and peanuts. The crops are sold in the city of Massigui after harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees making a profit of about 40,000 FCFA at the end of the year.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and small tools

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 69-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to university. 

He has operated a retail shop for 20 years now, and his main constraint is inadequate capital to invest in his shop. But his dream is to own a wholesale shop and also buy a motorcycle for transport business so as to increase on his daily income. He intends to get a hired driver to ride the motorcycle, who will remit to Edward 80% of the daily earning.

Edward needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Zainab.  She is a widow and has 3 children aged 7, 10 and 14 years who are school-going children. In 2002, Zainab established her textiles business.  She learnt from her mother after dropping out of school how to do business. Her business assisted her before and after she got married to her late husband. 

She earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy  different types of clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to open a larger shop and also see her children through their education. 

Zainab serves customers around Makeni City and the surrounding villages.  She offers quality materials; that’s why her business is popular.  Zainab travels by public transport to Guinea Conakry once a month and Freetown twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for different types of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
At her flourishing food stall in Ntungamo market, 49-year-old Mary sells food items such as beans, millet, and maize. Mary is an enterprising business woman who has been running her business for the past 6 years. The food items she sells are highly-favored staple foods on most food markets and at homes in Ntungamo and most parts of Western Uganda.

Mary is an exception to the rule. Notwithstanding the fact that she is divorced, she has showed fortitude in the face of hardship. It is a trait which is a rarity in most Ugandan women. She says that the odds were stacked against her but due to her strong resolve, she was not fazed. Her approach was to work assiduously to better her own welfare and that of her family. The entry into her business, just like any other business, was formidable but she remained firm in the face of the hurdles she encountered.

In many ways, affirmative action programs have been invaluable to her, just like they have been to many women entrepreneurs all across Uganda. Farming is the second string to her bow and, needless to say, her farms provide all the food items she sells after harvesting.
Mary says that her monthly sales income totals up to Uganda shillings 800,000. Mary is going to use this Kiva loan to pay school fees for her kids and for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids and for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Faa Yaa Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam est la représentante du groupe FAA YAA WENDE. Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle fait la coiffure depuis 15ans et s’est fait représenter sur la photo par la trésorière qui vend des draps. L’argent va servir pour la coiffure. Elle s’approvisionnement dans les différents marchés. Ses clients sont les femmes et les filles.

Elle veut s’acheter des mèches, des produits de beauté, des casques et des lave-tête.

Mme économise pour de la famille. Elle ambitionne de bonne choses pour son affaire et pour la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the FAA YAA WENDE group. She is the single mother of 2 children aged 11 and 5, both of whom go to school, and she is responsible for the upkeep of 5 dependents in total. Mariam has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She is represented in the picture by the group's treasurer, who sells sheets.
The loan will be used to fund her hairdressing business, which caters to girls and women. She gets her supplies from various markets and needs to restock on hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins. Mariam is saving up for her household and has big ambitions for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
В этот раз Роман изъявил желание воспользоваться кредитом, так как предвидел рост цен и решил закупить товар заранее, по более низкой цене. На кредитные средства Роман приобрел муку, сахар, соль, макароны, майонез, консервы рыбные, чай кофе и др. продукты для реализации.

За счет предыдущего кредита Роман смог расширить ассортимент своей продукции и увеличить прибыль. Роман ценит полученные кредиты и считает недопустимым опаздывать с выплатами даже на один день.
texts.en: This time, Roman expressed his desire to obtain a loan because he had anticipated an increase in prices and decided to purchase merchandise in advance, at lower prices.  He used the funds from the loan to purchase flour, sugar, salt, pasta, mayonnaise, canned fish, tea, coffee and other products for sale.  Using the previous loan, Roman was able to expand the assortment of his products and increase his profits.  Roman values the loans he obtained and considers it unacceptable to be late on payments even by one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories at low prices

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Charlyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like adobo, caldereta and afritada. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Charlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old and married, with two sons. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Thu has been making stuffed animals for 12 years. She receives the materials from toy dealers and makes the stuffed toys at her house. 

Thu would like to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys.

loans.name: Leemu

texts.en: Leemu, a single 30-year-old high school graduate living in Congo Town, has two children aged 3 months and 12 years, the latter of whom attends school. For the past ten years Leemu has been involved in local soap-making, and is now requesting a loan to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her business. She hopes to buy land and build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her soap-making business.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 48 years old. Warlito is married and is a loving father of four children. He lives in Namnama village, in the Isabela area, with his wife, his children, his parents, and his brother. 

He is a responsible and goal-oriented person. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Warlito primarily grows corn. He wants to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest. He also needs money to pay for his employees' work. This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 25,000. Warlito thanks all creditors, who will support him.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and mechanic.

Jeneth is a food vendor. She sells cooked meals and local delicacies. Jeneth also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to support her family.

Jeneth has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers. She hopes for her business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a twenty nine year old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. He has been running a retail shop for a period of one year. He started the shop with the savings he had acquired from cotton farming. The major challenges he is experiencing are: price fluctuation and inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. None the less, he has a goal of diversifying his business and expanding into new markets.

Godfrey needs a loan to buy a weighing machine and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jocelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yason

texts.en:
Yason is 49 years old and married to Hellen. They have seven children.

He has been in this business for the last three years and from it he earns a monthly income of Kenyan shillings 40,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Kenyan Shilngs 15,000.  He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by  a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more sewing machines and  textile materials.  His dream is to expand and open more tailoring shops.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and textile materials.

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol is 51 years old and lives with her 4 children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. Since her husband died 5 years ago, she became the only person taking care of and earning money for the family. Her daughter is now employed and independent. Chimedtsogzol has been selling dairy products in a market regularly since 2000, both in the neighboring province and in the capital city. Since her income is not enough to support the family, she would like to increase her variety, sales and income and extend her business further.

Chimedtsogzol is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, 'I'd love to extend my business based on my 12 years of experience in order to help my family financially."' The total amount she is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT to purchase dairy products such as milk, dried curds, curds, etc. from herders,

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es: María Gladys de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia; ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas,  el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona muy apta para el desarrollo y crecimiento de la siembra y está cercano a su residencia; comercia en todas las zonas aledañas  y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los precios bajos  y sobre todo por el buen servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar sus sueños;  quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. María Gladys tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable sabe que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida mejor

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida etc

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 12 años en la venta de limones y escogió esta actividad debido a que se compró un vehículo para transporte y con el cual también realiza fletes.  Trabaja todos los días, desde muy temprano en la mañana.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 2 hijos, una hija de 10 años quien va a la escuela fiscal del sector y el otro de 11 meses de edad.  Su sueño a futuro es poder ver crecer a sus hijos y que tengan una profesión.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de limones para su comercialización.
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Portoviejo.   He’s been selling lemons for 12 years and chose this activity because he bought a vehicle for transport that he also uses to make deliveries.  He works every day starting very early in the morning.  He’s in a common law relationship and his wife’s a housewife.  He has two children, a 10-year-old daughter attending public school and an 11-month-old son.  His future dream is to watch his children grow and that they have professions.  For now, he needs the loan to buy lemons to sell.

loans.use: to buy lemons.

loans.name: Saiq

texts.en:
Saiq, 45, sells men's and women's clothes in the central bazaar of Imishli. He has seven years of experience in this field. 

He is married and has two children.  

Saiq`s father helps him run the business.  His monthly income is 230 AZN.  Clothes he sells are very popular and in high demand.  Saiq would like to increase his sales and meet his customers needs. 

For this purpose, he applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more seasonal clothes, to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a 27 year old young man who is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is engaged and will get married soon and for this occasion he needs to purchase new bedroom furniture. Ameen has an amount of money which is not enough to pay the full amount, so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,500 from FATEN. When Ameen gets the loan, he will purchase new bedroom furniture. This enable him to prepare well for his wedding and let he and his wive live in better conditions. Ameen is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom for his wedding.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en: Nehad is a 28-year-old young man. He is married with two sons and one daughter. He is a taxi driver with a decent salary. Nehad wants to make some repairs to his taxi, such as replacing the engine and changing the tires and windows, but he hasn't enough money to pay for them. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nehad gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the taxi repairs, which will increase the taxi's efficiency, allow Nehad to work extra hours, and enable him to accommodate more special requests from his customers. Nehad is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 39 year old man and married with two sons and two daughters.

He is a taxi driver and earns a decent salary.  Mohammad wants to pay for proper licensing and make some repairs to his taxi, like painting, changing doors and tires, etc.  But he cannot afford the cost.  So he needs to take a loan in the amount of 3,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad gets the loan and increases his income, he will be able to offer a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay for proper licensing and making some repairs to his taxi, painting, changing doors and tires, etc.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Don Rolando de 41 años de edad, Originario de Pueblo Nuevo, casado, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, el es comerciante, se dedica al a venta de carne y pollo puso su negocio hace tres años, con capital propio. Ya que el estudio administración de empresas pero la escasez de trabajo  lo motivo  empezar  poner su propio negocio y ejercer lo que aprendió y sacar adelante a su familia.  El requiere el préstamo para compra de pollo, carne y granos básicos. Pues se acerca la temporada navideña y sus clientes le hacen mas demanda de estos productos. El tiene proyectado poner otros puesto de venta de pollo y carne, comprar un nuevo freezer para almacenar sus productos, ya que su idea de expandir su negocio.
texts.en: Rolando is 41 years old and is a native of Pueblo Nuevo.  He is married and has an 11 year-old child.  He works in retail trade, selling meat and chicken.  He started his business 3 years ago with his own capital.  He was motivated to start his own business because he had studied business administration, but due to the lack of jobs this was the only way that he could use his education and provide for his family.  He needs a loan to buy chicken, meat and staple grains, as the Christmas season is approaching and his customers will be increasing their demand for these products. He has plans to expand his business by setting up another stand where he can sell chicken and meat and purchasing a new freezer to store his products.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and staple grains

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Davaajav, 27, is a serviceman, and he has been working for five years at a private auto service business. He lives with his wife and does not have any children yet. Davaajav is a very hard-working and sensible businessman. He plans to build an apartment complex in the district near the colleges and rent the units to students or other people who need housing. Over the last several years, there has been a lot of population growth in the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Therefore, he needs to increase his income in order to have capital for his new business. Davaajav plans to start a taxi business to supplement the income from his current job by working at night and on his day off, but he does not have the money to purchase a car. He needs over MNT 3,000,000 to cover the cost of purchasing a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Mo'ammar

texts.en:
Mo'ammar is a 28-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and three daughters. He is a taxi driver who earns a low income. Mo'ammar wants to make some necessary repairs to his taxi such as painting, changing the engine, changing the doors, etc. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Mo'ammar gets the loan, he will pay the expenses for making repairs to his taxi. This will improve the taxi conditions and enable Mo'ammar to work extra hours and take more requests. This will allow him to increase his income and create better living conditions for his family. Mo'ammar is photographed next to his taxi.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see for the fund-raising includes both the principal loan and the loan-servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 40-year-old man, and a father of 4 sons and daughters.

Adel started his own business 7 years ago selling sanitary napkins and tools, and through these years he has been able to expand the shop space and add a few more products such as cosmetics to sell in his store. Now he has applied for a loan to enhance the products that he sells in the store by bringing in better quality cosmetics and perfumes too.

loans.use: To add more cosmetics and perfumes to his inventory

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru: Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Amil 50 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Uje 7 let kak on rabotayet taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy bil toje taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi klupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini. Yego deti uchatsya v kolledje.
texts.en: Amil is an international displaced person and a refuge from the city of Fuzuli. He now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Amil is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. His children are attending college. For the last seven years he has been working as a taxi driver. He has inherited this business from his father who was also a taxi driver. Currently Amil needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts

loans.name: Vazirkhan

texts.en: Vazirkhan is a 54-year-old man who is married and has five children. He has been running his business for the past eight years, and he earns about 250 AZN per month. Vazirkhan sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar. He plans to use this loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to invest in his business. Vazirkhan hopes to invest in the purchase of additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. His goal is to expand his business and provide a prosperous lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and young crops.

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en: Balakhan is married and lives with his wife and four children in Agsu, a province of Azerbaijan. His wife does the household chores and takes care of their children. In 2005, Balakhan decided to open a home goods store. When he started operating his business, he had much less working capital than he does now, after years of successful operation. Balakhan's trading business has grown thanks to his first loan with AqroInvest in 2010. He has a good loan history. Nowadays his monthly income is around 250 AZN. After successfully repaying his previous loans, he has requested a fourth loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to provide working capital to purchase more merchandise. Balakhan and his family are very thankful to AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: İlkin

texts.en: Ilkin is a 31-year-old man living in Agsu with his family. He is blessed with two children. Ilkin's wife takes care of the children and helps him with his business. He has an established grocery store, which he has run for the last eight years. The business is the only source of income for the young family. Ilkin is a diligent man who has plans and dreams for the future. With the help of AqroInvest and Kiva, he has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to increase his inventory and enlarge the store. This is his second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Shahlar

texts.en:
Shahlar is a 54 year-old father of four children.  He is a strong, hard-working man with a healthy appetite for learning and big plans for the future. 

Over the past six years, he has gained experience selling various items such as souvenirs, school bags, toys, etc.  

Shahlar has been a member of the AqroInvest credit Union since 2010.  This is his second loan from AqroInvest and the loans help him stock his small general store where he works all day. 

With this loan, in amount of 1500 AZN, he will stock his store with various items. Thanks to the loans he continues to increase his sales.

loans.use: to stock store with various items.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a 32-year-old trader who sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Elshan is married and has a son. He started his business in 2008 and since that time he has gained respect among the local people. The demand for foodstuffs is very high and he is not able to meet it. He needs to buy additional food products to increase his income. That is why he requested his second loan from AqroInvest. Elshan plans to use the loan of 1500 AZN to expand his inventory.

loans.use: to expand inventory

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en: Ceyhun is a 26-year-old man who lives in the city of Agsu. He is single and lives with his parents. Ceyhun is an owner of a food-stuffs store. His father helps him in his business. This is the first loan Ceyhun received from Aqroinvest and Kiva. Ceyhun used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy more goods to sell in his store to increase sales. His business is the only source of income for his family. Ceyhun plans to open another store in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for store

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a 56-year-old man. He is married and has two sons. Malik has owned and managed a grocery store for the last ten years. His store is located at the front of his house, and his wife actively helps him in his trading business. They are very hard-working people. By expanding the business he will be able to improve his family's quality of life. Malik feels happy because this is his fourth loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. He has requested a loan in the amount of 1800 AZN to renovate his store and expand his inventory.

loans.use: to renovate his store and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Agamir

texts.en: Agamir is a 34-year-old man, who lives with his family in a small settlement in Agsu. He has a son who is 13 years old. Agamir decided to start his own business in 2007 and since that time has done well. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase stock for his store. Agamir sells fruits and vegetables. He dreams to increase the family income which now is only 250 AZN per month. Agamir is a diligent man, who after repaying this loan, plans to open a new store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en: Shahid is from Agsu city. He is a 55-year-old married man and is blessed with two sons. Shahid's main goal is to provide a better life for his family. His wife helps him with it. They are a very diligent family. To make a better living, in 2006 Shahid opened an electrical goods store. After the first loan taken out from AqroInvest and Kiva in 2009, the income of the family increased up to 400 AZN per month. Shahid is very thankful for the support given to him. With the help of this fifth loan in the amount of 1800 AZN, Shahid purchased stock for his store. After he repays this loan, he plans to apply for more loans to grow his business and to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his electrical goods store

loans.name: Mutallim

texts.en:
Mutallim is a 53 year-old married man with two children. He is from Agsu. Mutallim and operates a gardening business to earn his living. He's been in this line of work for 18 years and he earns about 260 AZN a month. 

He requested a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

This is his first loan from AqroInvest.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is a hard-working, entrepreneur from Agsu city.  Ten years ago he decided to open a small grocery sales business.  Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand. 

Nadir has requested a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase additional foodstuff for his grocery.  He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers.

Nadir is married and has two sons.  One of his goals for his business is to help his children all he can.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuff.

loans.name: Cristobal Alfides

texts.es:
El señor Cristóbal tiene 58 años de edad, es casado con cinco hijos, pero solo uno vive con él.   

Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como albañil, ya tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, fueron unos amigos quienes le enseñaron. Además él junto con su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos desde hace 6 años. Su inventario es de 10 docenas de platos pachos, 5 docenas de platos soperos, 10 docenas de huacales de diferentes tamaños, 2 docenas de mascones para lavar platos, 1 docena de coladores de aluminio, 2 docenas de toallas para usar en la cocina y 2 docenas de manteles.

Esta mercancía las compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, que se encuentra a 27 kilómetros de la ciudad donde vive él, ahí encuentra los plásticos a mejor precio. Cristóbal solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar 1 docena de rayadores plásticos, 6 docenas de escobas, 6 docenas de mascones de alambre, 6 docenas de coladores, 6 docenas de cucharones de teflón, 6 docenas de cubiertos, 6 docenas de platos de zinc, 6 docenas de cantaros, 20 botellas y cambiarle las llantas a su vehiculo y hacerle otras arreglos.

 De esta manera Cristóbal, incrementara su inventario y diversificara sus productos, por lo que ofrecerá más a sus clientes y satisfará la demanda existente, además que tendrá su vehiculo en buen estado.

De los ingresos que reciba, producto de la venta en su negocio, tiene pensado ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir una casa, ya que donde viven es alquilada.
texts.en:
Cristobal, 58, is married with 5 children, but only one lives with him. He has worked as a mason for more than 30 years, and learned the trade from some friends. Together with his wife, he also opened a business 6 years ago selling plastic goods. His inventory is 10 dozen flat-brimmed plates, 5 dozen soup bowls, 10 dozen crates of various sizes, 2 dozen steel wool sponges for washing dishes, 1 dozen aluminum colanders, 2 dozen kitchen towels and 2 dozen tablecloths.
